<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> autism is one of the five pervasive developmental disorders ( pdd ) , which are characterized by widespread abnormalities of social interactions and communication , and severely restricted interests and highly repetitive behavior . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> these symptoms do not imply sickness , fragility , or emotional disturbance . <end>
<pad> <pad> <start> of the five pdd forms , asperger syndrome is closest to autism in signs and likely causes rett syndrome and childhood disintegrative disorder share several signs with autism , but may have unrelated causes pdd not otherwise specified ( pdd nos also called atypical autism ) is diagnosed when the criteria are not met for a more specific disorder . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> unlike with autism , people with asperger syndrome have no substantial delay in language development . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> the terminology of autism can be bewildering , with autism , asperger syndrome and pdd nos often called the autism spectrum disorders ( asd ) or sometimes the autistic disorders , whereas autism itself is often called autistic disorder , childhood autism , or infantile autism . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> in this article , autism refers to the classic autistic disorder in clinical practice , though , autism , asd , and pdd are often used interchangeably . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> asd , in turn , is a subset of the broader autism phenotype , which describes individuals who may not have asd but do have autistic like traits , such as avoiding eye contact . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> the manifestations of autism cover a wide spectrum , ranging from individuals with severe impairments who may be silent , developmentally disabled , and locked into hand flapping and rocking to high functioning individuals who may have active but distinctly odd social approaches , narrowly focused interests , and verbose , pedantic communication . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> because the behavior spectrum is continuous , boundaries between diagnostic categories are necessarily somewhat arbitrary . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> sometimes the syndrome is divided into low , medium or high functioning autism ( lfa , mfa , and hfa ) , based on iq thresholds , or on how much support the individual requires in daily life these subdivisions are not standardized and are controversial . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> autism can also be divided into syndromal and non syndromal autism the syndromal autism is associated with severe or profound intellectual disability or a congenital syndrome with physical symptoms , such as tuberous sclerosis . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> although individuals with asperger syndrome tend to perform better cognitively than those with autism , the extent of the overlap between asperger syndrome , hfa , and non syndromal autism is unclear . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> some studies have reported diagnoses of autism in children due to a loss of language or social skills , as opposed to a failure to make progress , typically from 15 to 30 months of age . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> the validity of this distinction remains controversial it is possible that regressive autism is a specific subtype , or that there is a continuum of behaviors between autism with and without regression . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> research into causes has been hampered by the inability to identify biologically meaningful subgroups within the autistic population and by the traditional boundaries between the disciplines of psychiatry , psychology , neurology and pediatrics . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <start> newer technologies such as fmri and diffusion tensor imaging can help identify biologically relevant phenotypes ( observable traits ) that can be viewed on brain scans , to help further neurogenetic studies of autism one example is lowered activity in the fusiform face area of the brain , which is associated with impaired perception of people versus objects . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> it has been proposed to classify autism using genetics as well as behavior . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> about half of parents of children with asd notice their child s unusual behaviors by age 18 months , and about four fifths notice by age 24 months . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> according to an article , failure to meet any of the following milestones is an absolute indication to proceed with further evaluations . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> delay in referral for such testing may delay early diagnosis and treatment and affect the long term outcome . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> the united states preventive services task force in 2016 found it was unclear if screening was beneficial or harmful among children in whom there is no concerns . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> the japanese practice is to screen all children for asd at 18 and 24 months , using autism specific formal screening tests . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> in contrast , in the uk , children whose families or doctors recognize possible signs of autism are screened . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> it is not known which approach is more effective . <end>
<start> screening tools include the modified checklist for autism in toddlers ( m chat ) , the early screening of autistic traits questionnaire , and the first year inventory initial data on m chat and its predecessor , the checklist for autism in toddlers ( chat ) , on children aged 18 30 months suggests that it is best used in a clinical setting
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> it may be more accurate to precede these tests with a broadband screener that does not distinguish asd from other developmental disorders . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> screening tools designed for one culture s norms for behaviors like eye contact may be inappropriate for a different culture . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> although genetic screening for autism is generally still impractical , it can be considered in some cases , such as children with neurological symptoms and dysmorphic features . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> while infection with rubella during pregnancy causes fewer than 1 of cases of autism , vaccination against rubella can prevent many of those cases . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> the main goals when treating children with autism are to lessen associated deficits and family distress , and to increase quality of life and functional independence . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> in general , higher iqs are correlated with greater responsiveness to treatment and improved treatment outcomes . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> no single treatment is best and treatment is typically tailored to the child s needs . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> families and the educational system are the main resources for treatment . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> services should be carried out by behavior analysts , special education teachers , speech pathologists , and licensed psychologists . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> studies of interventions have methodological problems that prevent definitive conclusions about efficacy . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> however , the development of evidence based interventions has advanced in recent years . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> although many psychosocial interventions have some positive evidence , suggesting that some form of treatment is preferable to no treatment , the methodological quality of systematic reviews of these studies has generally been poor , their clinical results are mostly tentative , and there is little evidence for the relative effectiveness of treatment options . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> intensive , sustained special education programs and behavior therapy early in life can help children acquire self care , communication , and job skills , and often improve functioning and decrease symptom severity and maladaptive behaviors claims that intervention by around age three years is crucial are not substantiated . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> while medications have not been found to help with core symptoms , they may be used for associated symptoms , such as irritability , inattention , or repetitive behavior patterns . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> educational interventions often used include applied behavior analysis ( aba ) , developmental models , structured teaching , speech and language therapy , social skills therapy , and occupational therapy . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> among these approaches , interventions either treat autistic features comprehensively , or focalize treatment on a specific area of deficit . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> the quality of research for early intensive behavioral intervention ( eibi ) a treatment procedure incorporating over thirty hours per week of the structured type of aba that is carried out with very young children is currently low , and more vigorous research designs with larger sample sizes are needed . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> two theoretical frameworks outlined for early childhood intervention include structured and naturalistic aba interventions , and developmental social pragmatic models ( dsp ) . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> one interventional strategy utilizes a parent training model , which teaches parents how to implement various aba and dsp techniques , allowing for parents to disseminate interventions themselves . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> various dsp programs have been developed to explicitly deliver intervention systems through at home parent implementation . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> despite the recent development of parent training models , these interventions have demonstrated effectiveness in numerous studies , being evaluated as a probable efficacious mode of treatment . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> early , intensive aba therapy has demonstrated effectiveness in enhancing communication , as well as adaptive and global functioning in preschool children it is well established for improving the intellectual performance of that age group . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> similarly , a teacher implemented intervention that utilizes a more naturalistic form of aba combined with a developmental social pragmatic approach has been found to be beneficial in improving social communication skills in young children , although there is less evidence in its treatment of global symptoms . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> neuropsychological reports are often poorly communicated to educators , resulting in a gap between what a report recommends and what education is provided . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> it is not known whether treatment programs for children lead to significant improvements after the children grow up , and the limited research on the effectiveness of adult residential programs shows mixed results . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> the appropriateness of including children with varying severity of autism spectrum disorders in the general education population is a subject of current debate among educators and researchers . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> medications may be used to treat asd symptoms that interfere with integrating a child into home or school when behavioral treatment fails . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> they may also be used for associated health problems , such as adhd or anxiety . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> more than half of us children diagnosed with asd are prescribed psychoactive drugs or anticonvulsants , with the most common drug classes being antidepressants , stimulants , and antipsychotics . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> the atypical antipsychotic drugs risperidone and aripiprazole are fda approved for treating associated aggressive and self injurious behaviors . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> however , their side effects must be weighed against their potential benefits , and people with autism may respond atypically . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> side effects , for example , may include weight gain , tiredness , drooling , and aggression . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> ssri antidepressants , such as fluoxetine and fluvoxamine , have been shown to be effective in reducing repetitive and ritualistic behaviors , while the stimulant medication methylphenidate is beneficial for some children with co morbid inattentiveness or hyperactivity . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> there is scant reliable research about the effectiveness or safety of drug treatments for adolescents and adults with asd . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> no known medication relieves autism s core symptoms of social and communication impairments . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> experiments in mice have reversed or reduced some symptoms related to autism by replacing or modulating gene function , suggesting the possibility of targeting therapies to specific rare mutations known to cause autism . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> although many alternative therapies and interventions are available , few are supported by scientific studies . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> treatment approaches have little empirical support in quality of life contexts , and many programs focus on success measures that lack predictive validity and real world relevance . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> some alternative treatments may place the child at risk . <end>
<pad> <pad> <start> the preference that children with autism have for unconventional foods can lead to reduction in bone cortical thickness with this being greater in those on casein free diets , as a consequence of the low intake of calcium and vitamin d however , suboptimal bone development in asd has also been associated with lack of exercise and gastrointestinal disorders . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> in 2005 , botched chelation therapy killed a five year old child with autism . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> chelation is not recommended for people with asd since the associated risks outweigh any potential benefits . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> another alternative medicine practice with no evidence is cease therapy , a mixture of homeopathy , supplements , and vaccine detoxing . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> although popularly used as an alternative treatment for people with autism , as of 2018 there is no good evidence to recommend a gluten and casein free diet as a standard treatment . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> a 2018 review concluded that it may be a therapeutic option for specific groups of children with autism , such as those with known food intolerances or allergies , or with food intolerance markers . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> the authors analyzed the prospective trials conducted to date that studied the efficacy of the gluten and casein free diet in children with asd ( 4 in total ) . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> all of them compared gluten and casein free diet versus normal diet with a control group ( 2 double blind randomized controlled trials , 1 double blind crossover trial , 1 single blind trial ) . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> in two of the studies , whose duration was 12 and 24 months , a significant improvement in asd symptoms ( efficacy rate 50 ) was identified . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> in the other two studies , whose duration was 3 months , no significant effect was observed . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> the authors concluded that a longer duration of the diet may be necessary to achieve the improvement of the asd symptoms . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> other problems documented in the trials carried out include transgressions of the diet , small sample size , the heterogeneity of the participants and the possibility of a placebo effect . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> in the subset of people who have gluten sensitivity there is limited evidence that suggests that a gluten free diet may improve some autistic behaviors . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> there is tentative evidence that music therapy may improve social interactions , verbal communication , and non verbal communication skills . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> there has been early research looking at hyperbaric treatments in children with autism . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> there is no known cure . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> children recover occasionally , so that they lose their diagnosis of asd this occurs sometimes after intensive treatment and sometimes not . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> it is not known how often recovery happens reported rates in unselected samples have ranged from 3 to 25 . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> most children with autism acquire language by age five or younger , though a few have developed communication skills in later years . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> most children with autism lack social support , meaningful relationships , future employment opportunities or self determination . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> although core difficulties tend to persist , symptoms often become less severe with age . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> few high quality studies address long term prognosis . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> some adults show modest improvement in communication skills , but a few decline no study has focused on autism after midlife . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> acquiring language before age six , having an iq above 50 , and having a marketable skill all predict better outcomes independent living is unlikely with severe autism . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> many individuals with autism face significant obstacles in transitioning to adulthood . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> compared to the general population individuals with autism are more likely to be unemployed and to have never had a job . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> about half of people in their 20s with autism are not employed . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> most recent reviews tend to estimate a prevalence of 1 2 per 1 , 000 for autism and close to 6 per 1 , 000 for asd , and 11 per 1 , 000 children in the united states for asd as of 2008 because of inadequate data , these numbers may underestimate asd s true rate . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> globally , autism affects an estimated 24 . 8 million people , while asperger syndrome affects a further 37 . 2 million . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> in 2012 , the nhs estimated that the overall prevalence of autism among adults aged 18 years and over in the uk was 1 . 1 . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> rates of pdd nos s has been estimated at 3 . 7 per 1 , 000 , asperger syndrome at roughly 0 . 6 per 1 , 000 , and childhood disintegrative disorder at 0 . 02 per 1 , 000 . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> cdc estimates about 1 out of 59 ( 1 . 7 ) for 2014 , an increase from 1 out of every 68 children ( 1 . 5 ) for 2010 . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> the number of reported cases of autism increased dramatically in the 1990s and early 2000s . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> this increase is largely attributable to changes in diagnostic practices , referral patterns , availability of services , age at diagnosis , and public awareness , though unidentified environmental risk factors cannot be ruled out . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> the available evidence does not rule out the possibility that autism s true prevalence has increased a real increase would suggest directing more attention and funding toward changing environmental factors instead of continuing to focus on genetics . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> boys are at higher risk for asd than girls . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> the sex ratio averages 4 . 3 1 and is greatly modified by cognitive impairment <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> it may be close to 2 1 with intellectual disability and more than 5 . 5 1 without . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> several theories about the higher prevalence in males have been investigated , but the cause of the difference is unconfirmed one theory is that females are underdiagnosed . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> although the evidence does not implicate any single pregnancy related risk factor as a cause of autism , the risk of autism is associated with advanced age in either parent , and with diabetes , bleeding , and use of psychiatric drugs in the mother during pregnancy . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> the risk is greater with older fathers than with older mothers two potential explanations are the known increase in mutation burden in older sperm , and the hypothesis that men marry later if they carry genetic liability and show some signs of autism . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> most professionals believe that race , ethnicity , and socioeconomic background do not affect the occurrence of autism . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> several other conditions are common in children with autism . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> they include a few examples of autistic symptoms and treatments were described long before autism was named . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> the table talk of martin luther , compiled by his notetaker , mathesius , contains the story of a 12 year old boy who may have been severely autistic . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> luther reportedly thought the boy was a soulless mass of flesh possessed by the devil , and suggested that he be suffocated , although a later critic has cast doubt on the veracity of this report . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> the earliest well documented case of autism is that of hugh blair of borgue , as detailed in a 1747 court case in which his brother successfully petitioned to annul blair s marriage to gain blair s inheritance . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> the wild boy of aveyron , a feral child caught in 1798 , showed several signs of autism the medical student jean itard treated him with a behavioral program designed to help him form social attachments and to induce speech via imitation . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> the new latin word autismus ( english translation autism ) was coined by the swiss psychiatrist eugen bleuler in 1910 as he was defining symptoms of schizophrenia . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> he derived it from the greek word autos ( , meaning self ) , and used it to mean morbid self admiration , referring to autistic withdrawal of the patient to his fantasies , against which any influence from outside becomes an intolerable disturbance . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> a soviet child psychiatrist , grunya sukhareva , described a similar syndrome that was published in russian in 1925 , and in german in 1926 . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> the word autism first took its modern sense in 1938 when hans asperger of the vienna university hospital adopted bleuler s terminology autistic psychopaths in a lecture in german about child psychology . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> asperger was investigating an asd now known as asperger syndrome , though for various reasons it was not widely recognized as a separate diagnosis until 1981 . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> leo kanner of the johns hopkins hospital first used autism in its modern sense in english when he introduced the label early infantile autism in a 1943 report of 11 children with striking behavioral similarities . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> almost all the characteristics described in kanner s first paper on the subject , notably autistic aloneness and insistence on sameness , are still regarded as typical of the autistic spectrum of disorders . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> it is not known whether kanner derived the term independently of asperger . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> donald triplett was the first person diagnosed with autism . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> he was diagnosed by kanner after being first examined in 1938 , and was labeled as case 1 . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> triplett was noted for his savant abilities , particularly being able to name musical notes played on a piano and to mentally multiply numbers . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> his father , oliver , described him as socially withdrawn but interested in number patterns , music notes , letters of the alphabet , and u . s . president pictures . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> by the age of 2 , he had the ability to recite the 23rd psalm and memorized 25 questions and answers from the presbyterian catechism . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> he was also interested in creating musical chords . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> kanner s reuse of autism led to decades of confused terminology like infantile schizophrenia , and child psychiatry s focus on maternal deprivation led to misconceptions of autism as an infant s response to refrigerator mothers . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> starting in the late 1960s autism was established as a separate syndrome . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> as late as the mid 1970s there was little evidence of a genetic role in autism while in 2007 it was believed to be one of the most heritable psychiatric conditions . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> although the rise of parent organizations and the destigmatization of childhood asd have affected how asd is viewed , parents continue to feel social stigma in situations where their child s autistic behavior is perceived negatively , and many primary care physicians and medical specialists express some beliefs consistent with outdated autism research . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> it took until 1980 for the dsm iii to differentiate autism from childhood schizophrenia . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> in 1987 , the dsm iii r provided a checklist for diagnosing autism . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> in may 2013 , the dsm 5 was released , updating the classification for pervasive developmental disorders . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> the grouping of disorders , including pdd nos , autism , asperger syndrome , rett syndrome , and cdd , has been removed and replaced with the general term of autism spectrum disorders . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> the two categories that exist are impaired social communication and or interaction , and restricted and or repetitive behaviors . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> the internet has helped autistic individuals bypass nonverbal cues and emotional sharing that they find difficult to deal with , and has given them a way to form online communities and work remotely . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> societal and cultural aspects of autism have developed some in the community seek a cure , while others believe that autism is simply another way of being . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> an autistic culture has emerged , accompanied by the autistic rights and neurodiversity movements . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> events include world autism awareness day , autism sunday , autistic pride day , autreat , and others . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> organizations dedicated to promoting awareness of autism include autism speaks , autism national committee , and autism society of america . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> social science scholars study those with autism in hopes to learn more about autism as a culture , transcultural comparisons . . . and research on social movements . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> while most autistic individuals do not have savant skills , many have been successful in their fields . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> the autism rights movement is a social movement within the context of disability rights that emphasizes the concept of neurodiversity , viewing the autism spectrum as a result of natural variations in the human brain rather than a disorder to be cured . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> the autism rights movement advocates for including greater acceptance of autistic behaviors therapies that focus on coping skills rather than imitating the behaviors those without autism and the recognition of the autistic community as a minority group . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> autism rights or neurodiversity advocates believe that the autism spectrum is genetic and should be accepted as a natural expression of the human genome . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> this perspective is distinct from two other likewise distinct views the medical perspective , that autism is caused by a genetic defect and should be addressed by targeting the autism gene ( s ) , and fringe theories that autism is caused by environmental factors such as vaccines . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> a common criticism against autistic activists is that the majority of them are high functioning or have asperger syndrome and do not represent the views of low functioning autistic people . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> about half of autistics are unemployed , and one third of those with graduate degrees may be unemployed . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> among autistics who find work , most are employed in sheltered settings working for wages below the national minimum . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> while employers state hiring concerns about productivity and supervision , experienced employers of autistics give positive reports of above average memory and detail orientation as well as a high regard for rules and procedure in autistic employees . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> a majority of the economic burden of autism if caused by decreased earnings in the job market . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> some studies also find decreased earning among parents who care for autistic children . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> books on autism for parents caregivers of pre school children <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> albedo albedo ( ) ( , meaning whiteness ) is the measure of the diffuse reflection of solar radiation out of the total solar radiation received by an astronomical body ( e . g . a planet like earth ) . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> it is dimensionless and measured on a scale from 0 ( corresponding to a black body that absorbs all incident radiation ) to 1 ( corresponding to a body that reflects all incident radiation ) . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> surface albedo is defined as the ratio of radiosity to the irradiance ( flux per unit area ) received by a surface . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> the proportion reflected is not only determined by properties of the surface itself , but also by the spectral and angular distribution of solar radiation reaching the earth s surface . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> these factors vary with atmospheric composition , geographic location and time ( see position of the sun ) . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> while bi hemispherical reflectance is calculated for a single angle of incidence ( i . e . , for a given position of the sun ) , albedo is the directional integration of reflectance over all solar angles in a given period . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> the temporal resolution may range from seconds ( as obtained from flux measurements ) to daily , monthly , or annual averages . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> unless given for a specific wavelength ( spectral albedo ) , albedo refers to the entire spectrum of solar radiation . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> due to measurement constraints , it is often given for the spectrum in which most solar energy reaches the surface ( between 0 . 3 and 3 m ) . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> this spectrum includes visible light ( 0 . 39 0 . 7 m ) , which explains why surfaces with a low albedo appear dark ( e . g . , trees absorb most radiation ) , whereas surfaces with a high albedo appear bright ( e . g . , snow reflects most radiation ) . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> albedo is an important concept in climatology , astronomy , and environmental management ( e . g . , as part of the leadership in energy and environmental design ( leed ) program for sustainable rating of buildings ) . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> the average albedo of the earth from the upper atmosphere , its planetary albedo , is 30 35 because of cloud cover , but widely varies locally across the surface because of different geological and environmental features . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> the term albedo was introduced into optics by johann heinrich lambert in his 1760 work photometria . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> any albedo in visible light falls within a range of about 0 . 9 for fresh snow to about 0 . 04 for charcoal , one of the darkest substances . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> deeply shadowed cavities can achieve an effective albedo approaching the zero of a black body . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> when seen from a distance , the ocean surface has a low albedo , as do most forests , whereas desert areas have some of the highest albedos among landforms . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> most land areas are in an albedo range of 0 . 1 to 0 . 4 . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> the average albedo of earth is about 0 . 3 . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> this is far higher than for the ocean primarily because of the contribution of clouds . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> earth s surface albedo is regularly estimated via earth observation satellite sensors such as nasa s modis instruments on board the terra and aqua satellites , and the ceres instrument on the suomi npp and jpss . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> as the amount of reflected radiation is only measured for a single direction by satellite , not all directions , a mathematical model is used to translate a sample set of satellite reflectance measurements into estimates of directional hemispherical reflectance and bi hemispherical reflectance ( e . g . , ) . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> these calculations are based on the bidirectional reflectance distribution function ( brdf ) , which describes how the reflectance of a given surface depends on the view angle of the observer and the solar angle . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> bdrf can facilitate translations of observations of reflectance into albedo . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> earth s average surface temperature due to its albedo and the greenhouse effect is currently about 15 c . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> if earth were frozen entirely ( and hence be more reflective ) , the average temperature of the planet would drop below 40 c . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> if only the continental land masses became covered by glaciers , the mean temperature of the planet would drop to about 0 c . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> in contrast , if the entire earth was covered by water <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> a so called ocean planet <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> the average temperature on the planet would rise to almost 27 c . <end>
<start> for land surfaces , it has been shown that the albedo at a particular solar zenith angle can be approximated by the proportionate sum of two terms with formula 3 being the proportion of direct radiation from a given solar angle , and formula 4 being the proportion of diffuse illumination , the actual albedo formula 5 ( also called blue sky albedo
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> the albedos of planets , satellites and minor planets such as asteroids can be used to infer much about their properties . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> the study of albedos , their dependence on wavelength , lighting angle ( phase angle ) , and variation in time comprises a major part of the astronomical field of photometry . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> for small and far objects that cannot be resolved by telescopes , much of what we know comes from the study of their albedos . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> for example , the absolute albedo can indicate the surface ice content of outer solar system objects , the variation of albedo with phase angle gives information about regolith properties , whereas unusually high radar albedo is indicative of high metal content in asteroids . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> enceladus , a moon of saturn , has one of the highest known albedos of any body in the solar system , with 99 of em radiation reflected . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> another notable high albedo body is eris , with an albedo of 0 . 96 . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> many small objects in the outer solar system and asteroid belt have low albedos down to about 0 . 05 . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> a typical comet nucleus has an albedo of 0 . 04 . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> such a dark surface is thought to be indicative of a primitive and heavily space weathered surface containing some organic compounds . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> the overall albedo of the moon is measured to be around 0 . 136 , but it is strongly directional and non lambertian , displaying also a strong opposition effect . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> although such reflectance properties are different from those of any terrestrial terrains , they are typical of the regolith surfaces of airless solar system bodies . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> two common albedos that are used in astronomy are the ( v band ) geometric albedo ( measuring brightness when illumination comes from directly behind the observer ) and the bond albedo ( measuring total proportion of electromagnetic energy reflected ) . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> their values can differ significantly , which is a common source of confusion . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> in detailed studies , the directional reflectance properties of astronomical bodies are often expressed in terms of the five hapke parameters which semi empirically describe the variation of albedo with phase angle , including a characterization of the opposition effect of regolith surfaces . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> the correlation between astronomical ( geometric ) albedo , absolute magnitude and diameter is formula 7 , where formula 8 is the astronomical albedo , formula 9 is the diameter in kilometers , and formula 10 is the absolute magnitude . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> albedo is not directly dependent on illumination because changing the amount of incoming light proportionally changes the amount of reflected light , except in circumstances where a change in illumination induces a change in the earth s surface at that location ( e . g . through albedo temperature feedback ) . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> that said , albedo and illumination both vary by latitude . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> albedo is highest near the poles and lowest in the subtropics , with a local maximum in the tropics . <end>
<start> the intensity of albedo temperature effects depends on the amount of albedo and the level of local insolation ( solar irradiance ) high albedo areas in the arctic and antarctic regions are cold due to low insolation , whereas areas such as the sahara desert , which also have a relatively high albedo , will be hotter due to high insolation . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> tropical and sub tropical rainforest areas have low albedo , and are much hotter than their temperate forest counterparts , which have lower insolation . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> because insolation plays such a big role in the heating and cooling effects of albedo , high insolation areas like the tropics will tend to show a more pronounced fluctuation in local temperature when local albedo changes . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> arctic regions notably release more heat back into space than what they absorb , effectively cooling the earth . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> this has been a concern since arctic ice and snow has been melting at higher rates due to higher temperatures , creating regions in the arctic that are notably darker ( being water or ground which is darker color ) and reflects less heat back into space . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> this feedback loop results in a reduced albedo effect . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> albedo affects climate by determining how much radiation a planet absorbs . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> the uneven heating of earth from albedo variations between land , ice , or ocean surfaces can drive weather . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> when an area s albedo changes due to snowfall , a snow temperature feedback results . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> a layer of snowfall increases local albedo , reflecting away sunlight , leading to local cooling . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> in principle , if no outside temperature change affects this area ( e . g . , a warm air mass ) , the raised albedo and lower temperature would maintain the current snow and invite further snowfall , deepening the snow temperature feedback . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> however , because local weather is dynamic due to the change of seasons , eventually warm air masses and a more direct angle of sunlight ( higher insolation ) cause melting . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> when the melted area reveals surfaces with lower albedo , such as grass or soil , the effect is reversed the darkening surface lowers albedo , increasing local temperatures , which induces more melting and thus reducing the albedo further , resulting in still more heating . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> snow albedo is highly variable , ranging from as high as 0 . 9 for freshly fallen snow , to about 0 . 4 for melting snow , and as low as 0 . 2 for dirty snow . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> over antarctica snow albedo averages a little more than 0 . 8 . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> if a marginally snow covered area warms , snow tends to melt , lowering the albedo , and hence leading to more snowmelt because more radiation is being absorbed by the snowpack ( the ice albedo positive feedback ) . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> just as fresh snow has a higher albedo than does dirty snow , the albedo of snow covered sea ice is far higher than that of sea water . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> sea water absorbs more solar radiation than would the same surface covered with reflective snow . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> when sea ice melts , either due to a rise in sea temperature or in response to increased solar radiation from above , the snow covered surface is reduced , and more surface of sea water is exposed , so the rate of energy absorption increases . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> the extra absorbed energy heats the sea water , which in turn increases the rate at which sea ice melts . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> as with the preceding example of snowmelt , the process of melting of sea ice is thus another example of a positive feedback . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> both positive feedback loops have long been recognized as important to the modern theory of global warming . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> cryoconite , powdery windblown dust containing soot , sometimes reduces albedo on glaciers and ice sheets . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> the dynamical nature of albedo in response to positive feedback , together with the effects of small errors in the measurement of albedo , can lead to large errors in energy estimates . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> because of this , in order to reduce the error of energy estimates , it is important to measure the albedo of snow covered areas through remote sensing techniques rather than applying a single value for albedo over broad regions . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> albedo works on a smaller scale , too . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> in sunlight , dark clothes absorb more heat and light coloured clothes reflect it better , thus allowing some control over body temperature by exploiting the albedo effect of the colour of external clothing . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> albedo can affect the electrical energy output of solar photovoltaic devices . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> for example , the effects of a spectrally responsive albedo are illustrated by the differences between the spectrally weighted albedo of solar photovoltaic technology based on hydrogenated amorphous silicon ( a si h ) and crystalline silicon ( c si ) based compared to traditional spectral integrated albedo predictions . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> research showed impacts of over 10 . <end>
<start> more recently , the analysis was extended to the effects of spectral bias due to the specular reflectivity of 22 commonly occurring surface materials ( both human made and natural ) and analyzes the albedo effects on the performance of seven photovoltaic materials covering three common photovoltaic system topologies industrial ( solar farms ) , commercial flat rooftops and residential pitched roof applications
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> because forests generally have a low albedo , ( the majority of the ultraviolet and visible spectrum is absorbed through photosynthesis ) , some scientists have suggested that greater heat absorption by trees could offset some of the carbon benefits of afforestation ( or offset the negative climate impacts of deforestation ) . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> in the case of evergreen forests with seasonal snow cover albedo reduction may be great enough for deforestation to cause a net cooling effect . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> trees also impact climate in extremely complicated ways through evapotranspiration . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> the water vapor causes cooling on the land surface , causes heating where it condenses , acts a strong greenhouse gas , and can increase albedo when it condenses into clouds . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> scientists generally treat evapotranspiration as a net cooling impact , and the net climate impact of albedo and evapotranspiration changes from deforestation depends greatly on local climate . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> in seasonally snow covered zones , winter albedos of treeless areas are 10 to 50 higher than nearby forested areas because snow does not cover the trees as readily . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> deciduous trees have an albedo value of about 0 . 15 to 0 . 18 whereas coniferous trees have a value of about 0 . 09 to 0 . 15 . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> variation in summer albedo across both forest types is correlated with maximum rates of photosynthesis because plants with high growth capacity display a greater fraction of their foliage for direct interception of incoming radiation in the upper canopy . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> the result is that wavelengths of light not used in photosynthesis are more likely to be reflected back to space rather than being absorbed by other surfaces lower in the canopy . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> studies by the hadley centre have investigated the relative ( generally warming ) effect of albedo change and ( cooling ) effect of carbon sequestration on planting forests . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> they found that new forests in tropical and midlatitude areas tended to cool new forests in high latitudes ( e . g . , siberia ) were neutral or perhaps warming . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> water reflects light very differently from typical terrestrial materials . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> the reflectivity of a water surface is calculated using the fresnel equations ( see graph ) . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> at the scale of the wavelength of light even wavy water is always smooth so the light is reflected in a locally specular manner ( not diffusely ) . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> the glint of light off water is a commonplace effect of this . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> at small angles of incident light , waviness results in reduced reflectivity because of the steepness of the reflectivity vs . incident angle curve and a locally increased average incident angle . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> although the reflectivity of water is very low at low and medium angles of incident light , it becomes very high at high angles of incident light such as those that occur on the illuminated side of earth near the terminator ( early morning , late afternoon , and near the poles ) . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> however , as mentioned above , waviness causes an appreciable reduction . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> because light specularly reflected from water does not usually reach the viewer , water is usually considered to have a very low albedo in spite of its high reflectivity at high angles of incident light . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> note that white caps on waves look white ( and have high albedo ) because the water is foamed up , so there are many superimposed bubble surfaces which reflect , adding up their reflectivities . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> fresh black ice exhibits fresnel reflection . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> snow on top of this sea ice increases the albedo to 0 . 9 . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> cloud albedo has substantial influence over atmospheric temperatures . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> different types of clouds exhibit different reflectivity , theoretically ranging in albedo from a minimum of near 0 to a maximum approaching 0 . 8 . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> on any given day , about half of earth is covered by clouds , which reflect more sunlight than land and water . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> clouds keep earth cool by reflecting sunlight , but they can also serve as blankets to trap warmth . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> albedo and climate in some areas are affected by artificial clouds , such as those created by the contrails of heavy commercial airliner traffic . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> a study following the burning of the kuwaiti oil fields during iraqi occupation showed that temperatures under the burning oil fires were as much as 10 c colder than temperatures several miles away under clear skies . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> aerosols ( very fine particles droplets in the atmosphere ) have both direct and indirect effects on earth s radiative balance . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> the direct ( albedo ) effect is generally to cool the planet the indirect effect ( the particles act as cloud condensation nuclei and thereby change cloud properties ) is less certain . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> as per spracklen et al . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> the effects are another albedo related effect on the climate is from black carbon particles . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> the size of this effect is difficult to quantify the intergovernmental panel on climate change estimates that the global mean radiative forcing for black carbon aerosols from fossil fuels is 0 . 2 w m , with a range 0 . 1 to 0 . 4 w m . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> black carbon is a bigger cause of the melting of the polar ice cap in the arctic than carbon dioxide due to its effect on the albedo . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> human activities ( e . g . , deforestation , farming , and urbanization ) change the albedo of various areas around the globe . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> however , quantification of this effect on the global scale is difficult . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> single scattering albedo is used to define scattering of electromagnetic waves on small particles . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> it depends on properties of the material ( refractive index ) the size of the particle or particles and the wavelength of the incoming radiation . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> albedo can be measured by an albedometer . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> a a ( named , plural as , a s , a s , a s or aes ) is the first letter and the first vowel of the modern english alphabet and the iso basic latin alphabet . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> it is similar to the ancient greek letter alpha , from which it derives . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> the uppercase version consists of the two slanting sides of a triangle , crossed in the middle by a horizontal bar . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> the lowercase version can be written in two forms the double storey a and single storey . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> the latter is commonly used in handwriting and fonts based on it , especially fonts intended to be read by children , and is also found in italic type . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> in the english grammar , a , and its variant an , is an indefinite article . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> the earliest certain ancestor of a is aleph ( also written aleph ) , the first letter of the phoenician alphabet , which consisted entirely of consonants ( for that reason , it is also called an abjad to distinguish it from a true alphabet ) . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> in turn , the ancestor of aleph may have been a pictogram of an ox head in proto sinaitic script influenced by egyptian hieroglyphs , styled as a triangular head with two horns extended . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> by 1600 bc , the phoenician alphabet letter had a linear form that served as the base for some later forms . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> its name is thought to have corresponded closely to the paleo hebrew or arabic aleph . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> when the ancient greeks adopted the alphabet , they had no use for a letter to represent the glottal stop the consonant sound that the letter denoted in phoenician and other semitic languages , and that was the first phoneme of the phoenician pronunciation of the letter <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> so they used their version of the sign to represent the vowel , and called it by the similar name of alpha . <end>
<start> in the earliest greek inscriptions after the greek dark ages , dating to the 8th century bc , the letter rests upon its side , but in the greek alphabet of later times it generally resembles the modern capital letter , although many local varieties can be distinguished by the shortening of one leg , or by the angle at which the cross
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> the etruscans brought the greek alphabet to their civilization in the italian peninsula and left the letter unchanged . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> the romans later adopted the etruscan alphabet to write the latin language , and the resulting letter was preserved in the latin alphabet that would come to be used to write many languages , including english . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> during roman times , there were many variant forms of the letter a . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> first was the monumental or lapidary style , which was used when inscribing on stone or other permanent media . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> there was also a cursive style used for everyday or utilitarian writing , which was done on more perishable surfaces . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> due to the perishable nature of these surfaces , there are not as many examples of this style as there are of the monumental , but there are still many surviving examples of different types of cursive , such as majuscule cursive , minuscule cursive , and semicursive minuscule . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> variants also existed that were intermediate between the monumental and cursive styles . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> the known variants include the early semi uncial , the uncial , and the later semi uncial . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> at the end of the roman empire ( 5th century ad ) , several variants of the cursive minuscule developed through western europe . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> among these were the semicursive minuscule of italy , the merovingian script in france , the visigothic script in spain , and the insular or anglo irish semi uncial or anglo saxon majuscule of great britain . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> by the 9th century , the caroline script , which was very similar to the present day form , was the principal form used in book making , before the advent of the printing press . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> this form was derived through a combining of prior forms . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> 15th century italy saw the formation of the two main variants that are known today . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> these variants , the italic and roman forms , were derived from the caroline script version . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> the italic form , also called script a , is used in most current handwriting and consists of a circle and vertical stroke . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> this slowly developed from the fifth century form resembling the greek letter tau in the hands of medieval irish and english writers . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> the roman form is used in most printed material it consists of a small loop with an arc over it ( a ) . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> both derive from the majuscule ( capital ) form . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> in greek handwriting , it was common to join the left leg and horizontal stroke into a single loop , as demonstrated by the uncial version shown . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> many fonts then made the right leg vertical . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> in some of these , the serif that began the right leg stroke developed into an arc , resulting in the printed form , while in others it was dropped , resulting in the modern handwritten form . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> italic type is commonly used to mark emphasis or more generally to distinguish one part of a text from the rest ( set in roman type ) . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> there are some other cases aside from italic type where script a ( ) , also called latin alpha , is used in contrast with latin a ( such as in the international phonetic alphabet ) . <end>

<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> however , occurs in many common digraphs , all with their own sound or sounds , particularly , , , , and . <end>
