<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> animalia ( book ) <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> animalia is an illustrated children s book by graeme base . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> it was originally published in 1986 , followed by a tenth anniversary edition in 1996 , and a 25th anniversary edition in 2012 . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> over four million copies have been sold worldwide . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> a special numbered and signed anniversary edition was also published in 1996 , with an embossed gold jacket . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> animalia is an alliterative alphabet book and contains twenty six illustrations , one for each letter of the alphabet . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> each illustration features an animal from the animal kingdom ( a is for alligator , b is for butterfly , etc . ) along with a short poem utilizing the letter of the page for many of the words . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> the illustrations contain many other objects beginning with that letter that the reader can try to identify . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> as an additional challenge , the author has hidden a picture of himself as a child in every picture . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> julia macrae books published an animalia colouring book in 2008 . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> h . n . abrams also published a wall calendar colouring book version for children the same year . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> h . n . abrams published the animalia wall frieze , a fold out over 26 feet in length , in which the author created new riddles for each letter . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> the great american puzzle factory created a 300 piece jigsaw puzzle based on the book s cover . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> a television series was also created , based on the book , which airs in the united states , australia , canada , the united kingdom , norway and venezuela . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> it also airs on minimax for the czech republic and slovakia . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> and recently in greece on the channel et1 . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> the australian children s television foundation released a teaching resource dvd rom in 2011 to accompany the tv series with teaching aids for classroom use . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> in 2010 , the base factory and appbooks released animalia as an application for ipad and iphone ipod touch . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> animalia won the young australian s best book award in 1987 for best picture story book . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> the children s book council of australia designated animalia a 1987 honour book . kid s own australian literature awards named animalia the 1988 picture book winner . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> international atomic time international atomic time ( tai , from the french name ) is a high precision atomic coordinate time standard based on the notional passage of proper time on earth s geoid . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> it is the principal realisation of terrestrial time ( with a fixed offset of epoch ) . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> it is also the basis for coordinated universal time ( utc ) , which is used for civil timekeeping all over the earth s surface . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> , when another leap second was added , tai is exactly 37 seconds ahead of utc . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> the 37 seconds results from the initial difference of 10 seconds at the start of 1972 , plus 27 leap seconds in utc since 1972 . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> tai may be reported using traditional means of specifying days , carried over from non uniform time standards based on the rotation of the earth . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> specifically , both julian dates and the gregorian calendar are used . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> tai in this form was synchronised with universal time at the beginning of 1958 , and the two have drifted apart ever since , due to the changing motion of the earth . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> tai is a weighted average of the time kept by over 400 atomic clocks in over 50 national laboratories worldwide . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> the majority of the clocks involved are caesium clocks the international system of units ( si ) definition of the second is based on caesium . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> the clocks are compared using gps signals and two way satellite time and frequency transfer . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> due to the signal averaging tai is an order of magnitude more stable than its best constituent clock . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> the participating institutions each broadcast , in real time , a frequency signal with timecodes , which is their estimate of tai . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> time codes are usually published in the form of utc , which differs from tai by a well known integer number of seconds . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> these time scales are denoted in the form utc ( npl ) in the utc form , where npl in this case identifies the national physical laboratory , uk . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> the tai form may be denoted tai ( npl ) . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> the latter is not to be confused with ta ( npl ) , which denotes an independent atomic time scale , not synchronised to tai or to anything else . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> the clocks at different institutions are regularly compared against each other . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> the international bureau of weights and measures ( bipm , france ) , combines these measurements to retrospectively calculate the weighted average that forms the most stable time scale possible . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> this combined time scale is published monthly in circular t , and is the canonical tai . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> this time scale is expressed in the form of tables of differences utc utc ( k ) ( equivalent to tai tai ( k ) ) for each participating institution k . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> the same circular also gives tables of tai ta ( k ) , for the various unsynchronised atomic time scales . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> errors in publication may be corrected by issuing a revision of the faulty circular t or by errata in a subsequent circular t . aside from this , once published in circular t , the tai scale is not revised . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> in hindsight it is possible to discover errors in tai , and to make better estimates of the true proper time scale . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> since the published circulars are definitive , better estimates do not create another version of tai it is instead considered to be creating a better realisation of terrestrial time ( tt ) . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> early atomic time scales consisted of quartz clocks with frequencies calibrated by a single atomic clock the atomic clocks were not operated continuously . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> atomic timekeeping services started experimentally in 1955 , using the first caesium atomic clock at the national physical laboratory , uk ( npl ) . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> it was used as a basis for calibrating the quartz clocks at the royal greenwich observatory and to establish a time scale , called greenwich atomic ( ga ) . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> the united states naval observatory began the a . 1 scale on 13 september 1956 , using an atomichron commercial atomic clock , followed by the nbs a scale at the national bureau of standards , boulder , colorado on 9 october 1957 . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> the international time bureau ( bih ) began a time scale , t or am , in july 1955 , using both local caesium clocks and comparisons to distant clocks using the phase of vlf radio signals . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> the bih scale , a . 1 , and nbs a were defined by an epoch at the beginning of 1958 the procedures used by the bih evolved , and the name for the time scale changed a3 in 1964 and ta ( bih ) in 1969 . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> the si second was defined in terms of the caesium atom in 1967 . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> from 1971 to 1975 the general conference on weights and measures and the international committee for weights and measures made a series of decisions which designated the bipm time scale international atomic time ( tai ) . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> in the 1970s , it became clear that the clocks participating in tai were ticking at different rates due to gravitational time dilation , and the combined tai scale therefore corresponded to an average of the altitudes of the various clocks . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> starting from julian date 2443144 . 5 ( 1 january 1977 00 00 00 ) , corrections were applied to the output of all participating clocks , so that tai would correspond to proper time at mean sea level ( the geoid ) . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> because the clocks were , on average , well above sea level , this meant that tai slowed down , by about one part in a trillion . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> the former uncorrected time scale continues to be published , under the name eal ( echelle atomique libre , meaning free atomic scale ) . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> the instant that the gravitational correction started to be applied serves as the epoch for barycentric coordinate time ( tcb ) , geocentric coordinate time ( tcg ) , and terrestrial time ( tt ) , which represent three fundamental time scales in the solar system . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> all three of these time scales were defined to read jd 2443144 . 5003725 ( 1 january 1977 00 00 32 . 184 ) exactly at that instant . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> tai was henceforth a realisation of tt , with the equation tt ( tai ) <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> tai 32 . 184 s . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> the continued existence of tai was questioned in a 2007 letter from the bipm to the itu r which stated , in the case of a redefinition of utc without leap seconds , the cctf would consider discussing the possibility of suppressing tai , as it would remain parallel to the continuous utc . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> utc is a discontinuous time scale . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> it is regularly adjusted by leap seconds . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> between these adjustments it is composed from segments that are linear transformations of atomic time . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> from its beginning in 1961 through december 1971 the adjustments were made regularly in fractional leap seconds so that utc approximated ut2 . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> afterwards these adjustments were made only in whole seconds to approximate ut1 . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> this was a compromise arrangement in order to enable a publicly broadcast time scale the post 1971 more linear transformation of the bih s atomic time meant that the time scale would be more stable and easier to synchronize internationally . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> the fact that it continues to approximate ut1 means that tasks such as navigation which require a source of universal time continue to be well served by the public broadcast of utc . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> altruism altruism is the principle and moral practice of concern for happiness of other human beings and or animals , resulting in a quality of life both material and spiritual . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> it is a traditional virtue in many cultures and a core aspect of various religious traditions and secular worldviews , though the concept of others toward whom concern should be directed can vary among cultures and religions . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> in an extreme case , altruism may become a synonym of selflessness which is the opposite of selfishness . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> the word altruism was coined by the french philosopher auguste comte in french , as altruisme , for an antonym of egoism . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> he derived it from the italian altrui , which in turn was derived from latin alteri , meaning other people or somebody else . <end>
<start> altruism in biological observations in field populations of the day organisms is an individual performing an action which is at a cost to themselves ( e . g . , pleasure and quality of life , time , probability of survival or reproduction ) , but benefits , either directly or indirectly , another third party individual , without the expectation of reciprocity
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> steinberg suggests a definition for altruism in the clinical setting , that is intentional and voluntary actions that aim to enhance the welfare of another person in the absence of any quid pro quo external rewards . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> in one sense , the opposite of altruism is spite a spiteful action harms another with no self benefit . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> altruism can be distinguished from feelings of loyalty , in that whilst the latter is predicated upon social relationships , altruism does not consider relationships . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> much debate exists as to whether true altruism is possible in human psychology . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> the theory of psychological egoism suggests that no act of sharing , helping or sacrificing can be described as truly altruistic , as the actor may receive an intrinsic reward in the form of personal gratification . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> the validity of this argument depends on whether intrinsic rewards qualify as benefits . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> the term altruism may also refer to an ethical doctrine that claims that individuals are morally obliged to benefit others . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> used in this sense , it is usually contrasted with egoism , which claims individuals are morally obligated to serve themselves first . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> effective altruism is the use of evidence and reason to determine the most effective ways to benefit others . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> the concept has a long history in philosophical and ethical thought . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> the term was originally coined in the 19th century by the founding sociologist and philosopher of science , auguste comte , and has become a major topic for psychologists ( especially evolutionary psychology researchers ) , evolutionary biologists , and ethologists . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> whilst ideas about altruism from one field can affect the other fields , the different methods and focuses of these fields always lead to different perspectives on altruism . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> in simple terms , altruism is caring about the welfare of other people and acting to help them . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> marcel mauss s book the gift contains a passage called note on alms . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> this note describes the evolution of the notion of alms ( and by extension of altruism ) from the notion of sacrifice . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> in it , he writes alms are the fruits of a moral notion of the gift and of fortune on the one hand , and of a notion of sacrifice , on the other . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> generosity is an obligation , because nemesis avenges the poor and the gods for the superabundance of happiness and wealth of certain people who should rid themselves of it . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> this is the ancient morality of the gift , which has become a principle of justice . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> the gods and the spirits accept that the share of wealth and happiness that has been offered to them and had been hitherto destroyed in useless sacrifices should serve the poor and children . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> in the science of ethology ( the study of animal behaviour ) , and more generally in the study of social evolution , altruism refers to behaviour by an individual that increases the fitness of another individual while decreasing the fitness of the actor . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> in evolutionary psychology this may be applied to a wide range of human behaviors such as charity , emergency aid , help to coalition partners , tipping , courtship gifts , production of public goods , and environmentalism . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> theories of apparently altruistic behavior were accelerated by the need to produce theories compatible with evolutionary origins . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> two related strands of research on altruism have emerged from traditional evolutionary analyses and from evolutionary game theory a mathematical model and analysis of behavioural strategies . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> some of the proposed mechanisms are such explanations do not imply that humans are always consciously calculating how to increase their inclusive fitness when they are doing altruistic acts . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> instead , evolution has shaped psychological mechanisms , such as emotions , that promote altruistic behaviors . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> every single instance of altruistic behavior need not always increase inclusive fitness altruistic behaviors would have been selected for if such behaviors on average increased inclusive fitness in the ancestral environment . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> this need not imply that on average 50 or more of altruistic acts were beneficial for the altruist in the ancestral environment if the benefits from helping the right person were very high it would be beneficial to err on the side of caution and usually be altruistic even if in most cases there were no benefits . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> the benefits for the altruist may be increased and the costs reduced by being more altruistic towards certain groups . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> research has found that people are more altruistic to kin than to no kin , to friends than to strangers , to those attractive than to those unattractive , to non competitors than to competitors , and to members ingroups than to members of outgroup . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> the study of altruism was the initial impetus behind george r . price s development of the price equation , which is a mathematical equation used to study genetic evolution . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> an interesting example of altruism is found in the cellular slime moulds , such as dictyostelium mucoroides . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> these protists live as individual amoebae until starved , at which point they aggregate and form a multicellular fruiting body in which some cells sacrifice themselves to promote the survival of other cells in the fruiting body . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> selective investment theory proposes that close social bonds , and associated emotional , cognitive , and neurohormonal mechanisms , evolved in order to facilitate long term , high cost altruism between those closely depending on one another for survival and reproductive success . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> such cooperative behaviors have sometimes been seen as arguments for left wing politics such by the russian zoologist and anarchist peter kropotkin in his 1902 book and peter singer in his book a darwinian left . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> jorge moll and jordan grafman , neuroscientists at the national institutes of health and labs d or hospital network ( j . m . ) provided the first evidence for the neural bases of altruistic giving in normal healthy volunteers , using functional magnetic resonance imaging . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> in their research , published in the proceedings of the national academy of sciences usa in october 2006 , they showed that both pure monetary rewards and charitable donations activated the mesolimbic reward pathway , a primitive part of the brain that usually responds to food and sex . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> however , when volunteers generously placed the interests of others before their own by making charitable donations , another brain circuit was selectively activated the subgenual cortex septal region . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> these structures are intimately related to social attachment and bonding in other species . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> altruism , the experiment suggested , was not a superior moral faculty that suppresses basic selfish urges but rather was basic to the brain , hard wired and pleasurable . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> one brain region , the subgenual anterior cingulate cortex basal forebrain , contributes to learning altruistic behavior , especially in those with trait empathy . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> the same study has shown a connection between giving to charity and the promotion of social bonding . <end>
<start> in fact , in an experiment published in march 2007 at the university of southern california neuroscientist antonio r . damasio and his colleagues showed that subjects with damage to the ventromedial prefrontal cortex lack the ability to empathically feel their way to moral answers , and that when confronted with moral dilemmas , these brain damaged patients coldly came up with end
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start>  <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> these patients appear to reach decisions without the anguish that afflicts those with normally functioning brains . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> according to adrian raine , a clinical neuroscientist also at the university of southern california , one of this study s implications is that society may have to rethink how it judges immoral people psychopaths often feel no empathy or remorse . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> without that awareness , people relying exclusively on reasoning seem to find it harder to sort their way through moral thickets . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> does that mean they should be held to different standards of accountability ? <end>
<start> in another study , in the 1990s , dr . bill harbaugh , a university of oregon economist , concluded people are motivated to give for reasons of personal prestige and in a similar fmri scanner test in 2007 with his psychologist colleague dr . ulrich mayr , reached the same conclusions of jorge moll and jordan grafman about giving to charity ,
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> one of their discoveries was that , though rarely , even some of the considered egoists sometimes gave more than expected because that would help others , leading to the conclusion that there are other factors in cause in charity , such as a person s environment and values . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> the international encyclopedia of the social sciences defines psychological altruism as a motivational state with the goal of increasing another s welfare . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> psychological altruism is contrasted with psychological egoism , which refers to the motivation to increase one s own welfare . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> there has been some debate on whether or not humans are truly capable of psychological altruism . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> some definitions specify a self sacrificial nature to altruism and a lack of external rewards for altruistic behaviors . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> however , because altruism ultimately benefits the self in many cases , the selflessness of altruistic acts is brought to question . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> the social exchange theory postulates that altruism only exists when benefits to the self outweigh costs to the self . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> daniel batson is a psychologist who examined this question and argues against the social exchange theory . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> he identified four major motives for altruism altruism to ultimately benefit the self ( egoism ) , to ultimately benefit the other person ( altruism ) , to benefit a group ( collectivism ) , or to uphold a moral principle ( principlism ) . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> altruism that ultimately serves selfish gains is thus differentiated from selfless altruism , but the general conclusion has been that empathy induced altruism can be genuinely selfless . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> the empathy altruism hypothesis basically states that psychological altruism does exist and is evoked by the empathic desire to help someone who is suffering . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> feelings of empathic concern are contrasted with feelings of personal distress , which compel people to reduce their own unpleasant emotions . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> people with empathic concern help others in distress even when exposure to the situation could be easily avoided , whereas those lacking in empathic concern avoid helping unless it is difficult or impossible to avoid exposure to another s suffering . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> helping behavior is seen in humans at about two years old , when a toddler is capable of understanding subtle emotional cues . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> in psychological research on altruism , studies often observe altruism as demonstrated through prosocial behaviors such as helping , comforting , sharing , cooperation , philanthropy , and community service . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> research has found that people are most likely to help if they recognize that a person is in need and feel personal responsibility for reducing the person s distress . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> research also suggests that the number of bystanders witnessing distress or suffering affects the likelihood of helping ( the bystander effect ) . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> greater numbers of bystanders decrease individual feelings of responsibility . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> however , a witness with a high level of empathic concern is likely to assume personal responsibility entirely regardless of the number of bystanders . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> many studies have observed the effects of volunteerism ( as a form of altruism ) on happiness and health and have consistently found a strong connection between volunteerism and current and future health and well being . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> in a study of older adults , those who volunteered were higher on life satisfaction and will to live , and lower in depression , anxiety , and somatization . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> volunteerism and helping behavior have not only been shown to improve mental health , but physical health and longevity as well , attributable to the activity and social integration it encourages . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> one study examined the physical health of mothers who volunteered over a 30 year period and found that 52 of those who did not belong to a volunteer organization experienced a major illness while only 36 of those who did volunteer experienced one . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> a study on adults ages 55 found that during the four year study period , people who volunteered for two or more organizations had a 63 lower likelihood of dying . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> after controlling for prior health status , it was determined that volunteerism accounted for a 44 reduction in mortality . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> merely being aware of kindness in oneself and others is also associated with greater well being . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> a study that asked participants to count each act of kindness they performed for one week significantly enhanced their subjective happiness . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> it is important to note that , while research supports the idea that altruistic acts bring about happiness , it has also been found to work in the opposite direction that happier people are also kinder . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> the relationship between altruistic behavior and happiness is bidirectional . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> studies have found that generosity increases linearly from sad to happy affective states . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> studies have also been careful to note that feeling over taxed by the needs of others has conversely negative effects on health and happiness . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> for example , one study on volunteerism found that feeling overwhelmed by others demands had an even stronger negative effect on mental health than helping had a positive one ( although positive effects were still significant ) . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> additionally , while generous acts make people feel good about themselves , it is also important for people to appreciate the kindness they receive from others . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> studies suggest that gratitude goes hand in hand with kindness and is also very important for our well being . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> a study on the relationship happiness to various character strengths showed that a conscious focus on gratitude led to reductions in negative affect and increases in optimistic appraisals , positive affect , offering emotional support , sleep quality , and well being . . <end>

<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> swami sivananda , an advaita scholar , reiterates the views in his commentary synthesising vedanta views on the brahma sutras , a vedantic text . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> in his commentary on chapter 3 of the brahma sutras , sivananda notes that karma is insentient and short lived , and ceases to exist as soon as a deed is executed . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> hence , karma cannot bestow the fruits of actions at a future date according to one s merit . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> furthermore , one cannot argue that karma generates apurva or punya , which gives fruit . <end>
