<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> algeria algeria ( , ) , officially the people s democratic republic of algeria ( , ) , is a country in the maghreb region of north africa . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> the capital and most populous city is algiers , located in the far north of the country on the mediterranean coast . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> with an area of , algeria is the tenth largest country in the world , the world s largest arab country , and the largest in africa . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> algeria is bordered to the northeast by tunisia , to the east by libya , to the west by morocco , to the southwest by the western saharan territory , mauritania , and mali , to the southeast by niger , and to the north by the mediterranean sea . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> the country is a semi presidential republic consisting of 48 provinces and 1 , 541 communes ( counties ) . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> it has the highest human development index of all non island african countries . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> ancient algeria has known many empires and dynasties , including ancient numidians , phoenicians , carthaginians , romans , vandals , byzantines , umayyads , abbasids , idrisid , aghlabid , rustamid , fatimids , zirid , hammadids , almoravids , almohads , spaniards , ottomans and the french colonial empire . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> berbers are the indigenous inhabitants of algeria . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> algeria is a regional and middle power . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> it supplies large amounts of natural gas to europe , and energy exports are the backbone of the economy . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> according to opec algeria has the 16th largest oil reserves in the world and the second largest in africa , while it has the 9th largest reserves of natural gas . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> sonatrach , the national oil company , is the largest company in africa . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> algeria has one of the largest militaries in africa and the largest defence budget on the continent most of algeria s weapons are imported from russia , with whom they are a close ally . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> algeria is a member of the african union , the arab league , opec , the united nations and is a founding member of the arab maghreb union . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> on 2 april 2019 , president abdelaziz bouteflika resigned after nearly 20 years in power , following pressure from mass protests against a fifth term . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> the country s name derives from the city of algiers . <end>
<start> the city s name in turn derives from the arabic ( , the islands ) , a truncated form of the older ( , islands of the mazghanna tribe ) , employed by medieval geographers such as al idrisi . in the region of ain hanech ( saida province ) , early remnants ( 200 , 000 bc ) of hominid occupation in
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> neanderthal tool makers produced hand axes in the levalloisian and mousterian styles ( 43 , 000 bc ) similar to those in the levant . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> algeria was the site of the highest state of development of middle paleolithic flake tool techniques . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> tools of this era , starting about 30 , 000 bc , are called aterian ( after the archeological site of bir el ater , south of tebessa ) . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> the earliest blade industries in north africa are called iberomaurusian ( located mainly in the oran region ) . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> this industry appears to have spread throughout the coastal regions of the maghreb between 15 , 000 and 10 , 000 bc . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> neolithic civilization ( animal domestication and agriculture ) developed in the saharan and mediterranean maghreb perhaps as early as 11 , 000 bc or as late as between 6000 and 2000 bc . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> this life , richly depicted in the tassili n ajjer paintings , predominated in algeria until the classical period . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> the mixture of peoples of north africa coalesced eventually into a distinct native population that came to be called berbers , who are the indigenous peoples of northern africa . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> from their principal center of power at carthage , the carthaginians expanded and established small settlements along the north african coast by 600 bc , a phoenician presence existed at tipasa , east of cherchell , hippo regius ( modern annaba ) and rusicade ( modern skikda ) . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> these settlements served as market towns as well as anchorages . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> as carthaginian power grew , its impact on the indigenous population increased dramatically . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> berber civilization was already at a stage in which agriculture , manufacturing , trade , and political organization supported several states . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> trade links between carthage and the berbers in the interior grew , but territorial expansion also resulted in the enslavement or military recruitment of some berbers and in the extraction of tribute from others . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> by the early 4th century bc , berbers formed the single largest element of the carthaginian army . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> in the revolt of the mercenaries , berber soldiers rebelled from 241 to 238 bc after being unpaid following the defeat of carthage in the first punic war . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> they succeeded in obtaining control of much of carthage s north african territory , and they minted coins bearing the name libyan , used in greek to describe natives of north africa . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> the carthaginian state declined because of successive defeats by the romans in the punic wars . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> in 146 bc the city of carthage was destroyed . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> as carthaginian power waned , the influence of berber leaders in the hinterland grew . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> by the 2nd century bc , several large but loosely administered berber kingdoms had emerged . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> two of them were established in numidia , behind the coastal areas controlled by carthage . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> west of numidia lay mauretania , which extended across the moulouya river in modern day morocco to the atlantic ocean . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> the high point of berber civilization , unequaled until the coming of the almohads and almoravids more than a millennium later , was reached during the reign of masinissa in the 2nd century bc . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> after masinissa s death in 148 bc , the berber kingdoms were divided and reunited several times . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> masinissa s line survived until 24 ad , when the remaining berber territory was annexed to the roman empire . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> for several centuries algeria was ruled by the romans , who founded many colonies in the region . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> like the rest of north africa , algeria was one of the breadbaskets of the empire , exporting cereals and other agricultural products . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> saint augustine was the bishop of hippo regius ( modern day algeria ) , located in the roman province of africa . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> the germanic vandals of geiseric moved into north africa in 429 , and by 435 controlled coastal numidia . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> they did not make any significant settlement on the land , as they were harassed by local tribes . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> in fact , by the time the byzantines arrived leptis magna was abandoned and the msellata region was occupied by the indigenous laguatan who had been busy facilitating an amazigh political , military and cultural revival . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> after negligible resistance from the locals , muslim arabs of the umayyad caliphate conquered algeria in the early 8th century . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> large numbers of the indigenous berber people converted to islam . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> christians , berber and latin speakers remained in the great majority in tunisia until the end of the 9th century and muslims only became a vast majority some time in the 10th . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> after the fall of the umayyad caliphate , numerous local dynasties emerged , including the aghlabids , almohads , abdalwadid , zirids , rustamids , hammadids , almoravids and the fatimids . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> the christians left in three waves after the initial conquest , in the 10th century and the 11th . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> the last were evacuated to sicily by the normans and the few remaining died out in the 14th century . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> during the middle ages , north africa was home to many great scholars , saints and sovereigns including judah ibn quraysh , the first grammarian to mention semitic and berber languages , the great sufi masters sidi boumediene ( abu madyan ) and sidi el houari , and the emirs abd al mu min and yaghmurasen . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> it was during this time that the fatimids or children of fatima , daughter of muhammad , came to the maghreb . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> these fatimids went on to found a long lasting dynasty stretching across the maghreb , hejaz and the levant , boasting a secular inner government , as well as a powerful army and navy , made up primarily of arabs and levantines extending from algeria to their capital state of cairo . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> the fatimid caliphate began to collapse when its governors the zirids seceded . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> in order to punish them the fatimids sent the arab banu hilal and banu sulaym against them . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> the resultant war is recounted in the epic taghribat . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> in al taghribat the amazigh zirid hero khalifa al zanati asks daily , for duels , to defeat the hilalan hero abu zayd al hilali and many other arab knights in a string of victories . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> the zirids , however , were ultimately defeated ushering in an adoption of arab customs and culture . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> the indigenous amazigh tribes , however , remained largely independent , and depending on tribe , location and time controlled varying parts of the maghreb , at times unifying it ( as under the fatimids ) . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> the fatimid islamic state , also known as fatimid caliphate made an islamic empire that included north africa , sicily , palestine , jordan , lebanon , syria , egypt , the red sea coast of africa , tihamah , hejaz and yemen . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> caliphates from northern africa traded with the other empires of their time , as well as forming part of a confederated support and trade network with other islamic states during the islamic era . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> the amazighs historically consisted of several tribes . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> the two main branches were the botr and barnes tribes , who were divided into tribes , and again into sub tribes . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> each region of the maghreb contained several tribes ( for example , sanhadja , houara , zenata , masmouda , kutama , awarba , and berghwata ) . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> all these tribes made independent territorial decisions . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> several amazigh dynasties emerged during the middle ages in the maghreb and other nearby lands . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> ibn khaldun provides a table summarising the amazigh dynasties of the maghreb region , the zirid , banu ifran , maghrawa , almoravid , hammadid , almohad , merinid , abdalwadid , wattasid , meknassa and hafsid dynasties . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> there reigned in ifriqiya , current tunisia , a berber family , zirid , somehow recognising the suzerainty of the fatimid caliph of cairo . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> probably in 1048 , the zirid ruler or viceroy , el mu izz , decided to end this suzerainty . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> the fatimid state was too weak to attempt a punitive expedition the viceroy , el mu izz , also found another means of revenge . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> between the nile and the red sea were living bedouin tribes expelled from arabia for their disruption and turbulent influence , both banu hilal and banu sulaym among others , whose presence disrupted farmers in the nile valley since the nomads would often loot . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> the then fatimid vizier devised to relinquish control of the maghreb and obtained the agreement of his sovereign . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> this not only prompted the bedouins to leave , but the fatimid treasury even gave them a light expatriation cash allowance . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> whole tribes set off with women , children , ancestors , animals and camping equipment . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> some stopped on the way , especially in cyrenaica , where they are still one of the essential elements of the settlement but most arrived in ifriqiya by the gabes region . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> the zirid ruler tried to stop this rising tide , but with each encounter , the last under the walls of kairouan , his troops were defeated and the arabs remained masters of the field . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> the flood was still rising , and in 1057 , the arabs spread on the high plains of constantine where they gradually choked qalaa of banu hammad , as they had done in kairouan a few decades ago . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> from there they gradually gained the upper algiers and oran plains . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> some were forcibly taken by the almohads in the second half of the 12th century . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> we can say that in the 13th century the arabs were in all of north africa , with the exception of the main mountain ranges and certain coastal regions which remained entirely berber . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> the influx of bedouin tribes was a major factor in the linguistic , cultural arabization of the maghreb and in the spread of nomadism in areas where agriculture had previously been dominant . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> ibn khaldun noted that the lands ravaged by banu hilal tribes had become completely arid desert . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> in the early 16th century , spain constructed fortified outposts ( presidios ) on or near the algerian coast . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> spain took control of few coastal towns like mers el kebir in 1505 oran in 1509 and tlemcen , mostaganem and tenes in 1510 . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> in the same year , a few merchants of algiers ceded one of the rocky islets in their harbour to spain , which built a fort on it . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> the presidios in north africa turned out to be a costly and largely ineffective military endeavour that did not guarantee access for spain s merchant fleet . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> the region of algeria was partially ruled by ottomans for three centuries from 1516 to 1830 . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> in 1516 the turkish privateer brothers aruj and hayreddin barbarossa , who operated successfully under the hafsids , moved their base of operations to algiers . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> they succeeded in conquering jijel and algiers from the spaniards but eventually assumed control over the city and the surrounding region , forcing the previous ruler , abu hamo musa iii of the bani ziyad dynasty , to flee . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> when aruj was killed in 1518 during his invasion of tlemcen , hayreddin succeeded him as military commander of algiers . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> the ottoman sultan gave him the title of beylerbey and a contingent of some 2 , 000 janissaries . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> with the aid of this force , hayreddin conquered the whole area between constantine and oran ( although the city of oran remained in spanish hands until 1792 ) . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> the next beylerbey was hayreddin s son hasan , who assumed the position in 1544 . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> until 1587 the area was governed by officers who served terms with no fixed limits . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> subsequently , with the institution of a regular ottoman administration , governors with the title of pasha ruled for three year terms . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> the pasha was assisted by janissaries , known in algeria as the ojaq and led by an agha . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> discontent among the ojaq rose in the mid 1600s because they were not paid regularly , and they repeatedly revolted against the pasha . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> as a result , the agha charged the pasha with corruption and incompetence and seized power in 1659 . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> plague had repeatedly struck the cities of north africa . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> algiers lost from 30 , 000 to 50 , 000 inhabitants to the plague in 1620 21 , and suffered high fatalities in 1654 57 , 1665 , 1691 and 1740 42 . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> in 1671 , the taifa rebelled , killed the agha , and placed one of its own in power . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> the new leader received the title of dey . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> after 1689 , the right to select the dey passed to the divan , a council of some sixty nobles . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> it was at first dominated by the ojaq but by the 18th century , it had become the dey s instrument . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> in 1710 , the dey persuaded the sultan to recognise him and his successors as regent , replacing the pasha in that role , although algiers remained a part of the ottoman empire . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> the dey was in effect a constitutional autocrat . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> the dey was elected for a life term , but in the 159 years ( 1671 1830 ) that the system survived , fourteen of the twenty nine deys were assassinated . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> despite usurpation , military coups and occasional mob rule , the day to day operation of ottoman government was remarkably orderly . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> although the regency patronised the tribal chieftains , it never had the unanimous allegiance of the countryside , where heavy taxation frequently provoked unrest . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> autonomous tribal states were tolerated , and the regency s authority was seldom applied in the kabylie . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> the barbary pirates preyed on christian and other non islamic shipping in the western mediterranean sea . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> the pirates often took the passengers and crew on the ships and sold them or used them as slaves . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> they also did a brisk business in ransoming some of the captives . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> according to robert davis , from the 16th to 19th century , pirates captured 1 million to 1 . 25 million europeans as slaves . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> they often made raids , called razzias , on european coastal towns to capture christian slaves to sell at slave markets in north africa and other parts of the ottoman empire . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> in 1544 , for example , hayreddin barbarossa captured the island of ischia , taking 4 , 000 prisoners , and enslaved some 9 , 000 inhabitants of lipari , almost the entire population . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> in 1551 , the ottoman governor of algiers , turgut reis , enslaved the entire population of the maltese island of gozo . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> barbary pirates often attacked the balearic islands . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> the threat was so severe that residents abandoned the island of formentera . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> until the 17th century the barbary pirates used galleys , but a dutch renegade of the name of zymen danseker taught them the advantage of using sailing ships . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> in july 1627 two pirate ships from algiers under the command of dutch pirate jan janszoon sailed as far as iceland , raiding and capturing slaves . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> two weeks earlier another pirate ship from sale in morocco had also raided in iceland . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> some of the slaves brought to algiers were later ransomed back to iceland , but some chose to stay in algeria . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> in 1629 pirate ships from algeria raided the faroe islands . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> barbary raids in the mediterranean continued to attack spanish merchant shipping , and as a result , the spanish navy bombarded algiers in 1783 and 1784 . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> for the attack in 1784 , the spanish fleet was to be joined by ships from such traditional enemies of algiers as naples , portugal and the knights of malta . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> over 20 , 000 cannonballs were fired , much of the city and its fortifications were destroyed and most of the algerian fleet was sunk . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> in the 19th century , the pirates forged affiliations with caribbean powers , paying a licence tax in exchange for safe harbour of their vessels . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> piracy on american vessels in the mediterranean resulted in the united states initiating the first ( 1801 1805 ) and second barbary wars ( 1815 ) . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> following those wars , algeria was weaker and europeans , with an anglo dutch fleet commanded by the british lord exmouth , attacked algiers . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> after a nine hour bombardment , they obtained a treaty from the dey that reaffirmed the conditions imposed by captain ( later commodore ) stephen decatur ( u . s . navy ) concerning the demands of tributes . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> in addition , the dey agreed to end the practice of enslaving christians . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> despite being removed from algeria in the 19th century , spain retained a presence in morocco . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> algeria consistently opposed spanish fortresses and control in nearby morocco through the 20th century . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> under the pretext of a slight to their consul , the french invaded and captured algiers in 1830 . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> historian ben kiernan wrote on the french conquest of algeria by 1875 , the french conquest was complete . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> the war had killed approximately 825 , 000 indigenous algerians since 1830 . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> french losses from 1831 51 were 92 , 329 dead in the hospital and only 3 , 336 killed in action . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> the population of algeria , which stood at about 2 . 9 million in 1872 , reached nearly 11 million in 1960 . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> french policy was predicated on civilising the country . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> the slave trade and piracy in algeria ceased following the french conquest . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> the conquest of algeria by the french took some time and resulted in considerable bloodshed . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> a combination of violence and disease epidemics caused the indigenous algerian population to decline by nearly one third from 1830 to 1872 . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> during this period , a small but influential french speaking indigenous elite was formed , made up of berbers , mostly kabyles . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> as a consequence , french government favored the kabyles . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> about 80 of indigenous schools were constructed for kabyles . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> from 1848 until independence , france administered the whole mediterranean region of algeria as an integral part and departement of the nation . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> one of france s longest held overseas territories , algeria became a destination for hundreds of thousands of european immigrants , who became known as colons and later , as pied noirs . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> between 1825 and 1847 , 50 , 000 french people emigrated to algeria . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> these settlers benefited from the french government s confiscation of communal land from tribal peoples , and the application of modern agricultural techniques that increased the amount of arable land . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> many europeans settled in oran and algiers , and by the early 20th century they formed a majority of the population in both cities . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> during the late 19th and early 20th century the european share was almost a fifth of the population . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> the french government aimed at making algeria an assimilated part of france , and this included substantial educational investments especially after 1900 . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> the indigenous cultural and religious resistance heavily opposed this tendency , but in contrast to the other colonised countries path in central asia and caucasus , algeria kept its individual skills and a relatively human capital intensive agriculture . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> gradually , dissatisfaction among the muslim population , which lacked political and economic status in the colonial system , gave rise to demands for greater political autonomy and eventually independence from france . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> in may 1945 , the uprising against the occupying french forces was suppressed through what is now known as the setif and guelma massacre . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> tensions between the two population groups came to a head in 1954 , when the first violent events of what was later called the algerian war began . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> historians have estimated that between 30 , 000 and 150 , 000 harkis and their dependents were killed by the front de liberation nationale ( fln ) or by lynch mobs in algeria . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> the fln used hit and run attacks in algeria and france as part of its war , and the french conducted severe reprisals . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> the war led to the death of hundreds of thousands of algerians and hundreds of thousands of injuries . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> historians , like alistair horne and raymond aron , state that the actual number of algerian muslim war dead was far greater than the original fln and official french estimates but was less than the 1 million deaths claimed by the algerian government after independence . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> horne estimated algerian casualties during the span of eight years to be around 700 , 000 . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> the war uprooted more than 2 million algerians . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> the war against french rule concluded in 1962 , when algeria gained complete independence following the march 1962 evian agreements and the july 1962 self determination referendum . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> the number of european pied noirs who fled algeria totaled more than 900 , 000 between 1962 and 1964 . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> the exodus to mainland france accelerated after the oran massacre of 1962 , in which hundreds of militants entered european sections of the city , and began attacking civilians . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> algeria s first president was the front de liberation nationale ( fln ) leader ahmed ben bella . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> morocco s claim to portions of western algeria led to the sand war in 1963 . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> ben bella was overthrown in 1965 by houari boumediene , his former ally and defence minister . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> under ben bella , the government had become increasingly socialist and authoritarian boumedienne continued this trend . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> but , he relied much more on the army for his support , and reduced the sole legal party to a symbolic role . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> he collectivised agriculture and launched a massive industrialization drive . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> oil extraction facilities were nationalised . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> this was especially beneficial to the leadership after the international 1973 oil crisis . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> in the 1960s and 1970s under president houari boumediene , algeria pursued a program of industrialization within a state controlled socialist economy . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> boumediene s successor , chadli bendjedid , introduced some liberal economic reforms . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> he promoted a policy of arabisation in algerian society and public life . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> teachers of arabic , brought in from other muslim countries , spread conventional islamic thought in schools and sowed the seeds of a return to orthodox islam . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> the algerian economy became increasingly dependent on oil , leading to hardship when the price collapsed during the 1980s oil glut . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> economic recession caused by the crash in world oil prices resulted in algerian social unrest during the 1980s by the end of the decade , bendjedid introduced a multi party system . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> political parties developed , such as the islamic salvation front ( fis ) , a broad coalition of muslim groups . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> in december 1991 the islamic salvation front dominated the first of two rounds of legislative elections . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> fearing the election of an islamist government , the authorities intervened on 11 january 1992 , cancelling the elections . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> bendjedid resigned and a high council of state was installed to act as the presidency . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> it banned the fis , triggering a civil insurgency between the front s armed wing , the armed islamic group , and the national armed forces , in which more than 100 , 000 people are thought to have died . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> the islamist militants conducted a violent campaign of civilian massacres . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> at several points in the conflict , the situation in algeria became a point of international concern , most notably during the crisis surrounding air france flight 8969 , a hijacking perpetrated by the armed islamic group . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> the armed islamic group declared a ceasefire in october 1997 . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> algeria held elections in 1999 , considered biased by international observers and most opposition groups which were won by president abdelaziz bouteflika . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> he worked to restore political stability to the country and announced a civil concord initiative , approved in a referendum , under which many political prisoners were pardoned , and several thousand members of armed groups were granted exemption from prosecution under a limited amnesty , in force until 13 january 2000 . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> the ais disbanded and levels of insurgent violence fell rapidly . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> the groupe salafiste pour la predication et le combat ( gspc ) , a splinter group of the group islamic army , continued a terrorist campaign against the government . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> bouteflika was re elected in the april 2004 presidential election after campaigning on a programme of national reconciliation . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> the programme comprised economic , institutional , political and social reform to modernise the country , raise living standards , and tackle the causes of alienation . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> it also included a second amnesty initiative , the charter for peace and national reconciliation , which was approved in a referendum in september 2005 . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> it offered amnesty to most guerrillas and government security forces . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> in november 2008 , the algerian constitution was amended following a vote in parliament , removing the two term limit on presidential incumbents . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> this change enabled bouteflika to stand for re election in the 2009 presidential elections , and he was re elected in april 2009 . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> during his election campaign and following his re election , bouteflika promised to extend the programme of national reconciliation and a 150 billion spending programme to create three million new jobs , the construction of one million new housing units , and to continue public sector and infrastructure modernisation programmes . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> a continuing series of protests throughout the country started on 28 december 2010 , inspired by similar protests across the middle east and north africa . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> on 24 february 2011 , the government lifted algeria s 19 year old state of emergency . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> the government enacted legislation dealing with political parties , the electoral code , and the representation of women in elected bodies . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> in april 2011 , bouteflika promised further constitutional and political reform . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> however , elections are routinely criticized by opposition groups as unfair and international human rights groups say that media censorship and harassment of political opponents continue . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> on 2 april 2019 , bouteflika resigned from the presidency . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> algeria is the largest country in africa , and the mediterranean basin . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> its southern part includes a significant portion of the sahara . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> to the north , the tell atlas form with the saharan atlas , further south , two parallel sets of reliefs in approaching eastbound , and between which are inserted vast plains and highlands . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> both atlas tend to merge in eastern algeria . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> the vast mountain ranges of aures and nememcha occupy the entire northeastern algeria and are delineated by the tunisian border . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> the highest point is mount tahat ( m ) . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> algeria lies mostly between latitudes 19 and 37 n ( a small area is north of 37 n and south of 19 n ) , and longitudes 9 w and 12 e . most of the coastal area is hilly , sometimes even mountainous , and there are a few natural harbours . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> the area from the coast to the tell atlas is fertile . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> south of the tell atlas is a steppe landscape ending with the saharan atlas farther south , there is the sahara desert . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> the hoggar mountains ( ) , also known as the hoggar , are a highland region in central sahara , southern algeria . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> they are located about south of the capital , algiers , and just east of tamanghasset . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> algiers , oran , constantine , and annaba are algeria s main cities . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> in this region , midday desert temperatures can be hot year round . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> after sunset , however , the clear , dry air permits rapid loss of heat , and the nights are cool to chilly . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> enormous daily ranges in temperature are recorded . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> rainfall is fairly plentiful along the coastal part of the tell atlas , ranging from annually , the amount of precipitation increasing from west to east . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> precipitation is heaviest in the northern part of eastern algeria , where it reaches as much as in some years . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> farther inland , the rainfall is less plentiful . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> algeria also has ergs , or sand dunes , between mountains . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> among these , in the summer time when winds are heavy and gusty , temperatures can get up to . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> the varied vegetation of algeria includes coastal , mountainous and grassy desert like regions which all support a wide range of wildlife . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> many of the creatures comprising the algerian wildlife live in close proximity to civilization . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> the most commonly seen animals include the wild boars , jackals , and gazelles , although it is not uncommon to spot fennecs ( foxes ) , and jerboas . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> algeria also has a small african leopard and saharan cheetah population , but these are seldom seen . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> a species of deer , the barbary stag , inhabits the dense humid forests in the north eastern areas . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> a variety of bird species makes the country an attraction for bird watchers . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> the forests are inhabited by boars and jackals . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> barbary macaques are the sole native monkey . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> snakes , monitor lizards , and numerous other reptiles can be found living among an array of rodents throughout the semi arid regions of algeria . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> many animals are now extinct , including the barbary lions , atlas bears and crocodiles . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> in the north , some of the native flora includes macchia scrub , olive trees , oaks , cedars and other conifers . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> the mountain regions contain large forests of evergreens ( aleppo pine , juniper , and evergreen oak ) and some deciduous trees . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> fig , eucalyptus , agave , and various palm trees grow in the warmer areas . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> the grape vine is indigenous to the coast . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> in the sahara region , some oases have palm trees . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> acacias with wild olives are the predominant flora in the remainder of the sahara . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> camels are used extensively the desert also abounds with venomous and nonvenomous snakes , scorpions , and numerous insects . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> elected politicians have relatively little sway over algeria . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> instead , a group of unelected civilian and military decideurs , known as le pouvoir ( the power ) , actually rule the country , even deciding who should be president . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> the most powerful man may be mohamed mediene , the head of military intelligence . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> in recent years , many of these generals have died or retired . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> after the death of general larbi belkheir , bouteflika put loyalists in key posts , notably at sonatrach , and secured constitutional amendments that make him re electable indefinitely . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> the head of state is the president of algeria , who is elected for a five year term . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> the president was formerly limited to two five year terms , but a constitutional amendment passed by the parliament on 11 november 2008 removed this limitation . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> the next presidential election was planned to be in april 2019 , but widespread protests erupted in 22 february against the president s decision to participate in the election , which resulted in president bouteflika announcing his resignation on 3 april . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> algeria has universal suffrage at 18 years of age . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> the president is the head of the army , the council of ministers and the high security council . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> he appoints the prime minister who is also the head of government . <end>
<start> the algerian parliament is bicameral the lower house , the people s national assembly , has 462 members who are directly elected for five year terms , while the upper house , the council of the nation , has 144 members serving six year terms , of which 96 members are chosen by local assemblies and 48 are appointed by the president .
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> according to the constitution , no political association may be formed if it is based on differences in religion , language , race , gender , profession , or region . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> in addition , political campaigns must be exempt from the aforementioned subjects . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> parliamentary elections were last held in may 2012 , and were judged to be largely free by international monitors , though local groups alleged fraud and irregularities . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> in the elections , the fln won 221 seats , the military backed national rally for democracy won 70 , and the islamist green algeria alliance won 47 . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> algeria is included in the european union s european neighbourhood policy ( enp ) which aims at bringing the eu and its neighbours closer . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> giving incentives and rewarding best performers , as well as offering funds in a faster and more flexible manner , are the two main principles underlying the european neighbourhood instrument ( eni ) that came into force in 2014 . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> it has a budget of 15 . 4 billion and provides the bulk of funding through a number of programmes . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> in 2009 , the french government agreed to compensate victims of nuclear tests in algeria . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> defense minister herve morin stated that it s time for our country to be at peace with itself , at peace thanks to a system of compensation and reparations , when presenting the draft law on the payouts . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> algerian officials and activists believe that this is a good first step and hope that this move would encourage broader reparation . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> tensions between algeria and morocco in relation to the western sahara have been an obstacle to tightening the arab maghreb union , nominally established in 1989 , but which has carried little practical weight . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> the military of algeria consists of the people s national army ( anp ) , the algerian national navy ( mra ) , and the algerian air force ( qjj ) , plus the territorial air defence forces . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> it is the direct successor of the national liberation army ( armee de liberation nationale or aln ) , the armed wing of the nationalist national liberation front which fought french colonial occupation during the algerian war of independence ( 1954 62 ) . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> total military personnel include 147 , 000 active , 150 , 000 reserve , and 187 , 000 paramilitary staff ( 2008 estimate ) . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> service in the military is compulsory for men aged 19 30 , for a total of 12 months . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> the military expenditure was 4 . 3 of the gross domestic product ( gdp ) in 2012 . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> algeria has the second largest military in north africa with the largest defence budget in africa ( 10 billion ) . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> in 2007 , the algerian air force signed a deal with russia to purchase 49 mig 29smt and 6 mig 29ubt at an estimated cost of 1 . 9 billion . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> russia is also building two 636 type diesel submarines for algeria . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> algeria has been categorized by freedom house as not free since it began publishing such ratings in 1972 , with the exception of 1989 , 1990 , and 1991 , when the country was labeled partly free . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> in december 2016 , the euro mediterranean human rights monitor issued a report regarding violation of media freedom in algeria . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> it clarified that the algerian government imposed restriction on freedom of the press expression and right to peaceful demonstration , protest and assembly as well as intensified censorship of the media and websites . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> due to the fact that the journalists and activists criticize the ruling government , some media organizations licenses are canceled . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> independent and autonomous trade unions face routine harassment from the government , with many leaders imprisoned and protests suppressed . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> in 2016 a number of unions , many of which were involved in the 2010 2012 algerian protests , have been deregistered by the government . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> homosexuality is illegal in algeria . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> public homosexual behavior is punishable by up to two years in prison . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> algeria is divided into 48 provinces ( wilayas ) , 553 districts ( dairas ) and 1 , 541 municipalities ( baladiyahs ) . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> each province , district , and municipality is named after its seat , which is usually the largest city . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> the administrative divisions have changed several times since independence . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> when introducing new provinces , the numbers of old provinces are kept , hence the non alphabetical order . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> with their official numbers , currently ( since 1983 ) they are algeria is classified as an upper middle income country by the world bank . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> algeria s currency is the dinar ( dzd ) . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> the economy remains dominated by the state , a legacy of the country s socialist post independence development model . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> in recent years , the algerian government has halted the privatization of state owned industries and imposed restrictions on imports and foreign involvement in its economy . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> these restrictions are just starting to be lifted off recently although questions about algeria s slowly diversifying economy remain . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> algeria has struggled to develop industries outside hydrocarbons in part because of high costs and an inert state bureaucracy . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> the government s efforts to diversify the economy by attracting foreign and domestic investment outside the energy sector have done little to reduce high youth unemployment rates or to address housing shortages . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> the country is facing a number of short term and medium term problems , including the need to diversify the economy , strengthen political , economic and financial reforms , improve the business climate and reduce inequalities amongst regions . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> a wave of economic protests in february and march 2011 prompted the algerian government to offer more than 23 billion in public grants and retroactive salary and benefit increases . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> public spending has increased by 27 annually during the past 5 years . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> the 2010 14 public investment programme will cost us 286 billion , 40 of which will go to human development . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> the algerian economy grew by 2 . 6 in 2011 , driven by public spending , in particular in the construction and public works sector , and by growing internal demand . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> if hydrocarbons are excluded , growth has been estimated at 4 . 8 . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> growth of 3 is expected in 2012 , rising to 4 . 2 in 2013 . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> the rate of inflation was 4 and the budget deficit 3 of gdp . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> the current account surplus is estimated at 9 . 3 of gdp and at the end of december 2011 , official reserves were put at us 182 billion . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> inflation , the lowest in the region , has remained stable at 4 on average between 2003 and 2007 . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> in 2011 algeria announced a budgetary surplus of 26 . 9 billion , 62 increase in comparison to 2010 surplus . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> in general , the country exported 73 billion worth of commodities while it imported 46 billion . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> thanks to strong hydrocarbon revenues , algeria has a cushion of 173 billion in foreign currency reserves and a large hydrocarbon stabilization fund . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> in addition , algeria s external debt is extremely low at about 2 of gdp . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> the economy remains very dependent on hydrocarbon wealth , and , despite high foreign exchange reserves ( us 178 billion , equivalent to three years of imports ) , current expenditure growth makes algeria s budget more vulnerable to the risk of prolonged lower hydrocarbon revenues . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> in 2011 , the agricultural sector and services recorded growth of 10 and 5 . 3 , respectively . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> about 14 of the labor force are employed in the agricultural sector . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> fiscal policy in 2011 remained expansionist and made it possible to maintain the pace of public investment and to contain the strong demand for jobs and housing . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> algeria has not joined the wto , despite several years of negotiations . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> in march 2006 , russia agreed to erase 4 . 74 billion of algeria s soviet era debt during a visit by russian president vladimir putin to the country , the first by a russian leader in half a century . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> in return , algerian president abdelaziz bouteflika agreed to buy 7 . 5 billion worth of combat planes , air defence systems and other arms from russia , according to the head of russia s state arms exporter rosoboronexport . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> dubai based conglomerate emarat dzayer group said it had signed a joint venture agreement to develop a 1 . 6 billion steel factory in algeria . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> algeria , whose economy is reliant on petroleum , has been an opec member since 1969 . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> its crude oil production stands at around 1 . 1 million barrels day , but it is also a major gas producer and exporter , with important links to europe . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> hydrocarbons have long been the backbone of the economy , accounting for roughly 60 of budget revenues , 30 of gdp , and over 95 of export earnings . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> algeria has the 10th largest reserves of natural gas in the world and is the sixth largest gas exporter . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> the u . s . energy information administration reported that in 2005 , algeria had of proven natural gas reserves . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> it also ranks 16th in oil reserves . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> non hydrocarbon growth for 2011 was projected at 5 . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> to cope with social demands , the authorities raised expenditure , especially on basic food support , employment creation , support for smes , and higher salaries . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> high hydrocarbon prices have improved the current account and the already large international reserves position . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> income from oil and gas rose in 2011 as a result of continuing high oil prices , though the trend in production volume is downwards . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> production from the oil and gas sector in terms of volume , continues to decline , dropping from 43 . 2 million tonnes to 32 million tonnes between 2007 and 2011 . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> nevertheless , the sector accounted for 98 of the total volume of exports in 2011 , against 48 in 1962 , and 70 of budgetary receipts , or us 71 . 4 billion . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> the algerian national oil company is sonatrach , which plays a key role in all aspects of the oil and natural gas sectors in algeria . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> all foreign operators must work in partnership with sonatrach , which usually has majority ownership in production sharing agreements . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> algeria has invested an estimated 100 billion dinars towards developing research facilities and paying researchers . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> this development program is meant to advance alternative energy production , especially solar and wind power . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> algeria is estimated to have the largest solar energy potential in the mediterranean , so the government has funded the creation of a solar science park in hassi r mel . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> currently , algeria has 20 , 000 research professors at various universities and over 780 research labs , with state set goals to expand to 1 , 000 . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> besides solar energy , areas of research in algeria include space and satellite telecommunications , nuclear power and medical research . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> despite a decline in total unemployment , youth and women unemployment is high . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> unemployment particularly affects the young , with a jobless rate of 21 . 5 among the 15 24 age group . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> the overall rate of unemployment was 10 in 2011 , but remained higher among young people , with a rate of 21 . 5 for those aged between 15 and 24 . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> the government strengthened in 2011 the job programmes introduced in 1988 , in particular in the framework of the programme to aid those seeking work ( dispositif d aide a l insertion professionnelle ) . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> the development of the tourism sector in algeria had previously been hampered by a lack of facilities , but since 2004 a broad tourism development strategy has been implemented resulting in many hotels of a high modern standard being built . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> there are several unesco world heritage sites in algeria including al qal a of beni hammad , the first capital of the hammadid empire <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> tipasa , a phoenician and later roman town and djemila and timgad , both roman ruins m zab valley , a limestone valley containing a large urbanized oasis and the casbah of algiers , an important citadel . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> the only natural world heritage site is the tassili n ajjer , a mountain range . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> the algerian road network is the densest in africa its length is estimated at of highways , with more than 3 , 756 structures and a paving rate of 85 . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> this network will be complemented by the east west highway , a major infrastructure project currently under construction . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> it is a 3 way , highway , linking annaba in the extreme east to the tlemcen in the far west . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> algeria is also crossed by the trans sahara highway , which is now completely paved . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> this road is supported by the algerian government to increase trade between the six countries crossed algeria , mali , niger , nigeria , chad , and tunisia . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> in january 2016 algeria s population was an estimated 40 . 4 million , who are mainly arab berber ethnically . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> at the outset of the 20th century , its population was approximately four million . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> about 90 of algerians live in the northern , coastal area the inhabitants of the sahara desert are mainly concentrated in oases , although some 1 . 5 million remain nomadic or partly nomadic . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> 28 . 1 of algerians are under the age of 15 . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> women make up 70 of the country s lawyers and 60 of its judges and also dominate the field of medicine . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> increasingly , women are contributing more to household income than men . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> 60 of university students are women , according to university researchers . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> between 90 , 000 and 165 , 000 sahrawis from western sahara live in the sahrawi refugee camps , in the western algerian sahara desert . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> there are also more than 4 , 000 palestinian refugees , who are well integrated and have not asked for assistance from the united nations high commissioner for refugees ( unhcr ) . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> in 2009 , 35 , 000 chinese migrant workers lived in algeria . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> the largest concentration of algerian migrants outside algeria is in france , which has reportedly over 1 . 7 million algerians of up to the second generation . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> indigenous berbers as well as phoenicians , romans , byzantine greeks , arabs , turks , various sub saharan africans , and french have contributed to the history of algeria . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> descendants of andalusian refugees are also present in the population of algiers and other cities . <end>
<start> moreover , spanish was spoken by these aragonese and castillian morisco descendants deep into the 18th century , and even catalan was spoken at the same time by catalan morisco descendants in the small town of grish el oued . despite the dominance of the berber culture and ethnicity in algeria , the majority of algerians identify with an arabic based identity ,
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> berbers and berber speaking algerians are divided into many groups with varying languages . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> the largest of these are the kabyles , who live in the kabylie region east of algiers , the chaoui of northeast algeria , the tuaregs in the southern desert and the shenwa people of north algeria . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> during the colonial period , there was a large ( 10 in 1960 ) <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> european population who became known as pied noirs . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> they were primarily of french , spanish and italian origin . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> almost all of this population left during the war of independence or immediately after its end . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> modern standard arabic and berber are the official languages . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> algerian arabic ( darja ) is the language used by the majority of the population . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> colloquial algerian arabic is heavily infused with borrowings from french and berber . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> berber has been recognized as a national language by the constitutional amendment of 8 may 2002 . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> kabyle , the predominant berber language , is taught and is partially co official ( with a few restrictions ) in parts of kabylie . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> in february 2016 , the algerian constitution passed a resolution that would make berber an official language alongside arabic . <end>
<pad> <pad> <start> although french has no official status , algeria is the second largest francophone country in the world in terms of speakers , and french is widely used in government , media ( newspapers , radio , local television ) , and both the education system ( from primary school onwards ) and academia due to algeria s colonial history . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> it can be regarded as a lingua franca of algeria . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> in 2008 , 11 . 2 million algerians could read and write in french . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> an abassa institute study in april 2000 found that 60 of households could speak and understand french or 18 million in a population of 30 million then . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> after an earlier period during which the algerian government tried to phase out french ( which is why it has no official status ) , in recent decades the government has backtracked and reinforced the study of french and television programs have reinforced use of the language . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> algeria emerged as a bilingual state after 1962 . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> colloquial algerian arabic is spoken by about 72 of the population and berber by 27 30 . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> islam is the predominant religion in algeria , with its adherents , mostly sunnis , accounting for 99 of the population according to a 2012 cia world factbook estimate , and 97 . 9 according to pew research in 2010 . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> there are about 150 , 000 ibadis in the m zab valley in the region of ghardaia . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> algeria has given the muslim world a number of prominent thinkers , including emir abdelkader , abdelhamid ben badis , mouloud kacem nait belkacem , malek bennabi and mohamed arkoun . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> below is a list of the most important algerian cities modern algerian literature , split between arabic , tamazight and french , has been strongly influenced by the country s recent history . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> famous novelists of the 20th century include mohammed dib , albert camus , kateb yacine and ahlam mosteghanemi while assia djebar is widely translated . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> among the important novelists of the 1980s were rachid mimouni , later vice president of amnesty international , and tahar djaout , murdered by an islamist group in 1993 for his secularist views . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> malek bennabi and frantz fanon are noted for their thoughts on decolonization augustine of hippo was born in tagaste ( modern day souk ahras ) and ibn khaldun , though born in tunis , wrote the muqaddima while staying in algeria . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> the works of the sanusi family in pre colonial times , and of emir abdelkader and sheikh ben badis in colonial times , are widely noted . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> the latin author apuleius was born in madaurus ( mdaourouch ) , in what later became algeria . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> contemporary algerian cinema is various in terms of genre , exploring a wider range of themes and issues . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> there has been a transition from cinema which focused on the war of independence to films more concerned with the everyday lives of algerians . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> algerian painters , like or baya , attempted to revive the prestigious algerian past prior to french colonization , at the same time that they have contributed to the preservation of the authentic values of algeria . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> in this line , mohamed temam , abdelkhader houamel have also returned through this art , scenes from the history of the country , the habits and customs of the past and the country life . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> other new artistic currents including the one of m hamed issiakhem , mohammed khadda and bachir yelles , appeared on the scene of algerian painting , abandoning figurative classical painting to find new pictorial ways , in order to adapt algerian paintings to the new realities of the country through its struggle and its aspirations . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> mohammed khadda and m hamed issiakhem have been notable in recent years . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> the historic roots of algerian literature go back to the numidian and roman african era , when apuleius wrote the golden ass , the only latin novel to survive in its entirety . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> this period had also known augustine of hippo , nonius marcellus and martianus capella , among many others . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> the middle ages have known many arabic writers who revolutionized the arab world literature , with authors like ahmad al buni , ibn manzur and ibn khaldoun , who wrote the muqaddimah while staying in algeria , and many others . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> albert camus was an algerian born french pied noir author . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> in 1957 he was awarded the nobel prize in literature . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> today algeria contains , in its literary landscape , big names having not only marked the algerian literature , but also the universal literary heritage in arabic and french . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> as a first step , algerian literature was marked by works whose main concern was the assertion of the algerian national entity , there is the publication of novels as the algerian trilogy of mohammed dib , or even nedjma of kateb yacine novel which is often regarded as a monumental and major work . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> other known writers will contribute to the emergence of algerian literature whom include mouloud feraoun , malek bennabi , malek haddad , moufdi zakaria , abdelhamid ben badis , mohamed laid al khalifa , mouloud mammeri , frantz fanon , and assia djebar . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> in the aftermath of the independence , several new authors emerged on the algerian literary scene , they will attempt through their works to expose a number of social problems , among them there are rachid boudjedra , rachid mimouni , leila sebbar , tahar djaout and tahir wattar . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> currently , a part of algerian writers tends to be defined in a literature of shocking expression , due to the terrorism that occurred during the 1990s , the other party is defined in a different style of literature who staged an individualistic conception of the human adventure . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> among the most noted recent works , there is the writer , the swallows of kabul and the attack of yasmina khadra , the oath of barbarians of boualem sansal , memory of the flesh of ahlam mosteghanemi and the last novel by assia djebar nowhere in my father s house . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> chaabi music is a typically algerian musical genre characterized by specific rhythms and of qacidate ( popular poems ) in arabic dialect . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> the undisputed master of this music is el hadj m hamed el anka . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> the constantinois malouf style is saved by musician from whom mohamed tahar fergani is a performer . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> folk music styles include bedouin music , characterized by the poetic songs based on long kacida ( poems ) kabyle music , based on a rich repertoire that is poetry and old tales passed through generations shawiya music , a folklore from diverse areas of the aures mountains . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> rahaba music style is unique to the aures . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> souad massi is a rising algerian folk singer . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> other algerian singers of the diaspora include manel filali in germany and kenza farah in france . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> tergui music is sung in tuareg languages generally , tinariwen had a worldwide success . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> finally , the staifi music is born in setif and remains a unique style of its kind . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> modern music is available in several facets , rai music is a style typical of western algeria . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> rap , a relatively recent style in algeria , is experiencing significant growth . <end>
<start> the algerian state s interest in film industry activities can be seen in the annual budget of dzd 200 million ( eur 1 . 8 ) allocated to production , specific measures and an ambitious programme plan implemented by the ministry of culture in order to promote national production , renovate the cinema stock and remedy the weak links in distribution and exploitation
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> the financial support provided by the state , through the fund for the development of the arts , techniques and the film industry ( fdatic ) and the algerian agency for cultural influence <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> ( aarc ) , plays a key role in the promotion of national production . <end>

<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> in mid 2013 , aarc had already supported a total of 78 films , including 42 feature films , 6 short films and 30 documentaries . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> according to the european audiovisual observatory s lumiere database , 41 algerian films were distributed in europe between 1996 and 2013 21 films in this repertoire were algerian french co productions . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> days of glory ( 2006 ) and outside the law ( 2010 ) recorded the highest number of admissions in the european union , 3 , 172 , 612 and 474 , 722 , respectively . <end>

<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> various games have existed in algeria since antiquity . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> in the aures , people played several games such as el kherba or el khergueba ( chess variant ) . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> playing cards , checkers and chess games are part of algerian culture . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> racing ( fantasia ) and rifle shooting are part of cultural recreation of the algerians . <end>
