<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> the original macintosh os , apple dos , and prodos , on the other hand , used carriage return ( cr ) alone as a line terminator however , since apple replaced these operating systems with the unix based macos operating system , they now use line feed ( lf ) as well . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> the radio shack trs 80 also used a lone cr to terminate lines . <end>
<start> computers attached to the arpanet included machines running operating systems such as tops 10 and tenex using cr lf line endings , machines running operating systems such as multics using lf line endings , and machines running operating systems such as os 360 that represented lines as a character count followed by the characters of the line and that used ebcdic rather than
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> the telnet protocol defined an ascii network virtual terminal ( nvt ) , so that connections between hosts with different line ending conventions and character sets could be supported by transmitting a standard text format over the network . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> telnet used ascii along with cr lf line endings , and software using other conventions would translate between the local conventions and the nvt . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> the file transfer protocol adopted the telnet protocol , including use of the network virtual terminal , for use when transmitting commands and transferring data in the default ascii mode . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> this adds complexity to implementations of those protocols , and to other network protocols , such as those used for e mail and the world wide web , on systems not using the nvt s cr lf line ending convention . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> the pdp 6 monitor , and its pdp 10 successor tops 10 , used control z ( sub ) as an end of file indication for input from a terminal . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> some operating systems such as cp m tracked file length only in units of disk blocks and used control z to mark the end of the actual text in the file . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> for these reasons , eof , or end of file , was used colloquially and conventionally as a three letter acronym for control z instead of substitute . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> the end of text code ( etx ) , also known as control c , was inappropriate for a variety of reasons , while using z as the control code to end a file is analogous to it ending the alphabet and serves as a very convenient mnemonic aid . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> a historically common and still prevalent convention uses the etx code convention to interrupt and halt a program via an input data stream , usually from a keyboard . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> in c library and unix conventions , the null character is used to terminate text strings such null terminated strings can be known in abbreviation as asciz or asciiz , where here z stands for zero . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> other representations might be used by specialist equipment , for example iso 2047 graphics or hexadecimal numbers . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> codes 20 to 7e , known as the printable characters , represent letters , digits , punctuation marks , and a few miscellaneous symbols . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> there are 95 printable characters in total . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> code 20 , the space character , denotes the space between words , as produced by the space bar of a keyboard . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> since the space character is considered an invisible graphic ( rather than a control character ) it is listed in the table below instead of in the previous section . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> code 7f corresponds to the non printable delete ( del ) control character and is therefore omitted from this chart it is covered in the previous section s chart . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> earlier versions of ascii used the up arrow instead of the caret ( 5e ) and the left arrow instead of the underscore ( 5f ) . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> points which represented a different character in previous versions ( the 1963 version <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> and or the 1965 draft ) are shown boxed . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> points assigned since the 1963 version but otherwise unchanged are shown lightly shaded relative to their legend colours . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> ascii was first used commercially during 1963 as a seven bit teleprinter code for american telephone telegraph s twx ( teletypewriter exchange ) network . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> twx originally used the earlier five bit ita2 , which was also used by the competing telex teleprinter system . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> bob bemer introduced features such as the escape sequence . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> his british colleague hugh mcgregor ross helped to popularize this work according to bemer , so much so that the code that was to become ascii was first called the bemer ross code in europe . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> because of his extensive work on ascii , bemer has been called the father of ascii . <end>
<start> on march 11 , 1968 , u . s . president lyndon b . johnson mandated that all computers purchased by the united states federal government support ascii , stating i have also approved recommendations of the secretary of commerce luther h . hodges regarding standards for recording the standard code for information interchange on magnetic tapes and paper tapes when they are
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> all computers and related equipment configurations brought into the federal government inventory on and after july 1 , 1969 , must have the capability to use the standard code for information interchange and the formats prescribed by the magnetic tape and paper tape standards when these media are used . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> ascii was the most common character encoding on the world wide web until december 2007 , when utf 8 encoding surpassed it utf 8 is backward compatible with ascii . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> as computer technology spread throughout the world , different standards bodies and corporations developed many variations of ascii to facilitate the expression of non english languages that used roman based alphabets . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> one could class some of these variations as ascii extensions , although some misuse that term to represent all variants , including those that do not preserve ascii s character map in the 7 bit range . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> furthermore , the ascii extensions have also been mislabelled as ascii . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> from early in its development , ascii was intended to be just one of several national variants of an international character code standard . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> other international standards bodies have ratified character encodings such as iso 646 ( 1967 ) that are identical or nearly identical to ascii , with extensions for characters outside the english alphabet and symbols used outside the united states , such as the symbol for the united kingdom s pound sterling ( ) . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> almost every country needed an adapted version of ascii , since ascii suited the needs of only the us and a few other countries . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> for example , canada had its own version that supported french characters . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> many other countries developed variants of ascii to include non english letters ( e . g . e , n , , ) , currency symbols ( e . g . , ) , etc . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> see also yuscii ( yugoslavia ) . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> it would share most characters in common , but assign other locally useful characters to several code points reserved for national use . <end>
<start> however , the four years that elapsed between the publication of ascii 1963 and iso s first acceptance of an international recommendation during 1967 caused ascii s choices for the national use characters to seem to be de facto standards for the world , causing confusion and incompatibility once other countries did begin to make their own assignments to these code points .
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> iso iec 646 , like ascii , is a 7 bit character set . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> it does not make any additional codes available , so the same code points encoded different characters in different countries . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <start> escape codes were defined to indicate which national variant applied to a piece of text , but they were rarely used , so it was often impossible to know what variant to work with and , therefore , which character a code represented , and in general , text processing systems could cope with only one variant anyway . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> because the bracket and brace characters of ascii were assigned to national use code points that were used for accented letters in other national variants of iso iec 646 , a german , french , or swedish , etc . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> programmer using their national variant of iso iec 646 , rather than ascii , had to write , and thus read , something such as instead of c trigraphs were created to solve this problem for ansi c , although their late introduction and inconsistent implementation in compilers limited their use . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> many programmers kept their computers on us ascii , so plain text in swedish , german etc . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> ( for example , in e mail or usenet ) contained , and similar variants in the middle of words , something those programmers got used to . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> for example , a swedish programmer mailing another programmer asking if they should go for lunch , could get n jag har sm rg sar as the answer , which should be na jag har smorgasar meaning no i ve got sandwiches . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> eventually , as 8 , 16 and 32 bit ( and later 64 bit ) computers began to replace 12 , 18 and 36 bit computers as the norm , it became common to use an 8 bit byte to store each character in memory , providing an opportunity for extended , 8 bit relatives of ascii . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> in most cases these developed as true extensions of ascii , leaving the original character mapping intact , but adding additional character definitions after the first 128 ( i . e . , 7 bit ) characters . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> encodings include iscii ( india ) , viscii ( vietnam ) . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> although these encodings are sometimes referred to as ascii , true ascii is defined strictly only by the ansi standard . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> most early home computer systems developed their own 8 bit character sets containing line drawing and game glyphs , and often filled in some or all of the control characters from 0 to 31 with more graphics . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> kaypro cp m computers used the upper 128 characters for the greek alphabet . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> the petscii code commodore international used for their 8 bit systems is probably unique among post 1970 codes in being based on ascii 1963 , instead of the more common ascii 1967 , such as found on the zx spectrum computer . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> atari 8 bit computers and galaksija computers also used ascii variants . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> the ibm pc defined code page 437 , which replaced the control characters with graphic symbols such as smiley faces , and mapped additional graphic characters to the upper 128 positions . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> operating systems such as dos supported these code pages , and manufacturers of ibm pcs supported them in hardware . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> digital equipment corporation developed the multinational character set ( dec mcs ) for use in the popular vt220 terminal as one of the first extensions designed more for international languages than for block graphics . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> the macintosh defined mac os roman and postscript also defined a set , both of these contained both international letters and typographic punctuation marks instead of graphics , more like modern character sets . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> the iso iec 8859 standard ( derived from the dec mcs ) finally provided a standard that most systems copied ( at least as accurately as they copied ascii , but with many substitutions ) . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> a popular further extension designed by microsoft , windows 1252 ( often mislabeled as iso 8859 1 ) , added the typographic punctuation marks needed for traditional text printing . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> iso 8859 1 , windows 1252 , and the original 7 bit ascii were the most common character encodings until 2008 when utf 8 became more common . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> iso iec 4873 introduced 32 additional control codes defined in the 80 9f hexadecimal range , as part of extending the 7 bit ascii encoding to become an 8 bit system . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> unicode and the iso iec 10646 universal character set ( ucs ) have a much wider array of characters and their various encoding forms have begun to supplant iso iec 8859 and ascii rapidly in many environments . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> while ascii is limited to 128 characters , unicode and the ucs support more characters by separating the concepts of unique identification ( using natural numbers called code points ) and encoding ( to 8 , 16 or 32 bit binary formats , called utf 8 , utf 16 and utf 32 ) . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> ascii was incorporated into the unicode ( 1991 ) character set as the first 128 symbols , so the 7 bit ascii characters have the same numeric codes in both sets . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> this allows utf 8 to be backward compatible with 7 bit ascii , as a utf 8 file containing only ascii characters is identical to an ascii file containing the same sequence of characters . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> even more importantly , forward compatibility is ensured as software that recognizes only 7 bit ascii characters as special and does not alter bytes with the highest bit set ( as is often done to support 8 bit ascii extensions such as iso 8859 1 ) will preserve utf 8 data unchanged . <end>

<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> animation animation is a method in which pictures are manipulated to appear as moving images . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> in traditional animation , images are drawn or painted by hand on transparent celluloid sheets to be photographed and exhibited on film . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> today , most animations are made with computer generated imagery ( cgi ) . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> computer animation can be very detailed 3d animation , while 2d computer animation can be used for stylistic reasons , low bandwidth or faster real time renderings . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> other common animation methods apply a stop motion technique to two and three dimensional objects like paper cutouts , puppets or clay figures . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> commonly the effect of animation is achieved by a rapid succession of sequential images that minimally differ from each other . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> the illusion as in motion pictures in general is thought to rely on the phi phenomenon and beta movement , but the exact causes are still uncertain . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> analog mechanical animation media that rely on the rapid display of sequential images include the phenakisticope , zoetrope , flip book , praxinoscope and film . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> television and video are popular electronic animation media that originally were analog and now operate digitally . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> for display on the computer , techniques like animated gif and flash animation were developed . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> animation is more pervasive than many people realise . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> apart from short films , feature films , animated gifs and other media dedicated to the display of moving images , animation is also heavily used for video games , motion graphics and special effects . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> animation is also prevalent in information technology interfaces . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> the physical movement of image parts through simple mechanics in for instance the moving images in magic lantern shows can also be considered animation . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> the mechanical manipulation of puppets and objects to emulate living beings has a very long history in automata . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> automata were popularised by disney as animatronics . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> animators are artists who specialize in creating animation . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> the word animation stems from the latin animationem ( nominative animatio ) , noun of action from past participle stem of animare , meaning the action of imparting life . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> the primary meaning of the english word is liveliness and has been in use much longer than the meaning of moving image medium . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> the history of animation started long before the development of cinematography . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> humans have probably attempted to depict motion as far back as the paleolithic period . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> shadow play and the magic lantern offered popular shows with moving images as the result of manipulation by hand and or some minor mechanics . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> a 5 , 200 year old pottery bowl discovered in shahr e sukhteh , iran , has five sequential images painted around it that seem to show phases of a goat leaping up to nip at a tree . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> in 1833 , the phenakistiscope introduced the stroboscopic principle of modern animation , which would also provide the basis for the zoetrope ( 1866 ) , the flip book ( 1868 ) , the praxinoscope ( 1877 ) and cinematography . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> charles emile reynaud further developed his projection praxinoscope into the theatre optique with transparent hand painted colorful pictures in a long perforated strip wound between two spools , patented in december 1888 . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> from 28 october 1892 to march 1900 reynaud gave over 12 , 800 shows to a total of over 500 . 000 visitors at the musee grevin in paris . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> his pantomimes lumineuses series of animated films each contained 300 to 700 frames that were manipulated back and forth to last 10 to 15 minutes per film . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> piano music , song , and some dialogue were performed live , while some sound effects were synchronized with an electromagnet . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> after cinematography became a popular medium , some manufacturers of optical toys adapted small magic lanterns into toy film projectors for short loops of film . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> by 1902 , they were producing many chromolithography film loops , usually by tracing live action film footage ( much like the later rotoscoping technique ) . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> some early filmmakers , including j . stuart blackton , arthur melbourne cooper , segundo de chomon and edwin s . porter experimented with stop motion animation , possibly since around 1899 . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> blackton s the haunted hotel ( 1907 ) was the first huge success that baffled audiences with objects apparently moving by themselves and inspired other filmmakers to try the technique . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> j . stuart blackton also experimented with animation drawn on blackboards and some cutout animation in humorous phases of funny faces ( 1906 ) . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> in 1908 , emile cohl s fantasmagorie was released with a white on black chalkline look created with negative prints from black ink drawings on white paper . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> the film largely consists of a stick figure moving about and encountering all kinds of morphing objects , including a wine bottle that transforms into a flower . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> inspired by emile cohl s stop motion film les allumettes animees animated matches ( 1908 ) , ladislas starevich started making his influential puppet animations in 1910 . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> winsor mccay s little nemo ( 1911 ) showcased very detailed drawings . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> his gertie the dinosaur ( 1914 ) was also an early example of character development in drawn animation . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> during the 1910s , the production of animated short films , known as cartoons , became an industry and cartoon shorts were produced for showing in cinemas . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> the most successful producer at the time was john randolph bray , who , along with animator earl hurd , patented the cel animation process that dominated the animation industry for the rest of the decade . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> el apostol ( spanish the apostle ) was a 1917 argentine animated film utilizing cutout animation , and the world s first animated feature film . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> a fire that destroyed producer federico valle s film studio incinerated the only known copy of el apostol , and it is now considered a lost film . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> in 1919 , the silent animated short feline follies marked the debut of felix the cat , becoming the first animated character in the silent film era to gain significant popularity . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> the earliest extant feature length animated film is the adventures of prince achmed ( 1926 ) made by director lotte reiniger and her collaborators carl koch and berthold bartosch . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> the first animation with full sound synchronization ( both music and dialogue ) was a short by walt disney s animation studio called steamboat willie , featuring mickey mouse in 1928 . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> in 1932 , the first short animated film created entirely with technicolor ( using red green blue photographic filters and three strips of film in the camera ) was disney s flowers and trees , directed by burt gillett . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> the first full color animated feature film was snow white and the seven dwarfs , also by walt disney . <end>
<start> through the 1930s and 1950s , the golden age of american animation saw new animated characters emerge , including goofy , donald duck , daisy duck , bugs bunny , daffy duck , porky pig , betty boop , popeye , sylvester the cat , woody woodpecker , tweety , wile e . coyote and road runner , elmer fudd , foghorn leghorn
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> in 1958 , hanna barbera released the huckleberry hound show , the first half hour television program to feature only in animation . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> terrytoons released tom terrific that same year . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> television significantly decreased public attention to the animated shorts being shown in theaters . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> computer animation has become popular since toy story ( 1995 ) , the first feature length animated film completely made using this technique . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> in 2008 , the animation market was worth us 68 . 4 billion . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> animation as an art and industry continues to thrive as of the mid 2010s because well made animated projects can find audiences across borders and in all four quadrants . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> animated feature length films returned the highest gross margins ( around 52 ) of all film genres in 2004 2013 . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> traditional animation ( also called cel animation or hand drawn animation ) was the process used for most animated films of the 20th century . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> the individual frames of a traditionally animated film are photographs of drawings , first drawn on paper . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> to create the illusion of movement , each drawing differs slightly from the one before it . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> the animators drawings are traced or photocopied onto transparent acetate sheets called cels , which are filled in with paints in assigned colors or tones on the side opposite the line drawings . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> the completed character cels are photographed one by one against a painted background by a rostrum camera onto motion picture film . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> the traditional cel animation process became obsolete by the beginning of the 21st century . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> today , animators drawings and the backgrounds are either scanned into or drawn directly into a computer system . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> various software programs are used to color the drawings and simulate camera movement and effects . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> the final animated piece is output to one of several delivery media , including traditional 35 mm film and newer media with digital video . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> the look of traditional cel animation is still preserved , and the character animators work has remained essentially the same over the past 70 years . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> some animation producers have used the term tradigital ( a play on the words traditional and digital ) to describe cel animation that uses significant computer technology . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> examples of traditionally animated feature films include pinocchio ( united states , 1940 ) , animal farm ( united kingdom , 1954 ) , lucky and zorba ( italy , 1998 ) , and the illusionist ( british french , 2010 ) . <end>
<start> traditionally animated films produced with the aid of computer technology include the lion king ( us , 1994 ) , the prince of egypt ( us , 1998 ) , akira ( japan , 1988 ) , spirited away ( japan , 2001 ) , the triplets of belleville ( france , 2003 ) , and the secret of kells ( irish french
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> full animation refers to the process of producing high quality traditionally animated films that regularly use detailed drawings and plausible movement , having a smooth animation . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> fully animated films can be made in a variety of styles , from more realistically animated works like those produced by the walt disney studio ( the little mermaid , beauty and the beast , aladdin , the lion king ) to the more cartoon styles of the warner bros . animation studio . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> many of the disney animated features are examples of full animation , as are non disney works , the secret of nimh ( us , 1982 ) , the iron giant ( us , 1999 ) , and nocturna ( spain , 2007 ) . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> fully animated films are animated at 24 frames per second , with a combination of animation on ones and twos , meaning that drawings can be held for one frame out of 24 or two frames out of 24 . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> limited animation involves the use of less detailed or more stylized drawings and methods of movement usually a choppy or skippy movement animation . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> limited animation uses fewer drawings per second , thereby limiting the fluidity of the animation . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> this is a more economic technique . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> pioneered by the artists at the american studio united productions of america , limited animation can be used as a method of stylized artistic expression , as in gerald mcboing boing ( us , 1951 ) , yellow submarine ( uk , 1968 ) , and certain anime produced in japan . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> its primary use , however , has been in producing cost effective animated content for media for television ( the work of hanna barbera , filmation , and other tv animation studios ) and later the internet ( web cartoons ) . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> rotoscoping is a technique patented by max fleischer in 1917 where animators trace live action movement , frame by frame . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> the source film can be directly copied from actors outlines into animated drawings , as in the lord of the rings ( us , 1978 ) , or used in a stylized and expressive manner , as in waking life ( us , 2001 ) and a scanner darkly ( us , 2006 ) . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> some other examples are fire and ice ( us , 1983 ) , heavy metal ( 1981 ) , and aku no hana ( 2013 ) . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> live action animation is a technique combining hand drawn characters into live action shots or live action actors into animated shots . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> one of the earlier uses was in koko the clown when koko was drawn over live action footage . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> other examples include allegro non troppo ( italy , 1976 ) , who framed roger rabbit ( us , 1988 ) , space jam ( us , 1996 ) and osmosis jones ( us , 2001 ) . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> stop motion animation is used to describe animation created by physically manipulating real world objects and photographing them one frame of film at a time to create the illusion of movement . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> there are many different types of stop motion animation , usually named after the medium used to create the animation . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> computer software is widely available to create this type of animation traditional stop motion animation is usually less expensive but more time consuming to produce than current computer animation . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> computer animation encompasses a variety of techniques , the unifying factor being that the animation is created digitally on a computer . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> 2d animation techniques tend to focus on image manipulation while 3d techniques usually build virtual worlds in which characters and objects move and interact . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> 3d animation can create images that seem real to the viewer . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> 2d animation figures are created or edited on the computer using 2d bitmap graphics and 2d vector graphics . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> this includes automated computerized versions of traditional animation techniques , interpolated morphing , onion skinning and interpolated rotoscoping . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> 2d animation has many applications , including analog computer animation , flash animation , and powerpoint animation . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> cinemagraphs are still photographs in the form of an animated gif file of which part is animated . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> final line advection animation is a technique used in 2d animation , to give artists and animators more influence and control over the final product as everything is done within the same department . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> speaking about using this approach in paperman , john kahrs said that our animators can change things , actually erase away the cg underlayer if they want , and change the profile of the arm . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> 3d animation is digitally modeled and manipulated by an animator . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> the animator usually starts by creating a 3d polygon mesh to manipulate . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> a mesh typically includes many vertices that are connected by edges and faces , which give the visual appearance of form to a 3d object or 3d environment . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> sometimes , the mesh is given an internal digital skeletal structure called an armature that can be used to control the mesh by weighting the vertices . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> this process is called rigging and can be used in conjunction with keyframes to create movement . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> other techniques can be applied , mathematical functions ( e . g . , gravity , particle simulations ) , simulated fur or hair , and effects , fire and water simulations . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> these techniques fall under the category of 3d dynamics . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> an animator is an artist who creates a visual sequence ( or audio visual if added sound ) of multiple sequential images that generate the illusion of movement , that is , an animation . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> animations are currently in many areas of technology and video , such as cinema , television , video games or the internet . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> generally , these works require the collaboration of several animators . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> the methods to create these images depend on the animator and style that one wants to achieve ( with images generated by computer , manually . . . ) . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> animators can be divided into animators of characters ( artists who are specialized in the movements , dialogue and acting of the characters ) and animators of special effects ( for example vehicles , machinery or natural phenomena such as water , snow , rain ) . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> the creation of non trivial animation works ( i . e . , longer than a few seconds ) has developed as a form of filmmaking , with certain unique aspects . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> traits common to both live action and animated feature length films are labor intensity and high production costs . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> the most important difference is that once a film is in the production phase , the marginal cost of one more shot is higher for animated films than live action films . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> it is relatively easy for a director to ask for one more take during principal photography of a live action film , but every take on an animated film must be manually rendered by animators ( although the task of rendering slightly different takes has been made less tedious by modern computer animation ) . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> it is pointless for a studio to pay the salaries of dozens of animators to spend weeks creating a visually dazzling five minute scene if that scene fails to effectively advance the plot of the film . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> thus , animation studios starting with disney began the practice in the 1930s of maintaining story departments where storyboard artists develop every single scene through storyboards , then handing the film over to the animators only after the production team is satisfied that all the scenes make sense as a whole . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> while live action films are now also storyboarded , they enjoy more latitude to depart from storyboards ( i . e . , real time improvisation ) . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> another problem unique to animation is the requirement to maintain a film s consistency from start to finish , even as films have grown longer and teams have grown larger . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> animators , like all artists , necessarily have individual styles , but must subordinate their individuality in a consistent way to whatever style is employed on a particular film . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> since the early 1980s , teams of about 500 to 600 people , of whom 50 to 70 are animators , typically have created feature length animated films . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> it is relatively easy for two or three artists to match their styles synchronizing those of dozens of artists is more difficult . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> this problem is usually solved by having a separate group of visual development artists develop an overall look and palette for each film before animation begins . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> character designers on the visual development team draw model sheets to show how each character should look like with different facial expressions , posed in different positions , and viewed from different angles . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> on traditionally animated projects , maquettes were often sculpted to further help the animators see how characters would look from different angles . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> unlike live action films , animated films were traditionally developed beyond the synopsis stage through the storyboard format the storyboard artists would then receive credit for writing the film . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> in the early 1960s , animation studios began hiring professional screenwriters to write screenplays ( while also continuing to use story departments ) and screenplays had become commonplace for animated films by the late 1980s . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> criticism of animation has been common in media and cinema since its inception . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> with its popularity , a large amount of criticism has arisen , especially animated feature length films . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> many concerns of cultural representation , psychological effects on children have been brought up around the animation industry , which has remained rather politically unchanged and stagnant since its inception into mainstream culture . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> as with any other form of media , animation too has instituted awards for excellence in the field . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> the original awards for animation were presented by the academy of motion picture arts and sciences for animated shorts from the year 1932 , during the 5th academy awards function . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> the first winner of the academy award was the short flowers and trees , a production by walt disney productions . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> the academy award for a feature length animated motion picture was only instituted for the year 2001 , and awarded during the 74th academy awards in 2002 . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> it was won by the film shrek , produced by dreamworks and pacific data images . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> disney pixar have produced the most films either to win or be nominated for the award . <end>

<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> also since 2007 , the asia pacific screen award for best animated feature film has been awarded at the asia pacific screen awards . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> since 2009 , the european film awards have awarded the european film award for best animated film . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> the annie award is another award presented for excellence in the field of animation . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> unlike the academy awards , the annie awards are only received for achievements in the field of animation and not for any other field of technical and artistic endeavor . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> they were re organized in 1992 to create a new field for best animated feature . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> the 1990s winners were dominated by walt disney , however , newer studios , led by pixar dreamworks , have now begun to consistently vie for this award . <end>

<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> apollo apollo ( attic , ionic , and homeric greek , apollon ( ) ) is one of the most important and complex of the olympian deities in classical greek and roman religion and greek and roman mythology . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> the national divinity of the greeks , apollo has been recognized as a god of archery , music and dance , truth and prophecy , healing and diseases , the sun and light , poetry , and more . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> apollo is the son of zeus and leto , and has a twin sister , the chaste huntress artemis . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> seen as the most beautiful god and the ideal of the kouros ( a beardless , athletic youth ) , apollo is considered to be the most greek of all gods . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> apollo is known in greek influenced etruscan mythology as apulu . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> as the patron of delphi ( pythian apollo ) , apollo is an oracular god the prophetic deity of the delphic oracle . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> medicine and healing are associated with apollo , whether through the god himself or mediated through his son asclepius . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> yet apollo is also a god who could bring ill health and deadly plague with his arrows . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> apollo is the god of archery and the invention of archery is credited to him and his sister artemis . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> he has a golden and a silver bow , and a quiver of golden arrows . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> as the god of mousike ( art of muses ) , apollo presided over all music , songs , dance and poetry . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> he is the inventor of string music , and the frequent companion of the muses , functioning as their chorus leader in celebrations . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> the lyre is a common attribute of apollo . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> as the protector of young , apollo ( kourotrophos ) is concerned with the health and education of children . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> he presides over their passage into adulthood . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> apollo is an important pastoral deity . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> he is the patron of herdsmen and shepherds . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> protection of herds , flocks and crops from diseases and pests were his primary duties . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> apollo encouraged founding new towns and establishment of civil constitution , and is associated with dominion over colonists . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> he is also the giver of laws , and his oracles were consulted before setting laws in a city . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> apollo is the god who affords help and wards off evil . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> he delivered men from epidemics . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> various epithets call him the averter of evil . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> as the patron of seafarers , he is also the god of foreigners , the protector of fugitives and refugees . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> in hellenistic times , especially during the 5th century bce , as apollo helios he became identified among greeks with helios , titan god of the sun . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> in latin texts , however , there was no conflation of apollo with sol among the classical latin poets until 1st century ad . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> apollo and helios sol remained separate beings in literary and mythological texts until the 5th century ce . <end>

<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> they show the spread of the cult of apollo and the evolution of the greek architecture , which was mostly based on the rightness of form and on mathematical relations . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> some of the earliest temples , especially in crete , do not belong to any greek order . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> it seems that the first peripteral temples were rectangular wooden structures . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> the different wooden elements were considered divine , and their forms were preserved in the marble or stone elements of the temples of doric order . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> the greeks used standard types because they believed that the world of objects was a series of typical forms which could be represented in several instances . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> the temples should be canonic , and the architects were trying to achieve this esthetic perfection . <end>

<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> the first buildings were built narrowly in order to hold the roof , and when the dimensions changed some mathematical relations became necessary in order to keep the original forms . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> this probably influenced the theory of numbers of pythagoras , who believed that behind the appearance of things there was the permanent principle of mathematics . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> the doric order dominated during the 6th and the 5th century bc but there was a mathematical problem regarding the position of the triglyphs , which couldn t be solved without changing the original forms . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> the order was almost abandoned for the ionic order , but the ionic capital also posed an insoluble problem at the corner of a temple . <end>

<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> as god of colonization , apollo gave oracular guidance on colonies , especially during the height of colonization , 750 550 bce . <end>

<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> hittite cuneiform texts mention a minor asian god called appaliunas or apalunas in connection with the city of wilusa attested in hittite inscriptions , which is now generally regarded as being identical with the greek ilion by most scholars . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> in this interpretation , apollo s title of lykegenes can simply be read as born in lycia , which effectively severs the god s supposed link with wolves ( possibly a folk etymology ) . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> in literary contexts , apollo represents harmony , order , and reason characteristics contrasted with those of dionysus , god of wine , who represents ecstasy and disorder . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> the contrast between the roles of these gods is reflected in the adjectives apollonian and dionysian . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> however , the greeks thought of the two qualities as complementary the two gods are brothers , and when apollo at winter left for hyperborea , he would leave the delphic oracle to dionysus . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> this contrast appears to be shown on the two sides of the borghese vase . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> apollo is often associated with the golden mean . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> this is the greek ideal of moderation and a virtue that opposes gluttony . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> apollo is a common theme in greek and roman art and also in the art of the renaissance . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> the earliest greek word for a statue is delight ( , agalma ) , and the sculptors tried to create forms which would inspire such guiding vision . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> greek art puts into apollo the highest degree of power and beauty that can be imagined . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> the sculptors derived this from observations on human beings , but they also embodied in concrete form , issues beyond the reach of ordinary thought . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> the naked bodies of the statues are associated with the cult of the body that was essentially a religious activity . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> the muscular frames and limbs combined with slim waists indicate the greek desire for health , and the physical capacity which was necessary in the hard greek environment . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> the statues of apollo embody beauty , balance and inspire awe before the beauty of the world . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> the evolution of the greek sculpture can be observed in his depictions from the almost static formal kouros type in early archaic period , to the representation of motion in a relative harmonious whole in late archaic period . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> in classical greece the emphasis is not given to the illusive imaginative reality represented by the ideal forms , but to the analogies and the interaction of the members in the whole , a method created by polykleitos . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> finally praxiteles seems to be released from any art and religious conformities , and his masterpieces are a mixture of naturalism with stylization . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> the evolution of the greek art seems to go parallel with the greek philosophical conceptions , which changed from the natural philosophy of thales to the metaphysical theory of pythagoras . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> thales searched for a simple material form directly perceptible by the senses , behind the appearances of things , and his theory is also related to the older animism . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> this was paralleled in sculpture by the absolute representation of vigorous life , through unnaturally simplified forms . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> pythagoras believed that behind the appearance of things , there was the permanent principle of mathematics , and that the forms were based on a transcendental mathematical relation . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> the forms on earth , are imperfect imitations ( , eikones , images ) of the celestial world of numbers . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> his ideas had a great influence on post archaic art . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> the greek architects and sculptors were always trying to find the mathematical relation , that would lead to the esthetic perfection . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> ( canon ) . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> in classical greece , anaxagoras asserted that a divine reason ( mind ) gave order to the seeds of the universe , and plato extended the greek belief of ideal forms to his metaphysical theory of forms ( ideai , ideas ) . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> the forms on earth are imperfect duplicates of the intellectual celestial ideas . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> the greek words oida ( , ( i ) know ) and eidos ( , species ) , a thing seen , have the same root as the word idea ( ) , a thing to see . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> indicating how the greek mind moved from the gift of the senses , to the principles beyond the senses . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> the artists in plato s time moved away from his theories and art tends to be a mixture of naturalism with stylization . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> the greek sculptors considered the senses more important , and the proportions were used to unite the sensible with the intellectual . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> kouros ( male youth ) is the modern term given to those representations of standing male youths which first appear in the archaic period in greece . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> this type served certain religious needs and was first proposed for what was previously thought to be depictions of apollo . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> the first statues are certainly still and formal . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> the formality of their stance seems to be related with the egyptian precedent , but it was accepted for a good reason . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> the sculptors had a clear idea of what a young man is , and embodied the archaic smile of good manners , the firm and springy step , the balance of the body , dignity , and youthful happiness . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> when they tried to depict the most abiding qualities of men , it was because men had common roots with the unchanging gods . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> the adoption of a standard recognizable type for a long time , is probably because nature gives preference in survival of a type which has long be adopted by the climatic conditions , and also due to the general greek belief that nature expresses itself in ideal forms that can be imagined and represented . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> these forms expressed immortality . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> apollo was the immortal god of ideal balance and order . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> his shrine in delphi , that he shared in winter with dionysius had the inscriptions ( gnothi seauton know thyself ) and ( meden agan , nothing in excess ) , and ( eggya para d ate , make a pledge and mischief is nigh ) . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> in the first large scale depictions during the early archaic period ( 640 580 bc ) , the artists tried to draw one s attention to look into the interior of the face and the body which were not represented as lifeless masses , but as being full of life . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> the greeks maintained , until late in their civilization , an almost animistic idea that the statues are in some sense alive . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> this embodies the belief that the image was somehow the god or man himself . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> a fine example is the statue of the sacred gate kouros which was found at the cemetery of dipylon in athens ( dipylon kouros ) . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> the statue is the thing in itself , and his slender face with the deep eyes express an intellectual eternity . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> according to the greek tradition the dipylon master was named daedalus , and in his statues the limbs were freed from the body , giving the impression that the statues could move . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> it is considered that he created also the new york kouros , which is the oldest fully preserved statue of kouros type , and seems to be the incarnation of the god himself . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> the animistic idea as the representation of the imaginative reality , is sanctified in the homeric poems and in greek myths , in stories of the god hephaestus ( phaistos ) and the mythic daedalus ( the builder of the labyrinth ) that made images which moved of their own accord . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> this kind of art goes back to the minoan period , when its main theme was the representation of motion in a specific moment . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> these free standing statues were usually marble , but also the form rendered in limestone , bronze , ivory and terracotta . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> the earliest examples of life sized statues of apollo , may be two figures from the ionic sanctuary on the island of delos . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> such statues were found across the greek speaking world , the preponderance of these were found at the sanctuaries of apollo with more than one hundred from the sanctuary of apollo ptoios , boeotia alone . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> the last stage in the development of the kouros type is the late archaic period ( 520 485 bc ) , in which the greek sculpture attained a full knowledge of human anatomy and used to create a relative harmonious whole . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> ranking from the very few bronzes survived to us is the masterpiece bronze piraeus apollo . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> it was found in piraeus , the harbour of athens . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> the statue originally held the bow in its left hand , and a cup of pouring libation in its right hand . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> it probably comes from north eastern peloponnesus . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> the emphasis is given in anatomy , and it is one of the first attempts to represent a kind of motion , and beauty relative to proportions , which appear mostly in post archaic art . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> the statue throws some light on an artistic centre which , with an independently developed harder , simpler and heavier style , restricts ionian influence in athens . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> finally , this is the germ from which the art of polykleitos was to grow two or three generations later . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> at the beginning of the classical period , it was considered that beauty in visible things as in everything else , consisted of symmetry and proportions . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> the artists tried also to represent motion in a specific moment ( myron ) , which may be considered as the reappearance of the dormant minoan element . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> anatomy and geometry are fused in one , and each does something to the other . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> the greek sculptors tried to clarify it by looking for mathematical proportions , just as they sought some reality behind appearances . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> polykleitos in his canon wrote that beauty consists in the proportion not of the elements ( materials ) , but of the parts , that is the interrelation of parts with one another and with the whole . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> it seems that he was influenced by the theories of pythagoras . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> the famous apollo of mantua and its variants are early forms of the apollo citharoedus statue type , in which the god holds the cithara in his left arm . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> the type is represented by neo attic imperial roman copies of the late 1st or early 2nd century , modelled upon a supposed greek bronze original made in the second quarter of the 5th century bce , in a style similar to works of polykleitos but more archaic . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> the apollo held the cythara against his extended left arm , of which in the louvre example , a fragment of one twisting scrolling horn upright remains against his biceps . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> though the proportions were always important in greek art , the appeal of the greek sculptures eludes any explanation by proportion alone . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> the statues of apollo were thought to incarnate his living presence , and these representations of illusive imaginative reality had deep roots in the minoan period , and in the beliefs of the first greek speaking people who entered the region during the bronze age . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> just as the greeks saw the mountains , forests , sea and rivers as inhabited by concrete beings , so nature in all of its manifestations possesses clear form , and the form of a work of art . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> spiritual life is incorporated in matter , when it is given artistic form . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> just as in the arts the greeks sought some reality behind appearances , so in mathematics they sought permanent principles which could be applied wherever the conditions were the same . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> artists and sculptors tried to find this ideal order in relation with mathematics , but they believed that this ideal order revealed itself not so much to the dispassionate intellect , as to the whole sentient self . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> things as we see them , and as they really are , are one , that each stresses the nature of the other in a single unity . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> in the archaic pediments and friezes of the temples , the artists had a problem to fit a group of figures into an isosceles triangle with acute angles at the base . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> the siphnian treasury in delphi was one of the first greek buildings utilizing the solution to put the dominating form in the middle , and to complete the descending scale of height with other figures sitting or kneeling . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> the pediment shows the story of heracles stealing apollo s tripod that was strongly associated with his oracular inspiration . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> their two figures hold the centre . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> in the pediment of the temple of zeus in olympia , the single figure of apollo is dominating the scene . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> these representations rely on presenting scenes directly to the eye for their own visible sake . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> they care for the schematic arrangements of bodies in space , but only as parts in a larger whole . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> while each scene has its own character and completeness it must fit into the general sequence to which it belongs . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> in these archaic pediments the sculptors use empty intervals , to suggest a passage to and from a busy battlefield . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> the artists seem to have been dominated by geometrical pattern and order , and this was improved when classical art brought a greater freedom and economy . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> apollo as a handsome beardless young man , is often depicted with a kithara ( as apollo citharoedus ) or bow in his hand , or reclining on a tree ( the apollo lykeios and apollo sauroctonos types ) . <end>

<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> early in his career , agassi would look to end points quickly by playing first strike tennis , typically by inducing a weak return with a deep , hard shot , and then playing a winner at an extreme angle . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> on the rare occasion that he charged the net , agassi liked to take the ball in the air and hit a swinging volley for a winner . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> his favored groundstroke was his flat , accurate two handed backhand , hit well cross court but especially down the line . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> his forehand was nearly as strong , especially his inside out to the ad court . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> agassi s strength was in dictating play from the baseline , and he was able to consistently take the ball on the rise . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> while he was growing up , his father and nick bollettieri trained him in this way . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> when in control of a point , agassi would often pass up an opportunity to attempt a winner and hit a conservative shot to minimize his errors , and to make his opponent run more . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> this change to more methodical , less aggressive baseline play was largely initiated by his longtime coach , brad gilbert , in their first year together in 1994 . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> gilbert encouraged agassi to wear out opponents with his deep , flat groundstrokes and to use his fitness to win attrition wars , and noted agassi s two handed backhand down the line as his very best shot . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> a signature play later in his career was a change up drop shot to the deuce court after deep penetrating groundstrokes . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> this would often be followed by a passing shot or lob if the opponent was fast enough to retrieve it . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> agassi was raised on hardcourts , but found much of his early major tournament success on the red clay of roland garros , reaching two consecutive finals there early in his career . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> despite grass being his worst surface , his first major win was at the slick grass of wimbledon in 1992 , a tournament that he professed to hating at the time . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> his strongest surface over the course of his career , was indeed hardcourt , where he won six of his eight majors . <end>

<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> austroasiatic languages <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> the austroasiatic languages ( ) , also known as mon khmer ( ) , are a large language family of mainland southeast asia , also scattered throughout parts of india , bangladesh , nepal , and southern china . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> there are around 117 million speakers of austroasiatic languages . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> of these languages , only vietnamese , khmer and mon have a long established recorded history and only vietnamese and khmer have official status as modern national languages ( in vietnam and cambodia , respectively ) . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> in myanmar , the wa language is the de facto official language of wa state . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> santali is recognized as a regional language of india . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> the rest of the languages are spoken by minority groups and have no official status . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> ethnologue identifies 168 austroasiatic languages . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> these form thirteen established families ( plus perhaps shompen , which is poorly attested , as a fourteenth ) , which have traditionally been grouped into two , as mon khmer and munda . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> however , one recent classification posits three groups ( munda , nuclear mon khmer and khasi khmuic ) , while another has abandoned mon khmer as a taxon altogether , making it synonymous with the larger family . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> austroasiatic languages have a disjunct distribution across southeast asia and parts of india , bangladesh , nepal and east asia , separated by regions where other languages are spoken . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> they appear to be the extant autochthonous languages of southeast asia ( excluding the andaman islands ) , with the neighboring indo aryan , kra <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> dai , hmong mien , dravidian , austronesian , and sino tibetan languages being the result of later migrations . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> the name austroasiatic comes from a combination of the latin words for south and asia , hence south asia . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> regarding word structure , austroasiatic languages are well known for having an iambic sesquisyllabic pattern , with basic nouns and verbs consisting of an initial , unstressed , reduced minor syllable followed by a stressed , full syllable . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> this reduction of presyllables has led to a variety among modern languages of phonological shapes of the same original proto austroasiatic prefixes , such as the causative prefix , ranging from cvc syllables to consonant clusters to single consonants . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> as for word formation , most austroasiatic languages have a variety of derivational prefixes , many have infixes , but suffixes are almost completely non existent in most branches except munda , and a few specialized exceptions in other austroasiatic branches . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> the austroasiatic languages are further characterized as having unusually large vowel inventories and employing some sort of register contrast , either between modal ( normal ) voice and breathy ( lax ) voice or between modal voice and creaky voice . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> languages in the pearic branch and some in the vietic branch can have a three or even four way voicing contrast . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> however , some austroasiatic languages have lost the register contrast by evolving more diphthongs or in a few cases , such as vietnamese , tonogenesis . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> vietnamese has been so heavily influenced by chinese that its original austroasiatic phonological quality is obscured and now resembles that of south chinese languages , whereas khmer , which had more influence from sanskrit , has retained a more typically austroasiatic structure . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> much work has been done on the reconstruction of proto mon khmer in harry l . shorto s mon khmer comparative dictionary . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> little work has been done on the munda languages , which are not well documented . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> with their demotion from a primary branch , proto mon khmer becomes synonymous with proto austroasiatic . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> paul sidwell ( 2005 ) reconstructs the consonant inventory of proto mon khmer as follows <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> this is identical to earlier reconstructions except for . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> is better preserved in the katuic languages , which sidwell has specialized in . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> sidwell ( 2011 ) suggests that the likely homeland of austroasiatic is the middle mekong , in the area of the bahnaric and katuic languages ( approximately where modern laos , thailand , and cambodia come together ) , and that the family is not as old as frequently assumed , dating to perhaps 2000 bce . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> peiros ( 2011 ) criticized sidwell s theory heavily and calls it a bunch of contradictions . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> he show with his analysis that the homeland of austroasiatic is somewhere near the yangtze . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> he suggests the sichuan basin as likely homeland of proto austroasiatic before they migrated to other parts of central and southern china and than into southeast asia . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> he further suggests that the family must be as old as proto austronesian and proto sinotibetan or even older . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> georg van driem ( 2011 ) proposes that the homeland of austroasiatic is somewhere in southern china . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> he suggests that the region around the pearl river ( china ) is the likely homeland of the austroasiatic languages and people . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> he further suggests , based on genetic studies , that the migration of kra <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> dai people from taiwan replaced the original austroasiatic language but the effect on the people was only minor . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> local austroasiatic speakers adopted kra dai languages and partially their culture . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> the linguists sagart ( 2011 ) and bellwood ( 2013 ) support the theory of an origin of austroasiatic along the yangtze river in southern china . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> a genetic and linguistic research in 2015 about ancient people in east asia suggest an origin and homeland of austroasiatic in today southern china or even further north . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> linguists traditionally recognize two primary divisions of austroasiatic the mon khmer languages of southeast asia , northeast india and the nicobar islands , and the munda languages of east and central india and parts of bangladesh , parts of nepal . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> however , no evidence for this classification has ever been published . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> each of the families that is written in boldface type below is accepted as a valid clade . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> by contrast , the relationships between these families within austroasiatic are debated . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> in addition to the traditional classification , two recent proposals are given , neither of which accepts traditional mon khmer as a valid unit . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> however , little of the data used for competing classifications has ever been published , and therefore cannot be evaluated by peer review . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> in addition , there are suggestions that additional branches of austroasiatic might be preserved in substrata of acehnese in sumatra ( diffloth ) , the chamic languages of vietnam , and the land dayak languages of borneo ( adelaar 1995 ) . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> diffloth s widely cited original classification , now abandoned by diffloth himself , is used in encyclop dia britannica and except for the breakup of southern mon khmer in ethnologue . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> peiros is a lexicostatistic classification , based on percentages of shared vocabulary . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> this means that languages can appear to be more distantly related than they actually are due to language contact . <end>

<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> other languages with proposed austroasiatic substrata are john peterson ( 2017 ) suggests that pre munda languages may have once dominated the eastern indo gangetic plain , and were then absorbed by indo aryan languages at an early date as indo aryan spread east . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> peterson notes that eastern indo aryan languages display many morphosyntactic features similar to those of munda languages , while western indo aryan languages do not . <end>
<start> paul sidwell ( 2009 ) , in a lexicostatistical comparison of 36 languages which are well known enough to exclude loan words , finds little evidence for internal branching , though he did find an area of increased contact between the bahnaric and katuic languages , such that languages of all branches apart from the geographically distant munda and nicobarese show greater similarity
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> he therefore takes the conservative view that the thirteen branches of austroasiatic should be treated as equidistant on current evidence . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> sidwell blench ( 2011 ) discuss this proposal in more detail , and note that there is good evidence for a khasi palaungic node , which could also possibly be closely related to khmuic . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> if this would the case , sidwell blench suggest that khasic may have been an early offshoot of palaungic that had spread westward . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> sidwell blench ( 2011 ) suggest shompen as an additional branch , and believe that a vieto katuic connection is worth investigating . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> in general , however , the family is thought to have diversified too quickly for a deeply nested structure to have developed , since proto austroasiatic speakers are believed by sidwell to have radiated out from the central mekong river valley relatively quickly . <end>
