<start> a subsequent computational phylogenetic analysis of the austroasiatic language family by sidwell ( 2015b ) suggests that austroasiatic branches may have a loosely nested structure rather than a completely rake like structure , with an east west division ( consisting of munda , khasic , palaungic , and khmuic forming a western group as opposed to all of the other branches ) occurring
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> integrating computational phylogenetic linguistics with recent archaeological findings , paul sidwell ( 2015c ) further expanded his mekong riverine hypothesis by proposing that austroasiatic had ultimately expanded into indochina from the lingnan area of southern china , with the subsequent mekong riverine dispersal taking place after the initial arrival of neolithic farmers from southern china . <end>
<start> sidwell ( 2015c ) tentatively suggests that austroasiatic may have begun to split up 5 , 000 years b . p . during the neolithic transition era of mainland southeast asia , with all the major branches of austroasiatic formed by 4 , 000 b . p . austroasiatic would have had two possible dispersal routes from the western periphery of the pearl
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> both the reconstructed lexicon of proto austroasiatic and the archaeological record clearly show that early austroasiatic speakers around 4 , 000 b . p . cultivated rice and millet , kept livestock such as dogs , pigs , and chickens , and thrived mostly in estuarine rather than coastal environments . <end>
<pad> <pad> <start> at 4 , 500 b . p . , this neolithic package suddenly arrived in indochina from the lingnan area without cereal grains and displaced the earlier pre neolithic hunter gatherer cultures , with grain husks found in northern indochina by 4 , 100 b . p . and in southern indochina by 3 , 800 b . p . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> however , sidwell ( 2015c ) found that iron is not reconstructable in proto austroasiatic , since each austroasiatic branch has different terms for iron that had been borrowed relatively lately from tai , chinese , tibetan , malay , and other languages . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> during the iron age about 2 , 500 b . p . , relatively young austroasiatic branches in indochina such as vietic , katuic , pearic , and khmer were formed , while the more internally diverse bahnaric branch ( dating to about 3 , 000 b . p . ) underwent more extensive internal diversification . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> by the iron age , all of the austroasiatic branches were more or less in their present day locations , with most of the diversification within austroasiatic taking place during the iron age . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> paul sidwell ( 2018 ) considers the austroasiatic language family to have rapidly diversified around 4 , 000 years b . p . during the arrival of rice agriculture in indochina , but notes that the origin of proto austroasiatic itself is older than that date . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> the lexicon of proto austroasiatic can be divided into an early and late stratum . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> the early stratum consists of basic lexicon including body parts , animal names , natural features , and pronouns , while the names of cultural items ( agriculture terms and words for cultural artifacts , which are reconstructable in proto austroasiatic ) form part of the later stratum . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> roger blench ( 2017 ) suggests that vocabulary related to aquatic subsistence strategies ( such as boats , waterways , river fauna , and fish capture techniques ) , can be reconstructed for proto austroasiatic . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> blench ( 2017 ) finds widespread austroasiatic roots for river , valley , boat , fish , catfish sp . , eel , prawn , shrimp ( central austroasiatic ) , crab , tortoise , turtle , otter , crocodile , heron , fishing bird , and fish trap . <end>

<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> as early austroasiatic speakers dispersed rapidly via waterways , they would have encountered speakers of older language families who were already settled in the area , such as sino tibetan . other than latin based alphabets , many austroasiatic languages are written with the khmer , thai , lao , and burmese alphabets . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> vietnamese divergently had an indigenous script based on chinese logographic writing . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> this has since been supplanted by the latin alphabet in the 20th century . <end>

<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> a 2015 analysis using the automated similarity judgment program resulted in possible support for the austro tai ( but emphatically not austric ) languages . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> in this analysis , the supposed austric family was divided into two separate , unrelated clades austro tai and austroasiatic japonic . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> note however that asjp is not widely accepted among historical linguists as an adequate method to establish or evaluate relationships between language families . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> several lexical resemblances are found between the hmong mien and austroasiatic language families ( ratliff 2010 ) , some of which had earlier been proposed by haudricourt ( 1951 ) . <end>

<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> indian linguist suniti kumar chatterji pointed that a specific number of substantives in languages such as hindi , punjabi and bengali were borrowed from munda languages . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> additionally , french linguist jean przyluski suggested a similarity between the tales from the austroasiatic realm and the indian mythological stories of matsyagandha ( from mahabharata ) and the nagas . <end>

<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> according to riccio et al . , the munda people are likely descended from austroasiatic migrants from southeast asia . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> according to zhang et al . , austroasiatic migrations from southeast asia into india took place after the last glacial maximum , circa 10 , 000 years ago . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> arunkumar et al . suggest austroasiatic migrations from southeast asia occurred into northeast india 5 . 2 0 . 6 kya and into east india 4 . 3 0 . 2 kya . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> afroasiatic languages afroasiatic ( afro asiatic ) , also known as afrasian and in older sources as hamito semitic ( chamito semitic ) or semito hamitic , is a large language family of about 300 languages that are spoken predominantly in west asia , north africa , the horn of africa and parts of the sahel . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> though estimations vary widely , it is believed by scholars to have been spoken as a single language around 12 , 000 to 18 , 000 years ago , making it the oldest established language family in the world . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> afroasiatic languages have over 495 million native speakers , the fourth largest number of any language family ( after indo european , sino tibetan and niger congo ) . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> the phylum has six branches berber , chadic , cushitic , egyptian , omotic and semitic . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> by far the most widely spoken afroasiatic language or dialect continuum is arabic . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> a de facto group of distinct language varieties within the semitic branch , the languages that evolved from proto arabic have around 313 million native speakers , concentrated primarily in west asia and north africa . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> in addition to languages spoken today , afroasiatic includes several important ancient languages , such as ancient egyptian , which forms a distinct branch of the family , and akkadian , biblical hebrew and old aramaic , all of which are from the semitic branch . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> the original homeland of the afroasiatic family , and when the parent language ( i . e . proto afroasiatic ) was spoken , are yet to be agreed upon by historical linguists . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> proposed locations include north africa , the horn of africa , the eastern sahara and the levant . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> during the early 1800s , linguists grouped the berber , cushitic and egyptian languages within a hamitic phylum , in acknowledgement of these languages genetic relation with each other and with those in the semitic phylum . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> the terms hamitic and semitic were etymologically derived from the book of genesis , which describes various biblical tribes descended from ham and shem , two sons of noah . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> by the 1860s , the main constituent elements within the broader afroasiatic family had been worked out . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> friedrich muller introduced the name hamito semitic for the entire family in his grundriss der sprachwissenschaft ( 1876 ) . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> maurice delafosse ( 1914 ) later coined the term afroasiatic ( often now spelled afro asiatic ) . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> however , it did not come into general use until joseph greenberg ( 1950 ) formally proposed its adoption . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> in doing so , greenberg sought to emphasize the fact that afroasiatic spanned the continents of both africa and asia . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> individual scholars have also called the family erythraean ( tucker 1966 ) and lisramic ( hodge 1972 ) . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> in lieu of hamito semitic , the russian linguist igor diakonoff later suggested the term afrasian , meaning half african , half asiatic , in reference to the geographic distribution of the family s constituent languages . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> the term hamito semitic remains in use in the academic traditions of some european countries . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> scholars generally treat the afroasiatic language family as including the following branches although there is general agreement on these six families , linguists who study afroasiatic raise some points of disagreement , in particular arabic is the most widely spoken afroasiatic language with over 300 million native speakers . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> other widely spoken afroasiatic languages include in the 9th century , the hebrew grammarian judah ibn quraysh of tiaret in algeria was the first to link two branches of afroasiatic together he perceived a relationship between berber and semitic . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> he knew of semitic through his study of arabic , hebrew , and aramaic . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> in the course of the 19th century , europeans also began suggesting such relationships . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> in 1844 , theodor benfey suggested a language family consisting of semitic , berber , and cushitic ( calling the latter ethiopic ) . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> in the same year , t . n . newman suggested a relationship between semitic and hausa , but this would long remain a topic of dispute and uncertainty . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> friedrich muller named the traditional hamito semitic family in 1876 in his grundriss der sprachwissenschaft ( outline of linguistics ) , and defined it as consisting of a semitic group plus a hamitic group containing egyptian , berber , and cushitic he excluded the chadic group . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> it was the egyptologist karl richard lepsius ( 1810 1884 ) who restricted hamitic to the non semitic languages in africa , which are characterized by a grammatical gender system . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> this hamitic language group was proposed to unite various , mainly north african , languages , including the ancient egyptian language , the berber languages , the cushitic languages , the beja language , and the chadic languages . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> unlike muller , lepsius considered that hausa and nama were part of the hamitic group . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> these classifications relied in part on non linguistic anthropological and racial arguments . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> both authors used the skin color , mode of subsistence , and other characteristics of native speakers as part of their arguments that particular languages should be grouped together . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> in 1912 , carl meinhof published die sprachen der hamiten ( the languages of the hamites ) , in which he expanded lepsius s model , adding the fula , maasai , bari , nandi , sandawe and hadza languages to the hamitic group . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> meinhof s model was widely supported into the 1940s . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> meinhof s system of classification of the hamitic languages was based on a belief that speakers of hamitic became largely coterminous with cattle herding peoples with essentially caucasian origins , intrinsically different from and superior to the negroes of africa . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> however , in the case of the so called nilo hamitic languages ( a concept he introduced ) , it was based on the typological feature of gender and a fallacious theory of language mixture . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> meinhof did this although earlier work by scholars such as lepsius and johnston had substantiated that the languages which he would later dub nilo hamitic were in fact nilotic languages , with numerous similarities in vocabulary to other nilotic languages . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> leo reinisch ( 1909 ) had already proposed linking cushitic and chadic , while urging their more distant affinity with egyptian and semitic . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> however , his suggestion found little acceptance . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> marcel cohen ( 1924 ) rejected the idea of a distinct hamitic subgroup , and included hausa ( a chadic language ) in his comparative hamito semitic vocabulary . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> finally , joseph greenberg s 1950 work led to the widespread rejection of hamitic as a language category by linguists . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> greenberg refuted meinhof s linguistic theories , and rejected the use of racial and social evidence . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> in dismissing the notion of a separate nilo hamitic language category in particular , greenberg was returning to a view widely held a half century earlier . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> he consequently rejoined meinhof s so called nilo hamitic languages with their appropriate nilotic siblings . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> he also added ( and sub classified ) the chadic languages , and proposed the new name afroasiatic for the family . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> almost all scholars have accepted this classification as the new and continued consensus . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> greenberg s model was fully developed in his book the languages of africa ( 1963 ) , in which he reassigned most of meinhof s additions to hamitic to other language families , notably nilo saharan . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> following isaac schapera and rejecting meinhof , he classified the khoekhoe language as a member of the khoisan languages , a grouping that has since proven inaccurate and excessively motivated on the presence of click sounds . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> to khoisan he also added the tanzanian hadza and sandawe , though this view has been discredited as linguists working on these languages consider them to be linguistic isolates . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> despite this , greenberg s classification remains a starting point for modern work of many languages spoken in africa , and the hamitic category ( and its extension to nilo hamitic ) has no part in this . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> since the three traditional branches of the hamitic languages ( berber , cushitic and egyptian ) have not been shown to form an exclusive ( monophyletic ) phylogenetic unit of their own , separate from other afroasiatic languages , linguists no longer use the term in this sense . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> each of these branches is instead now regarded as an independent subgroup of the larger afroasiatic family . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> in 1969 , harold fleming proposed that what had previously been known as western cushitic is an independent branch of afroasiatic , suggesting for it the new name omotic . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> this proposal and name have met with widespread acceptance . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> several scholars , including harold fleming and robert hetzron , have since questioned the traditional inclusion of beja in cushitic . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> glottolog does not accept that the inclusion or even unity of omotic has been established , nor that of ongota or the unclassified kujarge . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> it therefore splits off the following groups as small families south omotic , mao , dizoid , gonga <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> gimojan ( north omotic apart from the preceding ) , ongota , kujarge . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> little agreement exists on the subgrouping of the five or six branches of afroasiatic semitic , egyptian , berber , chadic , cushitic , and omotic . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> however , christopher ehret ( 1979 ) , harold fleming ( 1981 ) , and joseph greenberg ( 1981 ) all agree that the omotic branch split from the rest first . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> otherwise afroasiatic is one of the four major language families spoken in africa identified by joseph greenberg in his book the languages of africa ( 1963 ) . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> it is one of the few whose speech area is transcontinental , with languages from afroasiatic s semitic branch also spoken in the middle east and europe . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> there are no generally accepted relations between afroasiatic and any other language family . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> however , several proposals grouping afroasiatic with one or more other language families have been made . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> the best known of these are the following <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> the earliest written evidence of an afroasiatic language is an ancient egyptian inscription dated to c . 3400 bc ( 5 , 400 years ago ) . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> symbols on gerzean ( naqada ii ) pottery resembling egyptian hieroglyphs date back to c . 4000 bc , suggesting an earlier possible dating . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> this gives us a minimum date for the age of afroasiatic . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> however , ancient egyptian is highly divergent from proto afroasiatic ( trombetti 1905 1 2 ) , and considerable time must have elapsed in between them . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> estimates of the date at which the proto afroasiatic language was spoken vary widely . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> they fall within a range between approximately 7 , 500 bc ( 9 , 500 years ago ) , and approximately 16 , 000 bc ( 18 , 000 years ago ) . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> according to igor m . diakonoff ( 1988 33n ) , proto afroasiatic was spoken c . 10 , 000 bc . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> christopher ehret ( 2002 35 36 ) asserts that proto afroasiatic was spoken c . 11 , 000 bc at the latest , and possibly as early as c . 16 , 000 bc . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> these dates are older than those associated with other proto languages . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> the term afroasiatic urheimat ( urheimat meaning original homeland in german ) refers to the hypothetical place where proto afroasiatic language speakers lived in a single linguistic community , or complex of communities , before this original language dispersed geographically and divided into distinct languages . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> afroasiatic languages are today primarily spoken in west asia , north africa , the horn of africa , and parts of the sahel . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> their distribution seems to have been influenced by the sahara pump operating over the last 10 , 000 years . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> there is no agreement when or where the original homeland of this language family existed . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> the main theories of urheimat are the levant , the eastern sahara , north africa and the horn of africa . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> h . ekkehard wolff proposes that proto afroasiatic arose in the fertile crescent between 15 , 000 and 9 , 000 years bc during the neolithic revolution , then migrated to africa around 8 , 000 bc to develop into the egyptian , chadic , omotic , cushitic and berber branches . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> widespread ( though not universal ) features of the afroasiatic languages include one of the most remarkable shared features among the afroasiatic languages is the prefixing verb conjugation ( see the table at the start of this section ) , with a distinctive pattern of prefixes beginning with <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> t n y , and in particular a pattern whereby third singular masculine y <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> is opposed to third singular feminine and second singular t . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> according to ehret ( 1996 ) , tonal languages appear in the omotic and chadic branches of afroasiatic , as well as in certain cushitic languages . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> the semitic , berber and egyptian branches generally do not use tones phonemically . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> the following are some examples of afroasiatic cognates , including ten pronouns , three nouns , and three verbs . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> there are two etymological dictionaries of afroasiatic , one by christopher ehret , and one by vladimir orel and olga stolbova . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> the two dictionaries disagree on almost everything . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> the following table contains the thirty roots or so ( out of thousands ) that represent a fragile consensus of present research <end>

<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> andorra andorra ( , ) , officially the principality of andorra ( ) , also called the principality of the valleys of andorra ( ) , is a sovereign landlocked microstate on the iberian peninsula , in the eastern pyrenees , bordered by france to the north and spain to the south . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> believed to have been created by charlemagne , andorra was ruled by the count of urgell until 988 , when it was transferred to the roman catholic diocese of urgell , and the present principality was formed by a charter in 1278 . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> it is known as a principality as it is a diarchy headed by two princes the catholic bishop of urgell in catalonia , spain , and the president of france . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> andorra is the sixth smallest nation in europe , having an area of and a population of approximately . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> the andorran people are a romance ethnic group of originally catalan descent . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> andorra is the 16th smallest country in the world by land and the 11th smallest by population . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> its capital , andorra la vella , is the highest capital city in europe , at an elevation of above sea level . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> the official language is catalan , however , spanish , portuguese , and french are also commonly spoken . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> tourism in andorra sees an estimated 10 . 2 million visitors annually . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> andorra is not a member of the european union , but the euro is its official currency . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> it has been a member of the united nations since 1993 . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> in 2013 , andorra had the highest life expectancy in the world at 81 years , according to the global burden of disease study . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> the origin of the word andorra is unknown , although several hypotheses have been formulated . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> the oldest derivation of the word andorra is from the greek historian polybius ( the histories iii , 35 , 1 ) who describes the andosins , an iberian pre roman tribe , as historically located in the valleys of andorra and facing the carthaginian army in its passage through the pyrenees during the punic wars . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> the word andosini or andosins ( ) may derive from the basque handia whose meaning is big or giant . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> the andorran toponymy shows evidence of basque language in the area . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> another theory suggests that the word andorra may derive from the old word anorra that contains the basque word ur ( water ) . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> another theory suggests that andorra may derive from arabic al durra , meaning the forest ( ) . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> when the moors conquered the iberian peninsula , the valleys of the pyrenees were covered by large tracts of forest , and other regions and towns , also administered by muslims , received this designation . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> other theories suggest that the term derives from the navarro aragonese andurrial , which means land covered with bushes or scrubland . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> the folk etymology holds that charlemagne had named the region as a reference to the biblical canaanite valley of endor or andor ( where the midianites had been defeated ) , a name also bestowed by his heir and son louis le debonnaire after defeating the moors in the wild valleys of hell . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> la balma de la margineda , found by archaeologists at sant julia de loria , was first settled in 9 , 500 bc as a passing place between the two sides of the pyrenees . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> the seasonal camp was perfectly located for hunting and fishing by the groups of hunter gatherers from ariege and segre . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> during the neolithic age , a group of people moved to the valley of madriu ( nowadays natural parc located in escaldes engordany declared unesco world heritage site ) as a permanent camp in 6640 bc . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> the population of the valley grew cereals , raised domestic livestock , and developed a commercial trade with people from the segre and occitania . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> other archaeological deposits include the tombs of segudet ( ordino ) and feixa del moro ( sant julia de loria ) both dated in 4900 4300 bc as an example of the urn culture in andorra . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> the model of small settlements began to evolve to a complex urbanism during the bronze age . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> metallurgical items of iron , ancient coins , and relicaries can be found in the ancient sanctuaries scattered around the country . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> the sanctuary of roc de les bruixes ( stone of the witches ) is perhaps the most important archeological complex of this age in andorra , located in the parish of canillo , about the rituals of funerals , ancient scripture and engraved stone murals . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> the inhabitants of the valleys were traditionally associated with the iberians and historically located in andorra as the iberian tribe andosins or andosini ( ) during the 7th and 2nd centuries bc . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> influenced by aquitanias , basque and iberian languages , the locals developed some current toponyms . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> early writings and documents relating to this group of people goes back to the second century bc by the greek writer polybius in his histories during the punic wars . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> some of the most significant remains of this era are the castle of the roc d enclar ( part of the early marca hispanica ) , l anxiu in les escaldes and roc de l oral in encamp . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> the presence of roman influence is recorded from the 2nd century bc to the 5th century ad . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> the places found with more roman presence are in camp vermell ( red field ) in sant julia de loria , and in some places in encamp , as well as in the roc d enclar . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> people continued trading , mainly with wine and cereals , with the roman cities of urgellet ( nowaday la seu d urgell ) and all across segre through the via romana strata ceretana ( also known as strata confluetana ) . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> after the fall of the roman empire , andorra came under the influence of the visigoths , not remotely from the kingdom of toledo , but locally from the diocese of urgell . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> the visigoths remained in the valleys for 200 years , during which time christianity spread . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> when the muslim empire and its conquest of most of the iberian peninsula replaced the ruling visigoths , andorra was sheltered from these invaders by the franks . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> tradition holds that charles the great ( charlemagne ) granted a charter to the andorran people for a contingent of five thousand soldiers under the command of marc almugaver , in return for fighting against the moors near porte puymorens ( cerdanya ) . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> andorra remained part of the marca hispanica of the frankish empire being part of the territory ruled by the count of urgell and eventually by the bishop of the diocese of urgell . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> also tradition holds that it was guaranteed by the son of charlemagne , <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> louis the pious , writing the carta de poblament or a local municipal charter circa 805 . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> in 988 , borrell ii , count of urgell , gave the andorran valleys to the diocese of urgell in exchange for land in cerdanya . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> since then , the bishop of urgell , based in seu d urgell , has been co prince of andorra . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> the first document that mentions andorra as a territory is the acta de consagracio i dotacio de la catedral de la <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> seu d urgell ( deed of consecration and endowment of the cathedral of la seu d urgell ) . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> the old document dated from 839 depicts the six old parishes of the andorran valleys and therefore the administrative division of the country . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> before 1095 , andorra did not have any type of military protection and the bishop of urgell , who knew that the count of urgell wanted to reclaim the andorran valleys , asked the lord of caboet for help and protection . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> in 1095 the lord of caboet and the bishop of urgell signed under oath a declaration of their co sovereignty over andorra . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> arnalda , daughter of arnau of caboet , married the viscount of castellbo and both became viscounts of castellbo and cerdanya . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> years later their daughter , ermessenda , married roger bernat ii , the french count of foix . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> they became roger bernat ii and ermessenda i , counts of foix , viscounts of castellbo and cerdanya , and co sovereigns of andorra ( shared with the bishop of urgell ) . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> in the 13th century , a military dispute arose between the bishop of urgell and the count of foix as aftermath of the cathar crusade . <end>
<start> the conflict was resolved in 1278 with the mediation of the king of aragon , pere ii between the bishop and the count , by the signing of the first pareage which provided that andorra s sovereignty be shared between the count of foix ( whose title would ultimately transfer to the french head of state ) and the bishop of urgell ,
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> this gave the principality its territory and political form . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> a second pareage was signed in 1288 after a dispute when the count of foix ordered the construction of a castle in roc d enclar . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> the document was ratified by the noble notary jaume orig of puigcerda and the construction of military structures in the country was prohibited . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> in 1364 the political organization of the country named the figure of the syndic ( now spokesman and president of the parliament ) as representative of the andorrans to their co princes making possible the creation of local departments ( comuns , quarts and veinats ) . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> after being ratified by the bishop francesc tovia and the count jean i , the consell de la terra or consell general de les valls ( general council of the valleys ) was founded in 1419 , the second oldest parliament in europe . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> the syndic andreu d alas and the general council organized the creation of the justice courts ( la cort de justicia ) in 1433 with the co princes and the collection of taxes like foc i lloc ( literally fire and site , a national tax active since then ) . <end>
<start> although we can find remains of ecclesiastical works dating before the 9th century ( sant vicenc d enclar or esglesia de santa coloma ) , andorra developed exquisite romanesque art during the 9th through 14th centuries , particularly in the construction of churches , bridges , religious murals and statues of the virgin and child ( our lady of meritxell being the most
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> nowadays , the romanesque buildings that form part of andorra s cultural heritage stand out in a remarkable way , with an emphasis on esglesia de sant esteve , sant joan de caselles , esglesia de sant miquel d engolasters , sant marti de la cortinada and the medieval bridges of margineda and escalls among many others . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> while the catalan pyrenees were embryonic of the catalan language at the end of the 11th century andorra was influenced by the appearance of that language where it was adopted by proximity and influence even decades before it was expanded by the rest of the crown of aragon . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> the local population based its economy during the middle ages in livestock and agriculture , as well as in furs and weavers . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> later , at the end of the 11th century , the first iron foundries began to appear in northern parishes like ordino , much appreciated by the master artisans who developed the art of the forges , an important economic activity in the country from the 15th century . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> in 1601 the tribunal de corts ( high court of justice ) was created as a result of huguenot rebellions from france , inquisition courts coming from spain and indigenous witchcraft experienced in the country due to the reformation and counter reformation . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> with the passage of time , the co title to andorra passed to the kings of navarre . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> after henry of navarre became king henry iv of france , he issued an edict in 1607 , that established the head of the french state and the bishop of urgell as co princes of andorra . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> during 1617 communal councils form the sometent ( popular militia or army ) to deal with the rise of bandolerisme ( brigandage ) and the consell de la terra was defined and structured in terms of its composition , organization and competences current today . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> andorra continued with the same economic system that it had during the 12th 14th centuries with a large production of metallurgy ( fargues , a system similar to farga catalana ) and with the introduction of tobacco circa 1692 and import trade . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> the fair of andorra la vella was ratified by the co princes in 1371 and 1448 being the most important annual national festival commercially ever since . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> the country had a unique and experienced guild of weavers , <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> confraria de paraires i teixidors , located in escaldes engordany founded in 1604 taking advantage of the thermal waters of the area . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> by that time the country was characterized by the social system of prohoms ( wealthy society ) and casalers ( rest of the population with smaller economic acquisition ) , deriving from the tradition of pubilla and hereu . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> three centuries after its foundation the consell de la <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> terra located its headquarters and the tribunal de corts in casa de la vall in 1702 . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> the manor house built in 1580 served as a noble fortress of the busquets family . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> inside the parliament was placed the closet of the six keys ( armari de les sis claus ) representative of each andorran parish and where the andorran constitution and other documents and laws were kept later on . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> in both guerra dels segadors and guerra de sucesion espanola conflicts , the andorran people ( although professing to be a neutral country ) supported the catalans who saw their rights reduced in 1716 . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> the reaction was the promotion of catalan writings in andorra , with cultural works such as the book of privileges ( llibre de privilegis de 1674 ) , manual digest ( 1748 ) by antoni fiter <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> i rossell or the polita andorra ( 1763 ) by antoni puig . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> after the french revolution in 1809 , napoleon i reestablished the co principate and removed the french medieval tithe . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> in 1812 13 , the first french empire annexed catalonia during the peninsular war ( ) and divided the region into four departements , with andorra as a part of the district of puigcerda . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> in 1814 , a royal decree reestablished the independence and economy of andorra . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> during this period , andorra s late medieval institutions and rural culture remained largely unchanged . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> in 1866 the syndic guillem d areny plandolit led the reformist group in a council general of 24 members elected by suffrage limited to heads of families . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> the council general replaced the aristocratic oligarchy that previously ruled the state . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> the new reform ( ) began after ratification by both co princes and established the basis of the constitution and symbols such as the tricolor flag of andorra . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> a new service economy arose as a demand of the valley inhabitants and began to build infrastructure such as hotels , spa resorts , roads and telegraph lines . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> the authorities of the co princes banned casinos and betting houses throughout the country . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> the ban resulted in an economic conflict for the andorran people . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> the conflict led to the so called revolution of 1881 , when revolutionaries assaulted the house of the syndic on 8 december 1880 , and established the provisional revolutionary council led by joan pla i calvo and pere baro i mas . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> the provisional revolutionary council allowed for the construction of casinos and spas by foreign companies . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> from 7 to 9 june 1881 , the loyalists of canillo and encamp reconquered the parishes of ordino and massana by establishing contact with the revolutionary forces in escaldes engordany . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> after a day of combat the treaty of the bridge of escalls was signed on 10 june . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> the council was replaced and new elections were held . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> the economic situation worsened , as the populace was divided over the the andorran question in relation to the eastern question ) . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> the struggles continued between pro bishops , pro french , and nationalists based on the troubles of canillo in 1882 and 1885 . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> andorra participated in the cultural movement of the catalan renaixenca . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> between 1882 and 1887 , the first academic schools were formed where trilingualism coexisted with the official language , catalan . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> romantic authors from france and spain reported the awakening of the national consciousness of the country . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> jacint verdaguer lived in ordino during the 1880s where he wrote and shared works related to the renaixenca with writer and photographer , joaquim de riba . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> in 1848 , fromental halevy had already premiered the opera le val d andorre to great success in europe , where the national consciousness of the valleys was exposed in the romantic work during the peninsular war . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> andorra declared war on imperial germany during world war i , but did not take part directly in the fighting . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> some andorrans volunteered to take part in the conflict as part of the french legions . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> it remained in an official state of belligerency until 1958 as it was not included in the treaty of versailles . <end>
<start> in 1933 , france occupied andorra following social unrest which occurred before elections due to the revolution of 1933 and the fhasa strikes ( vagues de fhasa ) the revolt led by joves andorrans ( a labour union group related to the spanish cnt and fai ) called for political reforms , the universal suffrage vote of all andorrans and acted in defense
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> the 5 april 1933 <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> joves andorrans seized the andorran parliament . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> these actions were preceded by the arrival of colonel rene jules baulard with 50 gendarmes and the mobilization of 200 local militias or sometent led by the sindic francesc cairat . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> on 6 july 1934 , adventurer and nobleman boris skossyreff , with his promise of freedoms and modernization of the country and wealth through the establishment of a tax haven and foreign investments , received the support of the members of the general council to proclaim himself the sovereign of andorra . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> on 8 july 1934 boris issued a proclamation in urgell , declaring himself boris i , king of andorra , simultaneously declaring war on the bishop of urgell and approving the king s constitution on 10 july . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> he was arrested by the co prince and bishop justi guitart <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> i vilardebo and their authorities on 20 july and ultimately expelled from spain . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> from 1936 until 1940 , a french military detachment of garde mobile led by well known colonel rene jules baulard was garrisoned in andorra to secure the principality against disruption from the spanish civil war and francoist spain and also face the rise of republicanism in the aftermath of the 1933 revolution . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> during the spanish civil war the inhabitants of andorra welcomed refugees from both sides and many of them settled permanently in the country thus contributing to the subsequent economic boom and the entry into the capitalist era of andorra . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> francoist troops reached the andorran border in the later stages of the war . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> during world war ii , andorra remained neutral and was an important smuggling route between vichy france and francoist spain . <end>
<start> at the course of the war , the population , which lived between two states that had declared to be openly fascist , criticized the passivity of the general council to the impediment of entry and expulsion of foreigners or refugees , the crimes for economic interests , the reduction of rights of citizens and be too close or sympathetic to francoism .
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> the general council itself justified its political and diplomatic actions under the survival and protection of andorra s sovereignty , which finally emerged from the two conflicts unscathed . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> thus , certain groups organized themselves to help the victims of nazi oppression coming from europe , while participating in smuggling to help the country survive . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> among the groups that were most prominent there was the hostal palanques evasion network command , in contact with the british mi6 , which helped almost 400 fugitives , among whom were also allied military personnel . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> they remained active between 1941 and 1944 , with certain struggles with pro axis informers and gestapo agents within the country . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> in the capital city there was a smuggling black market network of propaganda , culture and cinematic art not prone to totalitarian regimes , promulgated in some places as the hotel mirador or the casino hotel , as a meeting place for people of ideologies close to andorran and spanish republicanism , and free france . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> the network was maintained after the war , when the film societies were formed , where movies , music and books censored in franco s spain were imported , thus becoming an anti censorship attraction for the catalan or foreign public even within andorra . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> andorran group ( agrupament andorra ) , an anti fascist organization linked to the occitanie s french resistance , accused the french representative ( veguer ) of collaboration with nazism . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> the andorran opening to the capitalist economy resulted in two axes mass tourism and the country s tax exemption . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> the first steps towards the capitalist boom date from the 1930s , with the construction of fhasa and the creation of professional banking with banc agricol ( 1930 ) and credit andorra ( 1949 ) , later with banca mora ( 1952 ) , banca cassany ( 1958 ) and sobanca ( 1960 ) . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> shortly after activities such as skiing and shopping become a tourist attraction , with the inauguration of ski resorts and cultural entities in the late 1930s . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> all in all , a renovated hotel industry has developed . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> on april 1968 a social health insurance system was created ( cass ) . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> the andorran government necessarily involved planning , projection and forecasts for the future with the official visit of the french co prince charles de gaulle in 1967 and 1969 , it was given approval for the economic boom and national demands within the framework of human rights and international openness . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> andorra lived an era commonly known as andorran dream ( in relation to the american dream ) alongside with the trente glorieuses the mass culture rooted the country experiencing radical changes in the economy and culture . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> proof of this event was radio andorra , number one transmitter musical radio station in europe on this period , with guests and speakers of great importance promoting musical hits of chanson francaise , swing , rhythm blues , jazz , rock roll or american country music . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> so much so that andorra achieved a gdp per capita and a life expectancy higher than the most standard countries of the current economy . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> given its relative isolation , andorra has existed outside the mainstream of european history , with few ties to countries other than france , spain and portugal . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> in recent times , however , its thriving tourist industry along with developments in transport and communications have removed the country from its isolation . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> since 1976 the country sees the need to reform andorran institutions due to the anachronisms in the field of sovereignty , human rights and the balance of powers as well as the need to adapt legislation to modern demands . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> in 1982 a first separation of powers took place when instituting the govern d andorra , under the name of executive board ( consell executiu ) , chaired by the first prime minister oscar ribas reig with the approval of the co princes . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> in 1989 the principality signed an agreement with the european economic community to regularize trade relations . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> its political system was modernized in 1993 after the andorran constitutional referendum , when the constitution was drafted by the co princes and the general council and approved on 14 march by 74 . 2 of voters , with a 76 turnout . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> the first elections under the new constitution were held later in the year . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> the same year andorra became a member of the united nations and the council of europe . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> andorra formalized diplomatic relations with the united states in 1996 participating in the 51st un general assembly , a very important fact in view of the normalization that the country aspired to . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> first general syndic marc forne took part on a speech in catalan in the general assembly to defend the reform of the organization , and after three days forne took part in the parliamentary assembly of the council of europe to defend the linguistic rights and the economy of andorra . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> in mid 2006 the monetary agreement with the european union is formalized , which allows andorra to use the euro in an official way , as well as coin its own euro currency . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> andorra is a parliamentary co principality with the president of france and the catholic bishop of urgell ( catalonia , spain ) as co princes . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> this peculiarity makes the president of france , in his capacity as prince of andorra , an elected reigning monarch , although he is not elected by a popular vote of the andorran people . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> the politics of andorra take place in a framework of a parliamentary representative democracy , whereby the head of government is the chief executive , and of a pluriform multi party system . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> the current head of government is antoni marti of the democrats for andorra ( da ) . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> executive power is exercised by the government . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> legislative power is vested in both government and parliament . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> the parliament of andorra is known as the general council . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> the general council consists of between 28 and 42 councillors . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> the councillors serve for four year terms , and elections are held between the 30th and 40th days following the dissolution of the previous council . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> half are elected in equal numbers by each of the seven administrative parishes , and the other half of the councillors are elected in a single national constituency . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> fifteen days after the election , the councillors hold their inauguration . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> during this session , the syndic general , who is the head of the general council , and the subsyndic general , his assistant , are elected . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> eight days later , the council convenes once more . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> during this session the head of government is chosen from among the councillors . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> candidates can be proposed by a minimum of one fifth of the councillors . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> the council then elects the candidate with the absolute majority of votes to be head of government . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> the syndic general then notifies the co princes , who in turn appoint the elected candidate as the head of government of andorra . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> the general council is also responsible for proposing and passing laws . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> bills may be presented to the council as private members bills by three of the local parish councils jointly or by at least one tenth of the citizens of andorra . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> the council also approves the annual budget of the principality . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> the government must submit the proposed budget for parliamentary approval at least two months before the previous budget expires . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> if the budget is not approved by the first day of the next year , the previous budget is extended until a new one is approved . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> once any bill is approved , the syndic general is responsible for presenting it to the co princes so that they may sign and enact it . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> if the head of government is not satisfied with the council , he may request that the co princes dissolve the council and order new elections . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> in turn , the councillors have the power to remove the head of government from office . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> after a motion of censure is approved by at least one fifth of the councillors , the council will vote and if it receives the absolute majority of votes , the head of government is removed . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> the judiciary is composed of the magistrates court , the criminal law court , the high court of andorra , and the constitutional court . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> the high court of justice is composed of five judges one appointed by the head of government , one each by the co princes , one by the syndic general , and one by the judges and magistrates . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> it is presided over by the member appointed by the syndic general and the judges hold office for six year terms . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> the magistrates and judges are appointed by the high court , as is the president of the criminal law court . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> the high court also appoints members of the office of the attorney general . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> the constitutional court is responsible for interpreting the constitution and reviewing all appeals of unconstitutionality against laws and treaties . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> it is composed of four judges , one appointed by each of the co princes and two by the general council . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> they serve eight year terms . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> the court is presided over by one of the judges on a two year rotation so that each judge at one point will preside over the court . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> andorra does not have its own armed forces , although there is a small ceremonial army . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> responsibility for defending the nation rests primarily with france and spain . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> however , in case of emergencies or natural disasters , the sometent ( an alarm ) is called and all able bodied men between 21 and 60 of andorran nationality must serve . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> this is why all andorrans , and especially the head of each house ( usually the eldest able bodied man of a house ) should , by law , keep a rifle , even though the law also states that the police will offer a firearm in case of need . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> andorra is a full member of the united nations ( un ) , the organization for security and co operation in europe ( osce ) , and has a special agreement with the european union ( eu ) . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> andorra has a small army , which has historically been raised or reconstituted at various dates , but has never in modern times amounted to a standing army . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> the basic principle of andorran defence is that all able bodied men are available to fight if called upon by the sounding of the sometent . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> being a landlocked country , andorra has no navy . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> prior to world war i , andorra maintained an armed force of about 600 part time militiamen under the supervision of a captain ( capita or cap de sometent ) and a lieutenant ( desener or lloctinent del capita ) . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> this body was not liable for service outside the principality and was commanded by two officials ( veguers ) appointed by france and the bishop of urgell . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> despite not being involved in any fighting during the first world war , andorra was technically the longest combatant , as the country was left out of the versailles peace conference , technically remaining at war with germany from its original declaration of war in 1914 until 24 september 1958 when andorra officially declared peace with germany . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> in the modern era , the army has consisted of a very small body of volunteers willing to undertake ceremonial duties . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> uniforms and weaponry were handed down from generation to generation within families and communities . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> the army s role in internal security was largely taken over by the formation of the police corps of andorra in 1931 . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> brief civil disorder associated with the elections of 1933 led to assistance being sought from the french national gendarmerie , with a detachment resident in andorra for two months under the command of rene jules baulard . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> the andorran police was reformed in the following year , with eleven soldiers appointed to supervisory roles . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> the force consisted of six corporals , one for each parish ( although there are currently seven parishes , there were only six until 1978 ) , plus four junior staff officers to co ordinate action , and a commander with the rank of major . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> it was the responsibility of the six corporals , each in his own parish , to be able to raise a fighting force from among the able bodied men of the parish . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> today a small , twelve man ceremonial unit remains the only permanent section of the sometent , but all able bodied men remain technically available for military service , with a requirement for each family to have access to a firearm . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> the army has not fought for more than 700 years , and its main responsibility is to present the flag of andorra at official ceremonial functions . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> according to marc forne molne , andorra s military budget is strictly from voluntary donations , and the availability of full time volunteers . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> in more recent times there has only been a general emergency call to the popular army of sometent during the floods of 1982 in the catalan pyrenees , where 12 citizens perished in andorra , to help the population and establish a public order along with the local police units . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> andorra maintains a small but modern and well equipped internal police force , with around 240 police officers supported by civilian assistants . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> the principal services supplied by the corps are uniformed community policing , criminal detection , border control , and traffic policing . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> there are also small specialist units including police dogs , mountain rescue , and a bomb disposal team . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> the grup d intervencio policia d andorra ( gipa ) is a small special forces unit trained in counter terrorism , and hostage recovery tasks . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> although it is the closest in style to an active military force , it is part of the police corps , and not the army . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> as terrorist and hostage situations are a rare threat to the country , the gipa is commonly assigned to prisoner escort duties , and at other times to routine policing . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> the andorran fire brigade , with headquarters at santa coloma , operates from four modern fire stations , and has a staff of around 120 firefighters . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> the service is equipped with 16 heavy appliances ( fire tenders , turntable ladders , and specialist four wheel drive vehicles ) , four light support vehicles ( cars and vans ) and four ambulances . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> historically , the families of the six ancient parishes of andorra maintained local arrangements to assist each other in fighting fires . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> the first fire pump purchased by the government was acquired in 1943 . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> serious fires which lasted for two days in december 1959 led to calls for a permanent fire service , and the andorran fire brigade was formed on 21 april 1961 . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> the fire service maintains full time cover with five fire crews on duty at any time two at the brigade s headquarters in santa coloma , and one crew at each of the other three fire stations . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> andorra consists of seven parishes due to its location in the eastern pyrenees mountain range , andorra consists predominantly of rugged mountains , the highest being the coma pedrosa at , and the average elevation of andorra is . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> these are dissected by three narrow valleys in a y shape that combine into one as the main stream , the gran valira river , leaves the country for spain ( at andorra s lowest point of ) . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> andorra s land area is . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> phytogeographically , andorra belongs to the atlantic european province of the circumboreal region within the boreal kingdom . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> according to the wwf , the territory of andorra belongs to the ecoregion of pyrenees conifer and mixed forests . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> andorra has alpine , continental and oceanic climates , depending on altitude . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> its higher elevation means there is , on average , more snow in winter and it is slightly cooler in summer . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> the diversity of landmarks , the different orientation of the valleys and the irregularity relief typical of the mediterranean climates make the country have a great diversity of microclimates that hinder the general dominance of the high mountain climate . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> the great differences of altitude in the minimum and maximum points , together with the influence of a mediterranean climate , develop the climate of the andorran pyrenees . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> when in precipitation , a global model characterized by convective and abundant rains can be defined during spring and summer , which can last until autumn ( may , june and august are usually the rainiest months ) <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> in winter , however , it is less rainy , except in the highlands , subject to the influence of fronts from the atlantic , which explains the great amount of snowfall in the andorran mountains . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> the temperature regime is characterized , broadly , by a temperate summer and a long and cold winter in accordance with the mountainous condition of the principality . tourism , the mainstay of andorra s tiny , well to do economy , accounts for roughly 80 of gdp . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> an estimated 10 . 2 million tourists visit annually , attracted by andorra s duty free status and by its summer and winter resorts . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> one of the main sources of income in andorra is tourism from ski resorts which total over of ski ground . <end>

<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> the financial system comprises five banking groups , one specialised credit entity , 8 investment undertaking management entities , 3 asset management companies and 29 insurance companies , 14 of which are branches of foreign insurance companies authorised to operate in the principality . <end>

<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> andorra is not a member of the european union , but enjoys a special relationship with it , such as being treated as an eu member for trade in manufactured goods ( no tariffs ) and as a non eu member for agricultural products . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> andorra lacked a currency of its own and used both the french franc and the spanish peseta in banking transactions until 31 december 1999 , when both currencies were replaced by the eu s single currency , the euro . <end>

<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> however , during the european sovereign debt crisis of the 21st century , its tourist economy suffered a decline , partly caused by a drop in the prices of goods in spain , which undercut andorran duty free shopping . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> this led to a growth in unemployment . <end>

<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> on 31 may 2013 , it was announced that andorra intended to legislate for the introduction of an income tax by the end of june , against a background of increasing dissatisfaction with the existence of tax havens among eu members . <end>

<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> arithmetic mean <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> in mathematics and statistics , the arithmetic mean ( , stress on third syllable of arithmetic ) , or simply the mean or average when the context is clear , is the sum of a collection of numbers divided by the count of numbers in the collection . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> the collection is often a set of results of an experiment or an observational study , or frequently a set of results from a survey . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> the term arithmetic mean is preferred in some contexts in mathematics and statistics because it helps distinguish it from other means , such as the geometric mean and the harmonic mean . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> in addition to mathematics and statistics , the arithmetic mean is used frequently in many diverse fields such as economics , anthropology , and history , and it is used in almost every academic field to some extent . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> for example , per capita income is the arithmetic average income of a nation s population . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> while the arithmetic mean is often used to report central tendencies , it is not a robust statistic , meaning that it is greatly influenced by outliers ( values that are very much larger or smaller than most of the values ) . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> notably , for skewed distributions , such as the distribution of income for which a few people s incomes are substantially greater than most people s , the arithmetic mean may not coincide with one s notion of middle , and robust statistics , such as the median , may be a better description of central tendency . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> the arithmetic mean ( or mean or average ) , formula 1 ( read formula 2 bar ) , is the mean of the formula 3 values formula 4 . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> the arithmetic mean is the most commonly used and readily understood measure of central tendency in a data set . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> in statistics , the term average refers to any of the measures of central tendency . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> the arithmetic mean of a set of observed data is defined as being equal to the sum of the numerical values of each and every observation divided by the total number of observations . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> symbolically , if we have a data set consisting of the values formula 5 , then the arithmetic mean formula 6 is defined by the formula ( see summation for an explanation of the summation operator ) . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> for example , consider the monthly salary of 10 employees of a firm 2500 , 2700 , 2400 , 2300 , 2550 , 2650 , 2750 , 2450 , 2600 , 2400 . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> the arithmetic mean is if the data set is a statistical population ( i . e . , consists of every possible observation and not just a subset of them ) , then the mean of that population is called the population mean . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> if the data set is a statistical sample ( a subset of the population ) , we call the statistic resulting from this calculation a sample mean . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> the arithmetic mean has several properties that make it useful , especially as a measure of central tendency . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> these include the arithmetic mean may be contrasted with the median . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> the median is defined such that no more than half the values are larger than , and no more than half are smaller than , the median . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> if elements in the data increase arithmetically , when placed in some order , then the median and arithmetic average are equal . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> for example , consider the data sample formula 15 . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> the average is formula 16 , as is the median . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> however , when we consider a sample that cannot be arranged so as to increase arithmetically , such as formula 17 , the median and arithmetic average can differ significantly . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> in this case , the arithmetic average is 6 . 2 and the median is 4 . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> in general , the average value can vary significantly from most values in the sample , and can be larger or smaller than most of them . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> there are applications of this phenomenon in many fields . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> for example , since the 1980s , the median income in the united states has increased more slowly than the arithmetic average of income . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> a weighted average , or weighted mean , is an average in which some data points count more heavily than others , in that they are given more weight in the calculation . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> for example , the arithmetic mean of formula 18 and formula 19 is formula 20 , or equivalently formula 21 . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> in contrast , a weighted mean in which the first number receives , for example , twice as much weight as the second ( perhaps because it is assumed to appear twice as often in the general population from which these numbers were sampled ) would be calculated as formula 22 . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> here the weights , which necessarily sum to the value one , are formula 23 and formula 24 , the former being twice the latter . <end>
<pad> <start> the arithmetic mean ( sometimes called the unweighted average or equally weighted average ) can be interpreted as a special case of a weighted average in which all the weights are equal to each other ( equal to formula 25 in the above example , and equal to formula 26 in a situation with formula 3 numbers being averaged ) . <end>
<start> if a numerical property , and any sample of data from it , could take on any value from a continuous range , instead of , for example , just integers , then the probability of a number falling into some range of possible values can be described by integrating a continuous probability distribution across this range , even when the naive probability
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> the analog of a weighted average in this context , in which there are an infinite number of possibilities for the precise value of the variable in each range , is called the mean of the probability distribution . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> a most widely encountered probability distribution is called the normal distribution it has the property that all measures of its central tendency , including not just the mean but also the aforementioned median and the mode ( the three m s ) , are equal to each other . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> this equality does not hold for other probability distributions , as illustrated for the lognormal distribution here . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> particular care must be taken when using cyclic data , such as phases or angles . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> naively taking the arithmetic mean of 1 and 359 yields a result of 180 . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> this is incorrect for two reasons in general application , such an oversight will lead to the average value artificially moving towards the middle of the numerical range . <end>
<start> a solution to this problem is to use the optimization formulation ( viz . , define the mean as the central point the point about which one has the lowest dispersion ) , and redefine the difference as a modular distance ( i . e . , the distance on the circle so the modular distance between 1 and 359 is 2 ,
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> the arithmetic mean is often denoted by a bar , for example as in formula 1 ( read formula 2 bar ) . <end>
