<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> for example , the x symbol in html is actually a combination of two codes the base letter x plus a code for the line above ( 772 or ) . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> in some texts , such as pdfs , the x symbol may be replaced by a cent ( ) symbol ( unicode 162 ) when copied to text processor such as microsoft word . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> american football conference <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> the american football conference ( afc ) is one of the two conferences of the national football league ( nfl ) , the highest professional level of american football in the united states . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> this conference and its counterpart the national football conference ( nfc ) , currently contain 16 teams organized into 4 divisions . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> both conferences were created as part of the 1970 merger with the rival american football league ( afl ) , with all ten of the former afl teams and three nfl teams forming the afc , and the remaining thirteen nfl clubs forming the nfc . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> a series of league expansions and division realignments have occurred since the merger , thus making the current total of 16 clubs in each conference . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> the current afc champions are the new england patriots , who defeated the kansas city chiefs in the 2018 afc championship game for their 11th conference championship . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> since 2002 , like the nfc , the afc has 16 teams , organized into four divisions each with four teams east , north , south and west . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> currently , the thirteen opponents each team faces over the 16 game regular season schedule are set using a pre determined formula each afc team plays the other teams in their respective division twice ( home and away ) during the regular season , in addition to 10 other games assigned to their schedule by the nfl . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> two of these games are assigned on the basis of a particular team s final divisional standing from the previous season . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> the remaining 8 games are split between the roster of two other nfl divisions . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> this assignment shifts each year and will follow a standard cycle . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> using the 2012 regular season schedule as an example , each team in the afc west plays against every team in the afc north and nfc south . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> in this way , non divisional competition will be mostly among common opponents <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> the exception being the two games assigned based on the team s prior season divisional standing . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> at the end of each season , the four division winners and two wild cards ( non division winners with best regular season record ) in the afc qualify for the playoffs . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> the afc playoffs culminate in the afc championship game with the winner receiving the lamar hunt trophy . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> the afc champion then plays the nfc champion in the super bowl . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> both the afc and the nfc were created after the nfl merged with the american football league ( afl ) in 1970 . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> the afl began play in 1960 with eight teams , and added two more expansion clubs ( the miami dolphins in 1966 and the cincinnati bengals in 1968 ) before the merger . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> in order to equalize the number of teams in each conference , three nfl teams that predated the afl s launch ( the cleveland browns , pittsburgh steelers , and the then baltimore colts ) joined the ten former afl teams to form the afc . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> the two afl divisions afl east and afl west were more or less intact , while the nfl s century division , in which the browns and the steelers had played since 1967 , was moved from the nfl to become the new afc central . <end>
<start> upon the completion of the merger of the afl and nfl in 1970 , the newly minted american football conference had already agreed upon their divisional setup along mostly geographical lines for the 1970 season the national football conference , however , could not agree upon their setup , and one was chosen from a fishbowl on january 16 , 1970 . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> since the merger , five expansion teams have joined the afc and two have left , thus making the current total 16 . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> when the seattle seahawks and the tampa bay buccaneers joined the league in 1976 , they were temporarily placed in the nfc and afc respectively . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> this arrangement lasted for one season only before the two teams switched conferences . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> the seahawks eventually returned to the nfc as a result of the 2002 realignment . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> the expansion jacksonville jaguars joined the afc in 1995 . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> there have been five teams that have relocated at least once . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> in 1984 , the baltimore colts relocated to indianapolis . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> in 1995 , the cleveland browns had attempted to move to baltimore the resulting dispute between cleveland and the team led to modell establishing the baltimore ravens with the players and personnel from the browns , while the browns were placed in suspended operations before they were reinstated by the nfl . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> the ravens were treated as an expansion team . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> in california , the oakland raiders relocated to los angeles in 1982 , and back to oakland in 1995 , while the san diego chargers moved to los angeles in 2017 . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> the houston oilers moved to tennessee in 1997 , where they were renamed the tennessee oilers . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> the team would change its name again , two years later , to the tennessee titans . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> the nfl would again expand in 2002 , adding the houston texans to the afc . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> with the exception of the aforementioned relocations since that time , the divisional setup has remained static ever since . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> between 1995 and 2018 , the afc has sent less than half of the 16 afc teams to the super bowl with only 7 of the 16 individual teams making it . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> new england patriots ( 10 times ) , denver broncos ( 4 times ) , pittsburgh steelers ( 4 times ) , baltimore ravens ( 2 times ) , indianapolis colts ( 2 times ) , oakland raiders ( 1 time ) , and tennessee titans ( 1 time ) . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> by contrast , the nfc has sent 13 of the 16 nfc teams during that same time frame with only the detroit lions , minnesota vikings , and washington redskins missing out on an appearance in the super bowl . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> 16 of the last 18 afc champions have started one of just three quarterbacks tom brady , peyton manning , and ben roethlisberger in the super bowl . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> the afc has started 5 quarterbacks in the last 18 super bowls , while the nfc has started 15 . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> the merged league created a new logo for the afc that took elements of the old afl logo , specifically the a and the six stars surrounding it . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> the afc logo basically remained unchanged from 1970 to 2009 . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> the 2010 nfl season introduced an updated afc logo , with the most notable revision being the removal of two stars ( leaving four representing the four divisions of the afc ) , and moving the stars inside the letter , similar to the nfc logo . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> animal farm animal farm is an allegorical novella by george orwell , first published in england on 17 august 1945 . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> according to orwell , the fable reflects events leading up to the russian revolution of 1917 and then on into the stalinist era of the soviet union . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> orwell , a democratic socialist , was a critic of joseph stalin and hostile to moscow directed stalinism , an attitude that was critically shaped by his experiences during the spanish civil war . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> the soviet union , he believed , had become a brutal dictatorship , built upon a cult of personality and enforced by a reign of terror . <end>
<start> in a letter to yvonne davet , orwell described animal farm as a satirical tale against stalin ( ) , and in his essay why i write ( 1946 ) , wrote that animal farm was the first book in which he tried , with full consciousness of what he was doing , to fuse political purpose and artistic purpose into one whole
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> the original title was animal farm a fairy story , but u . s . publishers dropped the subtitle when it was published in 1946 , and only one of the translations during orwell s lifetime kept it . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> other titular variations include subtitles like a satire and a contemporary satire . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> orwell suggested the title for the french translation , which abbreviates to ursa , the latin word for bear , a symbol of russia . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> it also played on the french name of the soviet union , . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> orwell wrote the book between november 1943 and february 1944 , when the uk was in its wartime alliance with the soviet union against nazi germany and the british people and intelligentsia held stalin in high esteem , a phenomenon orwell hated . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> the manuscript was initially rejected by a number of british and american publishers , including one of orwell s own , victor gollancz , which delayed its publication . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> it became a great commercial success when it did appear partly because international relations were transformed as the wartime alliance gave way to the cold war . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> time magazine chose the book as one of the 100 best english language novels ( 1923 to 2005 ) it also featured at number 31 on the modern library list of best 20th century novels . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> it won a retrospective hugo award in 1996 and is included in the great books of the western world selection . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> the poorly run manor farm near willingdon , england , is ripened for rebellion from its animal populace by neglect at the hands of the irresponsible and alcoholic farmer mr . jones . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> one night , the exalted boar old major organizes a meeting , at which he calls for the overthrow of humans and teaches the animals a revolutionary song called beasts of england . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> when old major dies , two young pigs , snowball and napoleon , assume command and stage a revolt , driving mr . jones off the farm and renaming the property animal farm . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> they adopt the seven commandments of animalism , the most important of which is , all animals are equal . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> the decree is painted in large letters on one side of the barn . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> snowball teaches the animals to read and write , while napoleon educates young puppies on the principles of animalism . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> food is plentiful , and the farm runs smoothly . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> the pigs elevate themselves to positions of leadership and set aside special food items , ostensibly for their personal health . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> following an unsuccessful attempt by mr . jones and his associates to retake the farm ( later dubbed the battle of the cowshed ) , snowball announces his plans to modernize the farm by building a windmill . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> napoleon has his dogs chase snowball away and he declares himself leader . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> napoleon enacts changes to the governance structure of the farm , replacing meetings with a committee of pigs who will run the farm . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> through a young pig named squealer , napoleon claims credit for the windmill idea . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> the animals work harder with the promise of easier lives with the windmill . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> when the animals find the windmill collapsed after a violent storm , napoleon and squealer convince the animals that snowball is trying to sabotage their project , and begin to purge the farm of animals napoleon accuses of consorting with his old rival . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> when some animals recall the battle of the cowshed , napoleon ( who was nowhere to be found during the battle ) frequently smears snowball as a collaborator of mr . jones , while falsely representing himself as the hero of the battle . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> beasts of england is replaced with an anthem glorifying napoleon , who appears to be adopting the lifestyle of a man . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> the animals remain convinced that they are better off than they were under mr . jones . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> mr . frederick , a neighbouring farmer , attacks the farm , using blasting powder to blow up the restored windmill . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> although the animals win the battle , they do so at great cost , as many , including boxer the workhorse , are wounded . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> boxer eventually collapses while working on the windmill . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> although boxer is clearly taken away in a knacker s van , squealer quickly assures the animals that the van had been purchased from the knacker by an animal hospital and that the previous owner s signboard had not been repainted . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> squealer subsequently reports boxer s death and martyrizes him with a festival the following day . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> however , the truth is that napoleon had engineered the sale of boxer to the knacker , allowing napoleon and his inner circle to acquire money to buy whisky for themselves . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> years pass , the windmill is rebuilt , and another windmill is constructed , which makes the farm a good amount of income . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> however , the ideals which snowball discussed , including stalls with electric lighting , heating , and running water , are forgotten , with napoleon advocating that the happiest animals live simple lives . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> in addition to boxer , many of the animals who participated in the rebellion are dead or old . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> mr . jones , having moved away after giving up on reclaiming his farm , has also died . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> the pigs start to resemble humans , as they walk upright , carry whips , drink alcohol and wear clothes . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> the seven commandments are abridged to just two phrases all animals are equal , but some animals are more equal than others . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> and four legs good , two legs better . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> napoleon holds a dinner party for the pigs and local farmers , with whom he celebrates a new alliance . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> he abolishes the practice of the revolutionary traditions and restores the name the manor farm . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> the men and pigs start playing cards , flattering and praising each other while cheating at the game . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> both napoleon and mr . pilkington , one of the farmers , play the ace of spades at the same time and both sides begin fighting loudly over who cheated first . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> when the animals outside look at the pigs and men , they can no longer distinguish between the two . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> george orwell wrote the manuscript in 1943 and 1944 subsequent to his experiences during the spanish civil war , which he described in homage to catalonia ( 1938 ) . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> in the preface of a 1947 ukrainian edition of animal farm , he explained how escaping the communist purges in spain taught him how easily totalitarian propaganda can control the opinion of enlightened people in democratic countries . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> this motivated orwell to expose and strongly condemn what he saw as the stalinist corruption of the original socialist ideals . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> immediately prior to writing the book , orwell had quit the bbc . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> he was also upset about a booklet for propagandists the ministry of information had put out . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> the booklet included instructions on how to quell ideological fears of the soviet union , such as directions to claim that the red terror was a figment of nazi imagination . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> in the preface , orwell also described the source of the idea of setting the book on a farm orwell initially encountered difficulty getting the manuscript published , largely due to fears that the book might upset the alliance between britain , the united states , and the soviet union . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> four publishers refused one had initially accepted the work but declined it after consulting the ministry of information . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> eventually , secker and warburg published the first edition in 1945 . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> during the second world war , it became clear to orwell that anti soviet literature was not something which most major publishing houses would touch including his regular publisher gollancz . <end>
<start> he also submitted the manuscript to faber and faber , where the poet t . s . eliot ( who was a director of the firm ) rejected it eliot wrote back to orwell praising the book s good writing and fundamental integrity , but declared that they would only accept it for publication if they had some sympathy for the viewpoint which
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> eliot said he found the view not convincing , and contended that the pigs were made out to be the best to run the farm he posited that someone might argue what was needed . . . was not more communism but more public spirited pigs . <end>
<start> orwell let andre deutsch , who was working for nicholson watson in 1944 , read the typescript , and deutsch was convinced that nicholson watson would want to publish it however , they did not , and lectured orwell on what they perceived to be errors in animal farm . in his london letter on 17 april 1944 for partisan review , orwell
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> anti russian books do appear , but mostly from catholic publishing firms and always from a religious or frankly reactionary angle . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> the publisher jonathan cape , who had initially accepted animal farm , subsequently rejected the book after an official at the british ministry of information warned him off although the civil servant who it is assumed gave the order was later found to be a soviet spy . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> writing to leonard moore , a partner in the literary agency of christy moore , publisher jonathan cape explained that the decision had been taken on the advice of a senior official in the ministry of information . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> such flagrant anti soviet bias was unacceptable , and the choice of pigs as the dominant class was thought to be especially offensive . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> it may reasonably be assumed that the important official was a man named peter smollett , who was later unmasked as a soviet agent . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> orwell was suspicious of smollett smolka , and he would be one of the names orwell included in his list of crypto communists and fellow travellers sent to the information research department in 1949 . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> the publisher wrote to orwell , saying frederic warburg also faced pressures against publication , even from people in his own office and from his wife pamela , who felt that it was not the moment for ingratitude towards stalin and the heroic red army , which had played a major part in defeating adolf hitler . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> a russian translation was printed in the paper posev , and in giving permission for a russian translation of animal farm , orwell refused in advance all royalties . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> a translation in ukrainian , which was produced in germany , was confiscated in large part by the american wartime authorities and handed over to the soviet repatriation commission . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> in october 1945 , orwell wrote to frederic warburg expressing interest in pursuing the possibility that the political cartoonist david low might illustrate animal farm . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> low had written a letter saying that he had had a good time with animal farm an excellent bit of satire it would illustrate perfectly . <end>
<start> nothing came of this , and a trial issue produced by secker warburg in 1956 illustrated by john driver was abandoned , but the folio society published an edition in 1984 illustrated by quentin blake and an edition illustrated by the cartoonist ralph steadman was published by secker warburg in 1995 to celebrate the fiftieth anniversary of the first edition of animal farm
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> orwell originally wrote a preface complaining about british self censorship and how the british people were suppressing criticism of the ussr , their world war ii ally <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> although the first edition allowed space for the preface , it was not included , and as of june 2009 most editions of the book have not included it . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> secker and warburg published the first edition of animal farm in 1945 without an introduction . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> however , the publisher had provided space for a preface in the author s proof composited from the manuscript . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> for reasons unknown , no preface was supplied , and the page numbers had to be renumbered at the last minute . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> in 1972 , ian angus found the original typescript titled the freedom of the press , and bernard crick published it , together with his own introduction , in the times literary supplement on 15 september 1972 as how the essay came to be written . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> orwell s essay criticised british self censorship by the press , specifically the suppression of unflattering descriptions of stalin and the soviet government . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> the same essay also appeared in the italian 1976 edition of animal farm with another introduction by crick , claiming to be the first edition with the preface . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> other publishers were still declining to publish it . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> contemporary reviews of the work were not universally positive . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> writing in the american new republic magazine , george soule expressed his disappointment in the book , writing that it puzzled and saddened me . <end>

<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> the allegory turned out to be a creaking machine for saying in a clumsy way things that have been said better directly . <end>
<start> soule believed that the animals were not consistent enough with their real world inspirations , and said , it seems to me that the failure of this book ( commercially it is already assured of tremendous success ) arises from the fact that the satire deals not with something the author has experienced , but rather with stereotyped ideas about a country which
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> the guardian on 24 august 1945 called animal farm a delightfully humorous and caustic satire on the rule of the many by the few . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> tosco fyvel , writing in tribune on the same day , called the book a gentle satire on a certain state and on the illusions of an age which may already be behind us . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> julian symons responded , on 7 september , should we not expect , in tribune at least , acknowledgement of the fact that it is a satire not at all gentle upon a particular state soviet russia ? <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> it seems to me that a reviewer should have the courage to identify napoleon with stalin , and snowball with trotsky , and express an opinion favourable or unfavourable to the author , upon a political ground . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> in a hundred years time perhaps , animal farm may be simply a fairy story , today it is a political satire with a good deal of point . <end>

<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> animal farm has been subject to much comment in the decades since these early remarks . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> the pigs snowball , napoleon , and squealer adapt old major s ideas into a complete system of thought , which they formally name animalism , an allegoric reference to communism , not to be confused with the philosophy animalism . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> soon after , napoleon and squealer partake in activities associated with the humans ( drinking alcohol , sleeping in beds , trading ) , which were explicitly prohibited by the seven commandments . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> squealer is employed to alter the seven commandments to account for this humanisation , an allusion to the soviet government s revising of history in order to exercise control of the people s beliefs about themselves and their society . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> the original commandments are these commandments are also distilled into the maxim four legs good , two legs bad ! which is primarily used by the sheep on the farm , often to disrupt discussions and disagreements between animals on the nature of animalism . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> later , napoleon and his pigs secretly revise some commandments to clear themselves of accusations of law breaking . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> the changed commandments are as follows , with the changes bolded <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> eventually , these are replaced with the maxims , all animals are equal , but some animals are more equal than others , and four legs good , two legs better ! as the pigs become more human . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> this is an ironic twist to the original purpose of the seven commandments , which were supposed to keep order within animal farm by uniting the animals together against the humans and preventing animals from following the humans evil habits . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> through the revision of the commandments , orwell demonstrates how simply political dogma can be turned into malleable propaganda . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> orwell biographer jeffrey meyers has written , virtually every detail has political significance in this allegory . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <start> orwell himself wrote in 1946 , of course i intended it primarily as a satire on the russian revolution . . . and that kind of revolution ( violent conspiratorial revolution , led by unconsciously power hungry people ) can only lead to a change of masters revolutions only effect a radical improvement when the masses are alert . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> in a preface for a 1947 ukrainian edition , he stated , . . . for the past ten years i have been convinced that the destruction of the soviet myth was essential if we wanted a revival of the socialist movement . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> on my return from spain in 1937 i thought of exposing the soviet myth in a story that could be easily understood by almost anyone and which could be easily translated into other languages . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> the revolt of the animals against farmer jones is orwell s analogy with the october 1917 bolshevik revolution . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> the battle of the cowshed has been said to represent the allied invasion of soviet russia in 1918 , and the defeat of the white russians in the russian civil war . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> the pigs rise to pre eminence mirrors the rise of a stalinist bureaucracy in the ussr , just as napoleon s emergence as the farm s sole leader reflects stalin s emergence . <end>

<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> the puppies controlled by napoleon parallel the nurture of the secret police in the stalinist structure , and the pigs treatment of the other animals on the farm recalls the internal terror faced by the populace in the 1930s . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> in chapter seven , when the animals confess their nonexistent crimes and are killed , orwell directly alludes to the purges , confessions and show trials of the late 1930s . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> these contributed to orwell s conviction that the bolshevik revolution had been corrupted and the soviet system become rotten . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> peter edgerly firchow and peter davison consider that the battle of the windmill represents world war ii , especially the battle of stalingrad and the battle of moscow . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> during the battle , orwell first wrote , all the animals , including napoleon took cover . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> orwell had the publisher alter this to all the animals except napoleon in recognition of stalin s decision to remain in moscow during the german advance . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> orwell requested the change after he met joseph czapski in paris in march 1945 . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> czapski , a survivor of the katyn massacre and an opponent of the soviet regime , told orwell , as orwell wrote to arthur koestler , that it had been the character and greatness of stalin that saved russia from the german invasion . <end>

<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> the book s close , with the pigs and men in a kind of rapprochement , reflected orwell s view of the 1943 teheran conference that seemed to display the establishment of the best possible relations between the ussr and the west but in reality were destined , as orwell presciently predicted , to continue to unravel . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> the disagreement between the allies and the start of the cold war is suggested when napoleon and pilkington , both suspicious , played an ace of spades simultaneously . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> similarly , the music in the novel , starting with beasts of england and the later anthems , parallels the internationale and its adoption and repudiation by the soviet authorities as to the anthem of the ussr in the 1920s and 1930s . <end>

<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> this comic was not published in the u . k . but ran in brazilian and burmese newspapers . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> amphibian amphibians are ectothermic , tetrapod vertebrates of the class amphibia . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> modern amphibians are all lissamphibia . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> they inhabit a wide variety of habitats , with most species living within terrestrial , fossorial , arboreal or freshwater aquatic ecosystems . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> thus amphibians typically start out as larvae living in water , but some species have developed behavioural adaptations to bypass this . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> the young generally undergo metamorphosis from larva with gills to an adult air breathing form with lungs . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> amphibians use their skin as a secondary respiratory surface and some small terrestrial salamanders and frogs lack lungs and rely entirely on their skin . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> they are superficially similar to lizards but , along with mammals and birds , reptiles are amniotes and do not require water bodies in which to breed . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> with their complex reproductive needs and permeable skins , amphibians are often ecological indicators in recent decades there has been a dramatic decline in amphibian populations for many species around the globe . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> the earliest amphibians evolved in the devonian period from sarcopterygian fish with lungs and bony limbed fins , features that were helpful in adapting to dry land . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> they diversified and became dominant during the carboniferous and permian periods , but were later displaced by reptiles and other vertebrates . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> over time , amphibians shrank in size and decreased in diversity , leaving only the modern subclass lissamphibia . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> the three modern orders of amphibians are anura ( the frogs and toads ) , urodela ( the salamanders ) , and apoda ( the caecilians ) . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> the number of known amphibian species is approximately 8 , 000 , of which nearly 90 are frogs . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> the smallest amphibian ( and vertebrate ) in the world is a frog from new guinea ( paedophryne amauensis ) with a length of just . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> the largest living amphibian is the chinese giant salamander ( andrias davidianus ) , but this is dwarfed by the extinct prionosuchus from the middle permian of brazil . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> the study of amphibians is called batrachology , while the study of both reptiles and amphibians is called herpetology . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> the word amphibian is derived from the ancient greek term ( amphibios ) , which means both kinds of life , meaning of both kinds and meaning life . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> the term was initially used as a general adjective for animals that could live on land or in water , including seals and otters . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> traditionally , the class amphibia includes all tetrapod vertebrates that are not amniotes . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> amphibia in its widest sense ( sensu lato ) was divided into three subclasses , two of which are extinct the actual number of species in each group depends on the taxonomic classification followed . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> the two most common systems are the classification adopted by the website amphibiaweb , university of california , berkeley and the classification by herpetologist darrel frost and the american museum of natural history , available as the online reference database amphibian species of the world . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> the numbers of species cited above follows frost and the total number of known amphibian species as of march 31 , 2019 is exactly 8 , 000 , of which nearly 90 are frogs . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> with the phylogenetic classification , the taxon labyrinthodontia has been discarded as it is a polyparaphyletic group without unique defining features apart from shared primitive characteristics . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> classification varies according to the preferred phylogeny of the author and whether they use a stem based or a node based classification . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> traditionally , amphibians as a class are defined as all tetrapods with a larval stage , while the group that includes the common ancestors of all living amphibians ( frogs , salamanders and caecilians ) and all their descendants is called lissamphibia . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> the phylogeny of paleozoic amphibians is uncertain , and lissamphibia may possibly fall within extinct groups , like the temnospondyli ( traditionally placed in the subclass labyrinthodontia ) or the lepospondyli , and in some analyses even in the amniotes . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> this means that advocates of phylogenetic nomenclature have removed a large number of basal devonian and carboniferous amphibian type tetrapod groups that were formerly placed in amphibia in linnaean taxonomy , and included them elsewhere under cladistic taxonomy . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> if the common ancestor of amphibians and amniotes is included in amphibia , it becomes a paraphyletic group . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> all modern amphibians are included in the subclass lissamphibia , which is usually considered a clade , a group of species that have evolved from a common ancestor . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> the three modern orders are anura ( the frogs and toads ) , caudata ( or urodela , the salamanders ) , and gymnophiona ( or apoda , the caecilians ) . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> it has been suggested that salamanders arose separately from a temnospondyl like ancestor , and even that caecilians are the sister group of the advanced reptiliomorph amphibians , and thus of amniotes . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> although the fossils of several older proto frogs with primitive characteristics are known , the oldest true frog is prosalirus bitis , from the early jurassic kayenta formation of arizona . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> it is anatomically very similar to modern frogs . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> the oldest known caecilian is another early jurassic species , eocaecilia micropodia , also from arizona . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> the earliest salamander is beiyanerpeton jianpingensis from the late jurassic of northeastern china . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> authorities disagree as to whether salientia is a superorder that includes the order anura , or whether anura is a sub order of the order salientia . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> the lissamphibia are traditionally divided into three orders , but an extinct salamander like family , the albanerpetontidae , is now considered part of lissamphibia alongside the superorder salientia . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> furthermore , salientia includes all three recent orders plus the triassic proto frog , triadobatrachus . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> the first major groups of amphibians developed in the devonian period , around 370 million years ago , from lobe finned fish which were similar to the modern coelacanth and lungfish . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> these ancient lobe finned fish had evolved multi jointed leg like fins with digits that enabled them to crawl along the sea bottom . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> some fish had developed primitive lungs that help them breathe air when the stagnant pools of the devonian swamps were low in oxygen . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> they could also use their strong fins to hoist themselves out of the water and onto dry land if circumstances so required . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> eventually , their bony fins would evolve into limbs and they would become the ancestors to all tetrapods , including modern amphibians , reptiles , birds , and mammals . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> despite being able to crawl on land , many of these prehistoric tetrapodomorph fish still spent most of their time in the water . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> they had started to develop lungs , but still breathed predominantly with gills . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> many examples of species showing transitional features have been discovered . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> ichthyostega was one of the first primitive amphibians , with nostrils and more efficient lungs . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> it had four sturdy limbs , a neck , a tail with fins and a skull very similar to that of the lobe finned fish , eusthenopteron . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> amphibians evolved adaptations that allowed them to stay out of the water for longer periods . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> their lungs improved and their skeletons became heavier and stronger , better able to support the weight of their bodies on land . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> they developed hands and feet with five or more digits the skin became more capable of retaining body fluids and resisting desiccation . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> the fish s hyomandibula bone in the hyoid region behind the gills diminished in size and became the stapes of the amphibian ear , an adaptation necessary for hearing on dry land . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> an affinity between the amphibians and the teleost fish is the multi folded structure of the teeth and the paired supra occipital bones at the back of the head , neither of these features being found elsewhere in the animal kingdom . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> at the end of the devonian period ( 360 million years ago ) , the seas , rivers and lakes were teeming with life while the land was the realm of early plants and devoid of vertebrates , though some , such as ichthyostega , may have sometimes hauled themselves out of the water . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> it is thought they may have propelled themselves with their forelimbs , dragging their hindquarters in a similar manner to that used by the elephant seal . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> in the early carboniferous ( 360 to 345 million years ago ) , the climate became wet and warm . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> extensive swamps developed with mosses , ferns , horsetails and calamites . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> air breathing arthropods evolved and invaded the land where they provided food for the carnivorous amphibians that began to adapt to the terrestrial environment . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> there were no other tetrapods on the land and the amphibians were at the top of the food chain , occupying the ecological position currently held by the crocodile . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> though equipped with limbs and the ability to breathe air , most still had a long tapering body and strong tail . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> they were the top land predators , sometimes reaching several metres in length , preying on the large insects of the period and the many types of fish in the water . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> they still needed to return to water to lay their shell less eggs , and even most modern amphibians have a fully aquatic larval stage with gills like their fish ancestors . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> it was the development of the amniotic egg , which prevents the developing embryo from drying out , that enabled the reptiles to reproduce on land and which led to their dominance in the period that followed . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> after the carboniferous rainforest collapse amphibian dominance gave way to reptiles , and amphibians were further devastated by the permian triassic extinction event . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> during the triassic period ( 250 to 200 million years ago ) , the reptiles continued to out compete the amphibians , leading to a reduction in both the amphibians size and their importance in the biosphere . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> according to the fossil record , lissamphibia , which includes all modern amphibians and is the only surviving lineage , may have branched off from the extinct groups temnospondyli and lepospondyli at some period between the late carboniferous and the early triassic . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> the relative scarcity of fossil evidence precludes precise dating , but the most recent molecular study , based on multilocus sequence typing , suggests a late carboniferous early permian origin for extant amphibians . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> the origins and evolutionary relationships between the three main groups of amphibians is a matter of debate . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> a 2005 molecular phylogeny , based on rdna analysis , suggests that salamanders and caecilians are more closely related to each other than they are to frogs . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> it also appears that the divergence of the three groups took place in the paleozoic or early mesozoic ( around 250 million years ago ) , before the breakup of the supercontinent pangaea and soon after their divergence from the lobe finned fish . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> the briefness of this period , and the swiftness with which radiation took place , would help account for the relative scarcity of primitive amphibian fossils . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> there are large gaps in the fossil record , but the discovery of a gerobatrachus hottoni from the early permian in texas in 2008 provided a missing link with many of the characteristics of modern frogs . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> molecular analysis suggests that the frog salamander divergence took place considerably earlier than the palaeontological evidence indicates . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> newer research indicates that the common ancestor of all lissamphibians lived about 315 million years ago , and that stereospondyls are the closest relatives to the caecilians . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> as they evolved from lunged fish , amphibians had to make certain adaptations for living on land , including the need to develop new means of locomotion . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> in the water , the sideways thrusts of their tails had propelled them forward , but on land , quite different mechanisms were required . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> their vertebral columns , limbs , limb girdles and musculature needed to be strong enough to raise them off the ground for locomotion and feeding . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> terrestrial adults discarded their lateral line systems and adapted their sensory systems to receive stimuli via the medium of the air . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> they needed to develop new methods to regulate their body heat to cope with fluctuations in ambient temperature . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> they developed behaviours suitable for reproduction in a terrestrial environment . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> their skins were exposed to harmful ultraviolet rays that had previously been absorbed by the water . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> the skin changed to become more protective and prevent excessive water loss . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> the superclass tetrapoda is divided into four classes of vertebrate animals with four limbs . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> reptiles , birds and mammals are amniotes , the eggs of which are either laid or carried by the female and are surrounded by several membranes , some of which are impervious . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> lacking these membranes , amphibians require water bodies for reproduction , although some species have developed various strategies for protecting or bypassing the vulnerable aquatic larval stage . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> they are not found in the sea with the exception of one or two frogs that live in brackish water in mangrove swamps the anderson s salamander meanwhile occurs in brackish or salt water lakes . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> on land , amphibians are restricted to moist habitats because of the need to keep their skin damp . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> the smallest amphibian ( and vertebrate ) in the world is a microhylid frog from new guinea ( paedophryne amauensis ) first discovered in 2012 . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> it has an average length of and is part of a genus that contains four of the world s ten smallest frog species . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> the largest living amphibian is the chinese giant salamander ( andrias davidianus ) but this is a great deal smaller than the largest amphibian that ever existed the extinct prionosuchus , a crocodile like temnospondyl dating to 270 million years ago from the middle permian of brazil ! <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> the largest frog is the african goliath frog ( conraua goliath ) , which can reach and weigh . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> amphibians are ectothermic ( cold blooded ) vertebrates that do not maintain their body temperature through internal physiological processes . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> their metabolic rate is low and as a result , their food and energy requirements are limited . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> in the adult state , they have tear ducts and movable eyelids , and most species have ears that can detect airborne or ground vibrations . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> they have muscular tongues , which in many species can be protruded . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> modern amphibians have fully ossified vertebrae with articular processes . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> their ribs are usually short and may be fused to the vertebrae . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> their skulls are mostly broad and short , and are often incompletely ossified . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> their skin contains little keratin and lacks scales , apart from a few fish like scales in certain caecilians . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> the skin contains many mucous glands and in some species , poison glands ( a type of granular gland ) . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> the hearts of amphibians have three chambers , two atria and one ventricle . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> they have a urinary bladder and nitrogenous waste products are excreted primarily as urea . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> most amphibians lay their eggs in water and have aquatic larvae that undergo metamorphosis to become terrestrial adults . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> amphibians breathe by means of a pump action in which air is first drawn into the buccopharyngeal region through the nostrils . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> these are then closed and the air is forced into the lungs by contraction of the throat . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> they supplement this with gas exchange through the skin . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> the order anura ( from the ancient greek a ( n ) meaning without and oura meaning tail ) comprises the frogs and toads . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> they usually have long hind limbs that fold underneath them , shorter forelimbs , webbed toes with no claws , no tails , large eyes and glandular moist skin . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> members of this order with smooth skins are commonly referred to as frogs , while those with warty skins are known as toads . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> the difference is not a formal one taxonomically and there are numerous exceptions to this rule . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> members of the family bufonidae are known as the true toads . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> frogs range in size from the goliath frog ( conraua goliath ) of west africa to the paedophryne amauensis , first described in papua new guinea in 2012 , which is also the smallest known vertebrate . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> although most species are associated with water and damp habitats , some are specialised to live in trees or in deserts . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> they are found worldwide except for polar areas . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> anura is divided into three suborders that are broadly accepted by the scientific community , but the relationships between some families remain unclear . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> future molecular studies should provide further insights into their evolutionary relationships . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> the suborder archaeobatrachia contains four families of primitive frogs . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> these are ascaphidae , bombinatoridae , discoglossidae and leiopelmatidae which have few derived features and are probably paraphyletic with regard to other frog lineages . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> the six families in the more evolutionarily advanced suborder mesobatrachia are the fossorial megophryidae , pelobatidae , pelodytidae , scaphiopodidae and rhinophrynidae and the obligatorily aquatic pipidae . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> these have certain characteristics that are intermediate between the two other suborders . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> neobatrachia is by far the largest suborder and includes the remaining families of modern frogs , including most common species . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> ninety six percent of the over 5 , 000 extant species of frog are neobatrachians . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> the order caudata ( from the latin cauda meaning tail ) consists of the salamanders elongated , low slung animals that mostly resemble lizards in form . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> this is a symplesiomorphic trait and they are no more closely related to lizards than they are to mammals . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> salamanders lack claws , have scale free skins , either smooth or covered with tubercles , and tails that are usually flattened from side to side and often finned . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> they range in size from the chinese giant salamander ( andrias davidianus ) , which has been reported to grow to a length of , to the diminutive thorius pennatulus from mexico which seldom exceeds in length . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> salamanders have a mostly laurasian distribution , being present in much of the holarctic region of the northern hemisphere . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> the family plethodontidae is also found in central america and south america north of the amazon basin south america was apparently invaded from central america by about the start of the miocene , 23 million years ago . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> urodela is a name sometimes used for all the extant species of salamanders . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> members of several salamander families have become paedomorphic and either fail to complete their metamorphosis or retain some larval characteristics as adults . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> most salamanders are under long . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> they may be terrestrial or aquatic and many spend part of the year in each habitat . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> when on land , they mostly spend the day hidden under stones or logs or in dense vegetation , emerging in the evening and night to forage for worms , insects and other invertebrates . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> the suborder cryptobranchoidea contains the primitive salamanders . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> a number of fossil cryptobranchids have been found , but there are only three living species , the chinese giant salamander ( andrias davidianus ) , the japanese giant salamander ( andrias japonicus ) and the hellbender ( cryptobranchus alleganiensis ) from north america . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> these large amphibians retain several larval characteristics in their adult state gills slits are present and the eyes are unlidded . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> a unique feature is their ability to feed by suction , depressing either the left side of their lower jaw or the right . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> the males excavate nests , persuade females to lay their egg strings inside them , and guard them . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> as well as breathing with lungs , they respire through the many folds in their thin skin , which has capillaries close to the surface . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> the suborder salamandroidea contains the advanced salamanders . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> they differ from the cryptobranchids by having fused prearticular bones in the lower jaw , and by using internal fertilisation . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> in salamandrids , the male deposits a bundle of sperm , the spermatophore , and the female picks it up and inserts it into her cloaca where the sperm is stored until the eggs are laid . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> the largest family in this group is plethodontidae , the lungless salamanders , which includes 60 of all salamander species . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> the family salamandridae includes the true salamanders and the name newt is given to members of its subfamily pleurodelinae . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> the third suborder , sirenoidea , contains the four species of sirens , which are in a single family , sirenidae . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> members of this order are eel like aquatic salamanders with much reduced forelimbs and no hind limbs . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> some of their features are primitive while others are derived . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> fertilisation is likely to be external as sirenids lack the cloacal glands used by male salamandrids to produce spermatophores and the females lack spermathecae for sperm storage . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> despite this , the eggs are laid singly , a behaviour not conducive for external fertilisation . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> the order gymnophiona ( from the greek gymnos meaning naked and ophis meaning serpent ) or apoda comprises the caecilians . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> these are long , cylindrical , limbless animals with a snake or worm like form . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> the adults vary in length from 8 to 75 centimetres ( 3 to 30 inches ) with the exception of thomson s caecilian ( caecilia thompsoni ) , which can reach . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> a caecilian s skin has a large number of transverse folds and in some species contains tiny embedded dermal scales . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> it has rudimentary eyes covered in skin , which are probably limited to discerning differences in light intensity . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> it also has a pair of short tentacles near the eye that can be extended and which have tactile and olfactory functions . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> most caecilians live underground in burrows in damp soil , in rotten wood and under plant debris , but some are aquatic . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> most species lay their eggs underground and when the larvae hatch , they make their way to adjacent bodies of water . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> others brood their eggs and the larvae undergo metamorphosis before the eggs hatch . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> a few species give birth to live young , nourishing them with glandular secretions while they are in the oviduct . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> caecilians have a mostly gondwanan distribution , being found in tropical regions of africa , asia and central and south america . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> the structure contains some typical characteristics common to terrestrial vertebrates , such as the presence of highly cornified outer layers , renewed periodically through a moulting process controlled by the pituitary and thyroid glands . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> local thickenings ( often called warts ) are common , such as those found on toads . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> the outside of the skin is shed periodically mostly in one piece , in contrast to mammals and birds where it is shed in flakes . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> amphibians often eat the sloughed skin . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> caecilians are unique among amphibians in having mineralized dermal scales embedded in the dermis between the furrows in the skin . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> the similarity of these to the scales of bony fish is largely superficial . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> lizards and some frogs have somewhat similar osteoderms forming bony deposits in the dermis , but this is an example of convergent evolution with similar structures having arisen independently in diverse vertebrate lineages . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> amphibian skin is permeable to water . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> gas exchange can take place through the skin ( cutaneous respiration ) and this allows adult amphibians to respire without rising to the surface of water and to hibernate at the bottom of ponds . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> to compensate for their thin and delicate skin , amphibians have evolved mucous glands , principally on their heads , backs and tails . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> the secretions produced by these help keep the skin moist . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> in addition , most species of amphibian have granular glands that secrete distasteful or poisonous substances . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> some amphibian toxins can be lethal to humans while others have little effect . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> the main poison producing glands , the paratoids , produce the neurotoxin bufotoxin and are located behind the ears of toads , along the backs of frogs , behind the eyes of salamanders and on the upper surface of caecilians . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> the skin colour of amphibians is produced by three layers of pigment cells called chromatophores . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> these three cell layers consist of the melanophores ( occupying the deepest layer ) , the guanophores ( forming an intermediate layer and containing many granules , producing a blue green colour ) and the lipophores ( yellow , the most superficial layer ) . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> the colour change displayed by many species is initiated by hormones secreted by the pituitary gland . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> unlike bony fish , there is no direct control of the pigment cells by the nervous system , and this results in the colour change taking place more slowly than happens in fish . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> a vividly coloured skin usually indicates that the species is toxic and is a warning sign to predators . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> amphibians have a skeletal system that is structurally homologous to other tetrapods , though with a number of variations . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> they all have four limbs except for the legless caecilians and a few species of salamander with reduced or no limbs . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> the bones are hollow and lightweight . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> the musculoskeletal system is strong to enable it to support the head and body . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> the bones are fully ossified and the vertebrae interlock with each other by means of overlapping processes . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> the pectoral girdle is supported by muscle , and the well developed pelvic girdle is attached to the backbone by a pair of sacral ribs . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> the ilium slopes forward and the body is held closer to the ground than is the case in mammals . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> in most amphibians , there are four digits on the fore foot and five on the hind foot , but no claws on either . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> some salamanders have fewer digits and the amphiumas are eel like in appearance with tiny , stubby legs . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> the sirens are aquatic salamanders with stumpy forelimbs and no hind limbs . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> the caecilians are limbless . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> they burrow in the manner of earthworms with zones of muscle contractions moving along the body . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> on the surface of the ground or in water they move by undulating their body from side to side . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> in frogs , the hind legs are larger than the fore legs , especially so in those species that principally move by jumping or swimming . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> in the walkers and runners the hind limbs are not so large , and the burrowers mostly have short limbs and broad bodies . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> the feet have adaptations for the way of life , with webbing between the toes for swimming , broad adhesive toe pads for climbing , and keratinised tubercles on the hind feet for digging ( frogs usually dig backwards into the soil ) . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> in most salamanders , the limbs are short and more or less the same length and project at right angles from the body . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> locomotion on land is by walking and the tail often swings from side to side or is used as a prop , particularly when climbing . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> in their normal gait , only one leg is advanced at a time in the manner adopted by their ancestors , the lobe finned fish . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> some salamanders in the genus aneides and certain plethodontids climb trees and have long limbs , large toepads and prehensile tails . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> in aquatic salamanders and in frog tadpoles , the tail has dorsal and ventral fins and is moved from side to side as a means of propulsion . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> adult frogs do not have tails and caecilians have only very short ones . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> salamanders use their tails in defence and some are prepared to jettison them to save their lives in a process known as autotomy . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> certain species in the plethodontidae have a weak zone at the base of the tail and use this strategy readily . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> the tail often continues to twitch after separation which may distract the attacker and allow the salamander to escape . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> both tails and limbs can be regenerated . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> adult frogs are unable to regrow limbs but tadpoles can do so . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> amphibians have a juvenile stage and an adult stage , and the circulatory systems of the two are distinct . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> in the juvenile ( or tadpole ) stage , the circulation is similar to that of a fish the two chambered heart pumps the blood through the gills where it is oxygenated , and is spread around the body and back to the heart in a single loop . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> in the adult stage , amphibians ( especially frogs ) lose their gills and develop lungs . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> they have a heart that consists of a single ventricle and two atria . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> when the ventricle starts contracting , deoxygenated blood is pumped through the pulmonary artery to the lungs . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> continued contraction then pumps oxygenated blood around the rest of the body . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> mixing of the two bloodstreams is minimized by the anatomy of the chambers . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> the nervous system is basically the same as in other vertebrates , with a central brain , a spinal cord , and nerves throughout the body . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> the amphibian brain is less well developed than that of reptiles , birds and mammals but is similar in morphology and function to that of a fish . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> it is believed amphibians are capable of perceiving pain . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> the brain consists of equal parts , cerebrum , midbrain and cerebellum . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> various parts of the cerebrum process sensory input , such as smell in the olfactory lobe and sight in the optic lobe , and it is additionally the centre of behaviour and learning . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> the cerebellum is the center of muscular coordination and the medulla oblongata controls some organ functions including heartbeat and respiration . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> the brain sends signals through the spinal cord and nerves to regulate activity in the rest of the body . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> the pineal body , known to regulate sleep patterns in humans , is thought to produce the hormones involved in hibernation and aestivation in amphibians . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> tadpoles retain the lateral line system of their ancestral fishes , but this is lost in terrestrial adult amphibians . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> some caecilians possess electroreceptors that allow them to locate objects around them when submerged in water . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> the ears are well developed in frogs . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> there is no external ear , but the large circular eardrum lies on the surface of the head just behind the eye . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> this vibrates and sound is transmitted through a single bone , the stapes , to the inner ear . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> only high frequency sounds like mating calls are heard in this way , but low frequency noises can be detected through another mechanism . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> there is a patch of specialized haircells , called papilla amphibiorum , in the inner ear capable of detecting deeper sounds . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> another feature , unique to frogs and salamanders , is the columella operculum complex adjoining the auditory capsule which is involved in the transmission of both airborne and seismic signals . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> the ears of salamanders and caecilians are less highly developed than those of frogs as they do not normally communicate with each other through the medium of sound . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> the eyes of tadpoles lack lids , but at metamorphosis , the cornea becomes more dome shaped , the lens becomes flatter , and eyelids and associated glands and ducts develop . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> the adult eyes are an improvement on invertebrate eyes and were a first step in the development of more advanced vertebrate eyes . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> they allow colour vision and depth of focus . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> in the retinas are green rods , which are receptive to a wide range of wavelengths . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> many amphibians catch their prey by flicking out an elongated tongue with a sticky tip and drawing it back into the mouth before seizing the item with their jaws . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> some use inertial feeding to help them swallow the prey , repeatedly thrusting their head forward sharply causing the food to move backwards in their mouth by inertia . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> most amphibians swallow their prey whole without much chewing so they possess voluminous stomachs . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> the short oesophagus is lined with cilia that help to move the food to the stomach and mucus produced by glands in the mouth and pharynx eases its passage . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> the enzyme chitinase produced in the stomach helps digest the chitinous cuticle of arthropod prey . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> amphibians possess a pancreas , liver and gall bladder . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> the liver is usually large with two lobes . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> its size is determined by its function as a glycogen and fat storage unit , and may change with the seasons as these reserves are built or used up . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> adipose tissue is another important means of storing energy and this occurs in the abdomen ( in internal structures called fat bodies ) , under the skin and , in some salamanders , in the tail . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> there are two kidneys located dorsally , near the roof of the body cavity . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> their job is to filter the blood of metabolic waste and transport the urine via ureters to the urinary bladder where it is stored before being passed out periodically through the cloacal vent . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> larvae and most aquatic adult amphibians excrete the nitrogen as ammonia in large quantities of dilute urine , while terrestrial species , with a greater need to conserve water , excrete the less toxic product urea . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> some tree frogs with limited access to water excrete most of their metabolic waste as uric acid . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> the lungs in amphibians are primitive compared to those of amniotes , possessing few internal septa and large alveoli , and consequently having a comparatively slow diffusion rate for oxygen entering the blood . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> ventilation is accomplished by buccal pumping . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> most amphibians , however , are able to exchange gases with the water or air via their skin . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> to enable sufficient cutaneous respiration , the surface of their highly vascularised skin must remain moist to allow the oxygen to diffuse at a sufficiently high rate . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> because oxygen concentration in the water increases at both low temperatures and high flow rates , aquatic amphibians in these situations can rely primarily on cutaneous respiration , as in the titicaca water frog and the hellbender salamander . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> in air , where oxygen is more concentrated , some small species can rely solely on cutaneous gas exchange , most famously the plethodontid salamanders , which have neither lungs nor gills . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> many aquatic salamanders and all tadpoles have gills in their larval stage , with some ( such as the axolotl ) retaining gills as aquatic adults . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> for the purpose of reproduction most amphibians require fresh water although some lay their eggs on land and have developed various means of keeping them moist . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> a few ( e . g . fejervarya raja ) can inhabit brackish water , but there are no true marine amphibians . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> there are reports , however , of particular amphibian populations unexpectedly invading marine waters . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> such was the case with the black sea invasion of the natural hybrid pelophylax esculentus reported in 2010 . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> several hundred frog species in adaptive radiations ( e . g . , eleutherodactylus , the pacific platymantis , the australo papuan microhylids , and many other tropical frogs ) , however , do not need any water for breeding in the wild . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> they reproduce via direct development , an ecological and evolutionary adaptation that has allowed them to be completely independent from free standing water . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> almost all of these frogs live in wet tropical rainforests and their eggs hatch directly into miniature versions of the adult , passing through the tadpole stage within the egg . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> reproductive success of many amphibians is dependent not only on the quantity of rainfall , but the seasonal timing . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> in the tropics , many amphibians breed continuously or at any time of year . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> in temperate regions , breeding is mostly seasonal , usually in the spring , and is triggered by increasing day length , rising temperatures or rainfall . <end>
<pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <pad> <start> experiments have shown the importance of temperature , but the trigger event , especially in arid regions , is often a storm . <end>
